original: @1b #// 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: @1b #// 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: The noble Great Parinirvāṇa Sūtra

original: bam po nyi shu dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po nyi shu dgu pa /
translated: Fascicle twenty-nine

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu snang ba mtho btsun dpal gyi rgyal pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu snang ba mtho btsun dpal gyi rgyal pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantaprabhāsa-udgata-śrī-rāja said to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /🔽ji ltar sbyin pa byin na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu @2a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das / ji ltar sbyin pa byin na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu @2a *//
translated: Bhagavān,

original: phyin pa zhes mi gdags /🔽ji ltar sbyin pa byin na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes mi gdags pa nas /
analyzed: phyin pa zhes mi gdags / ji ltar sbyin pa byin na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes mi gdags pa nas /
translated: how is it that when one gives a gift, it is not called the perfection of generosity?

original: shes rab kyi bar du ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes mi gdags pa dang / ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes gdags pas 'dogs par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gdags /
analyzed: shes rab kyi bar du ji ltar na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes mi gdags pa dang / ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes gdags pas 'dogs par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa zhes gdags /
translated: How is it that when one gives a gift, it is not called the perfection of generosity, and so forth up to how is it that when one has wisdom, it is not called the perfection of wisdom? How is it that by designating it as the perfection of wisdom, it is designated? How is it that nirvāṇa is designated?

original: ji ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bgyi /
translated: How is it called the great nirvāṇa?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @2b pos shin tu rgyas pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la rab tu nan tan byed pa na sbyin pa mi thos /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen @2b pos shin tu rgyas pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la rab tu nan tan byed pa na sbyin pa mi thos /
translated: When bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practice the Mahāparinirvāṇa of the extensive teachings, they do not hear giving,

original: sbyin pa mi mthong /
analyzed: sbyin pa mi mthong /
translated: do not see giving,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi thos /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi thos /
translated: do not hear the perfection of giving,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi mthong ba nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi mthong ba nas /
translated: do not see the perfection of giving, and so forth,

original: shes rab kyi bar du mi thos /
analyzed: shes rab kyi bar du mi thos /
translated: up to do not hear wisdom,

original: shes rab mi mthong /
analyzed: shes rab mi mthong /
translated: do not see wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi thos /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi thos /
translated: do not hear the perfection of wisdom,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi mthong /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi mthong /
translated: do not see the perfection of wisdom,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mi thos /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mi thos /
translated: do not hear nirvāṇa,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mi mthong /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mi mthong /
translated: do not see nirvāṇa,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po mi thos /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po mi thos /
translated: do not hear the great nirvāṇa,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po mi mthong ste; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa ni chos kyi dbyings su rtogs shing mthong ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po mi mthong ste; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa ni chos kyi dbyings su rtogs shing mthong ste /
translated: do not see the great nirvāṇa. Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practicing the great nirvāṇa realize and see the realm of phenomena.

original: yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa ci yang med pa 'dus pa med pa tshor ba dang rtogs pa med pa'i mtshan @3a *//
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa ci yang med pa 'dus pa med pa tshor ba dang rtogs pa med pa'i mtshan @3a *//
translated: The characteristics of reality are emptiness, non-existence, non-aggregation, and the absence of sensation and conceptualization.

original: nyid ji lta ba rtogs shing zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sgyu mas sprul pa lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang / smig rgyu lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / nam mkha' lta bu'i mtshan nyid rab tu thob bo //
analyzed: nyid ji lta ba rtogs shing zag pa med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bya ba med pa'i mtshan nyid dang / sgyu mas sprul pa lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang / smig rgyu lta bu'i mtshan nyid dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / nam mkha' lta bu'i mtshan nyid rab tu thob bo //
translated: They realize the characteristics of reality just as it is, the characteristics of the absence of defilements, the characteristics of the absence of action, the characteristics of magical emanations, the characteristics of mirages, the characteristics of the city of gandharvas, and the characteristics of space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe mtshan nyid de lta bu thob nas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug med pas mi thos mi mthong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe mtshan nyid de lta bu thob nas 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug med pas mi thos mi mthong ste /
translated: When bodhisattvas attain these characteristics, they are free from desire, anger, and ignorance, and so they neither hear nor see.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dag pa ji lta ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dag pa ji lta ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s characteristic of reality just as it is.

original: yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag sbyin pa ni 'di /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag sbyin pa ni 'di /
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who abide in the characteristic of reality give this,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di'o zhes rtogs pa nas /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'di'o zhes rtogs pa nas /
translated: The perfection of giving is this.

original: shes rab ni 'di /
analyzed: shes rab ni 'di /
translated: Wisdom is this.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du ni 'di /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du ni 'di /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is this.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'di /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'di /
translated: Nirvana is this.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni 'di'o zhes rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni 'di'o zhes rab tu rtogs so //
translated: Great nirvana is this.

original: @3b rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: @3b rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: ji ltar sbyin pa ni yin la pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyin pa ni yin la pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that giving is not a perfection?

original: gang slong ba mthong nas gzod byin pa ni sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang slong ba mthong nas gzod byin pa ni sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one sees a beggar and then gives, it is called giving,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not a perfection.

original: gang slong ba med bzhin du rang sbyin pa byin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang slong ba med bzhin du rang sbyin pa byin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one gives a gift without a beggar, it is called the perfection of giving.

original: gang dus dus su byin pa ni sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang dus dus su byin pa ni sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: When one gives at certain times, it is called giving,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: but it is not called a perfection.

original: gang rtag tu sbyin pa byin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang rtag tu sbyin pa byin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one gives a gift constantly, it is called the perfection of giving.

original: gang pha rol la sbyin pa byin nas phyir yang 'gyod pa'i sems skye ba ni sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang pha rol la sbyin pa byin nas phyir yang 'gyod pa'i sems skye ba ni sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Giving to others and then feeling regret is called “giving,”

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: but it is not called “perfection.”

original: gang sbyin pa byin nas mi 'gyod pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sbyin pa byin nas mi 'gyod pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Giving without regret is called “perfection of giving.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nor dang zang zing la rgyal po dang / chom po dang / chu dang / me lta bu'i 'jigs pa bzhi bskyed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos nor dang zang zing la rgyal po dang / chom po dang / chu dang / me lta bu'i 'jigs pa bzhi bskyed de /
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas should generate the four fears regarding wealth and material things, like a king, a thief, water, and fire.

original: rab tu dga' bas sbyin pa byin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bas sbyin pa byin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Giving with joy is called “perfection of giving.”

original: gang lan la re bas sbyin pa byin pa ni sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang lan la re bas sbyin pa byin pa ni sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Giving with the expectation of return is called “giving,”

original: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: but it is not called “perfection.”

original: sbyin pa byin pa'i lan la mi re ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa byin pa'i lan la mi re ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Not giving with the expectation of return is called “perfection of giving.”

original: gang 'jigs pa dang / rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / khyim gyi so tshis dang / rigs 'tshob pa dang / lhar skye ba dang / 'dod pa lnga dang / nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / bshes gnyen tshol ba dang /🔽lan la re ba'i phyir sbyin pa byin pa de ji ltar tshong spogs @4a *//
analyzed: gang 'jigs pa dang / rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / khyim gyi so tshis dang / rigs 'tshob pa dang / lhar skye ba dang / 'dod pa lnga dang / nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / bshes gnyen tshol ba dang / lan la re ba'i phyir sbyin pa byin pa de ji ltar tshong spogs @4a *//
translated: Those who give out of fear, or for the sake of gain, fame, household management, family lineage, rebirth as a god, the five desires, pride, great pride, seeking friends,

original: byed pa lta bu'am /🔽rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: byed pa lta bu'am / rigs kyi bu /
translated: or hoping for a reward, are like those who engage in trade.🔽Or like a person who plants trees for the sake of shade, flowers, fruits, timber, and so on.

original: ji ltar mis shing bskyed pa dag bsil grib dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / khang shing la sogs pa re ba dang 'dra bar gang gis de ltar sbyin pa byin na de ni sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mis shing bskyed pa dag bsil grib dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / khang shing la sogs pa re ba dang 'dra bar gang gis de ltar sbyin pa byin na de ni sbyin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: If one gives in this way, it is called generosity,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not a perfection.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa ni sbyin pa dang / len pa dang / nor gyi dngos por mi mthong /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa ni sbyin pa dang / len pa dang / nor gyi dngos por mi mthong /
translated: Son of noble family, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice in this way for great nirvāṇa, they do not see the giver, the recipient, or the entity of wealth.

original: dus kyang mi mthong /
analyzed: dus kyang mi mthong /
translated: They do not see time.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'ang mi mthong /
translated: They do not see merit or demerit.

original: rgyu mi mthong /
analyzed: rgyu mi mthong /
translated: They do not see causes.

original: rkyen mi mthong /
analyzed: rkyen mi mthong /
translated: They do not see conditions.

original: 'bras bu smin pa mi mthong /
analyzed: 'bras bu smin pa mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the ripening of results.

original: byed pa mi mthong /
analyzed: byed pa mi mthong /
translated: They do not see action.

original: len pa mi mthong /🔽mang po mi mthong /
analyzed: len pa mi mthong / mang po mi mthong /
translated: They do not see appropriation.🔽They do not see many.

original: nyung ngu mi mthong /
analyzed: nyung ngu mi mthong /
translated: They do not see few.

original: gtsang ba mi mthong /
analyzed: gtsang ba mi mthong /
translated: They do not see pure.

original: mi gtsang ba mi mthong len pa dang bdag dang zang zing la mi smod /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba mi mthong len pa dang bdag dang zang zing la mi smod /
translated: They do not see impure. They do not disparage appropriation, self, or material things.

original: mthong ba'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: mthong ba'ang mi mthong /
translated: They do not see seeing.

original: mi mthong ba'ang mi mthong /
analyzed: mi mthong ba'ang mi mthong /
translated: They do not see not seeing.

original: bdag dang gzhan du mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du mi 'dzin te /
translated: They do not grasp self and other.🔽They give gifts for the sake of the very extensive Dharma of the constant abiding of great nirvana,

original: shin tu rgyas pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po rtag tu gnas pa'i chos kyi phyir sbyin pa byin pa dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir sbyin pa byin pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa yongs su gcad pa'i phyir sbyin pa byin pa dang /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa mya ngan las 'das pa chen po rtag tu gnas pa'i chos kyi phyir sbyin pa byin pa dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir sbyin pa byin pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa yongs su gcad pa'i phyir sbyin pa byin pa dang /
translated: they give gifts for the sake of the benefit and happiness of all sentient beings, they give gifts for the sake of cutting through the afflictions of all sentient beings,

original: sems can thams cad kyis sbyin pa dang / len pa dang / nor gyi dngos por mi mthong bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa byin pa la nan tan @4b byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis sbyin pa dang / len pa dang / nor gyi dngos por mi mthong bar bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa byin pa la nan tan @4b byed do //
translated: He practices giving in order that all sentient beings may not see giving, receiving, and the thing given.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Good son,

original: dper na / mi zhig rgya mtshor ltung ba las mi ro la 'jus na rgya mtsho las thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig rgya mtshor ltung ba las mi ro la 'jus na rgya mtsho las thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it is like a man who falls into the ocean and grasps a corpse. He will be able to get out of the ocean.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed na sbyin pa spyod pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed na sbyin pa spyod pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: If a bodhisattva-mahasattva practices the Mahayana, his practice of giving is like this.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Good son,

original: dper na / khri mun zab mo dag zhag shin tu che ba zhig tu mi zhig bcug na gzhan nas thar ba'i sa med la /
analyzed: dper na / khri mun zab mo dag zhag shin tu che ba zhig tu mi zhig bcug na gzhan nas thar ba'i sa med la /
translated: it is like a man who is locked in a deep, dark prison. He has no way to escape.

original: bshad gci'i khung bu gcig cig yod de /
analyzed: bshad gci'i khung bu gcig cig yod de /
translated: But there is a small hole in the wall,

original: de nas phyir byung na thogs pa med pa'i gnas su phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas phyir byung na thogs pa med pa'i gnas su phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and if he comes out through it, he will reach a place of no obstruction.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa na /
translated: If a bodhisattva-mahasattva practices the Mahayana,

original: sbyin pa byin pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa byin pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Giving is also like this.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: dper na / cho rigs btsun pa zhig 'jigs skrag nas mgon skyabs med na rigs ngan gdol pa la brten cing skyabs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: dper na / cho rigs btsun pa zhig 'jigs skrag nas mgon skyabs med na rigs ngan gdol pa la brten cing skyabs su 'gro'o //
translated: it is like a person of high social standing who, in fear and without any other recourse, would rely on and take refuge in a low-caste outcaste.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa na sbyin pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa na sbyin pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: When the bodhisattva-mahasattva practices the Great Nirvana Sutra, giving is also like this.

original: rigs kyi bu; dper na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; dper na /
translated: Good son,

original: nad pa zhig nad kyi sdug bsngal bsal zhing bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir mi gtsang ba za ba bzhin du /
analyzed: nad pa zhig nad kyi sdug bsngal bsal zhing bde ba thob par bya ba'i phyir mi gtsang ba za ba bzhin du /
translated: it is like a sick person who eats impure food in order to be cured of his illness and to obtain comfort.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa na sbyin pa byin pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa na sbyin pa byin pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: When the bodhisattva-mahasattva practices the Great Nirvana Sutra, giving is also like this.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: dper na / bram ze zhig srog gi phyir nas 'bras shin tu dkon pa na khyi sha za ba bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na / bram ze zhig srog gi phyir nas 'bras shin tu dkon pa na khyi sha za ba bzhin du /
translated: it is like a brahmin who, for the sake of his life, eats dog meat when rice and gruel are very scarce.

original: @5a *// byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa na sbyin pa byin pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: @5a *// byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa na sbyin pa byin pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices the Great Nirvana is also like this when he gives.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i nang na de lta bu'i dngos po bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du ma thos pa thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i nang na de lta bu'i dngos po bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du ma thos pa thos pa dang / tshul khrims dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nas /
translated: In the Great Nirvana there are such things that have not been heard for immeasurable eons, such as the teaching of morality and the perfection of morality,

original: shes rab dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du ston pa ji ltar sangs rgyas me tog sna tshogs kyi mdo las rgyas par 'chad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: shes rab dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du ston pa ji ltar sangs rgyas me tog sna tshogs kyi mdo las rgyas par 'chad pa bzhin no //
translated: up to the teaching of wisdom and the perfection of wisdom, just as it is explained in detail in the Sūtra of Various Flowers of the Buddha.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa na ma thos pa thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa na ma thos pa thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices the Great Nirvana attain what has not been heard?

original: mdo sde sde bcu gnyis kyi don shin tu zab mo sngon ma thos pa mdo sde 'di'i rkyen gyis yongs su thos par gyur to //
analyzed: mdo sde sde bcu gnyis kyi don shin tu zab mo sngon ma thos pa mdo sde 'di'i rkyen gyis yongs su thos par gyur to //
translated: The profound meaning of the twelve divisions of the sutras, which they had never heard before, they now hear in their entirety because of this sutra.

original: sngon cung zad yod pa'ang ming tsam thos te /
analyzed: sngon cung zad yod pa'ang ming tsam thos te /
translated: In the past, they heard only the names of a few of the sutras.

original: da mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di las gdod don thos par gyur to //
analyzed: da mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di las gdod don thos par gyur to //
translated: Now, for the first time, they hear the meaning of the Mahayana sutras.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni mdo sde sde bcu gnyis kyi ming 'ba' zhig thos kyi don mi thos so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni mdo sde sde bcu gnyis kyi ming 'ba' zhig thos kyi don mi thos so //
translated: The sravakas and pratyekabuddhas hear only the names of the twelve divisions of the sutras and do not hear their meaning.

original: da mdo sde 'di las yongs su rdzogs par thos par gyur pas ma thos pa thos pa zhes bya'o; ;rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: da mdo sde 'di las yongs su rdzogs par thos par gyur pas ma thos pa thos pa zhes bya'o; ;rigs kyi bu /
translated: Now, because they hear them in their entirety in this sutra, it is called the hearing of what was not heard before.🔽“Good son,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mdo sde las sangs rgyas rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa dang / mthar 'gog pa @5b pa ma yin pa dang / dkon mchog gsum dang / sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin khyad par gyi mtshan nyid med pa dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mdo sde las sangs rgyas rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa dang / mthar 'gog pa @5b pa ma yin pa dang / dkon mchog gsum dang / sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin khyad par gyi mtshan nyid med pa dang /
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have heard from the sūtras that the Buddha is permanent, blissful, self, and pure, that he is not ultimately in cessation, that the Three Jewels and the Buddha-nature are without the characteristics of distinction,

original: rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde la skur ba dang / mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba byas pa dang / log sred can thams cad la'ang sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes de ring mdo sde 'di las thos par gyur pas ma thos pa thos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde la skur ba dang / mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba byas pa dang / log sred can thams cad la'ang sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod do zhes de ring mdo sde 'di las thos par gyur pas ma thos pa thos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and that all those who have violated the four root precepts, who have slandered the Vaipulya Sūtras, who have committed the five heinous crimes, and who have wrong views have the Buddha-nature. Having heard this today from this sūtra, it is called ‘hearing what has not been heard.’

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu snang ba mtho ba btsun dpal gyi rgyal pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu snang ba mtho ba btsun dpal gyi rgyal pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantaprabhāsa-udgata-śrī-rāja said to the Bhagavān:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Bhagavān,

original: rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde la skur pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba bgyis pa dang / log sred can la sogs pa la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis na de dag ci ste yang sems can dmyal bar ltung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde la skur pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba bgyis pa dang / log sred can la sogs pa la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis na de dag ci ste yang sems can dmyal bar ltung bar 'gyur /
translated: If those who have violated the four root precepts, those who have slandered the Vaipulya sutras, those who have committed the five heinous crimes, and those who have cut off their roots of virtue and so on, all possess buddha-nature, why is it that they fall into the hells?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavat,

original: gal te de dag la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis na'ang ci'i slad du rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa ma mchis zhes gsungs /
analyzed: gal te de dag la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mchis na'ang ci'i slad du rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa ma mchis zhes gsungs /
translated: if they possess buddha-nature, why did you say that it is not permanent, blissful, self, or pure?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavat,

original: gang dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bcad pa de la log sred can zhes bgyi na; dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bcad pa de la log sred can zhes bgyi na; dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad pa'i tshe /
translated: if those who have cut off their roots of virtue are called those who have cut off their roots of virtue, when they have cut off their roots of virtue,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ci'i slad du ma bcad /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ci'i slad du ma bcad /
translated: why is it that their buddha-nature is not cut off?

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ci ste bcad na ci'i slad du rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag @6a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ci ste bcad na ci'i slad du rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag @6a *//
translated: If the buddha-nature is cut off, why did you say that it is permanent, blissful, self, and pure?

original: dang yongs su dag pa'o zhes gsungs /
analyzed: dang yongs su dag pa'o zhes gsungs /
translated: and the purity of the basis.

original: de ste ma bcad pa zhig lags na ci'i slad du log sred can zhes gdags /
analyzed: de ste ma bcad pa zhig lags na ci'i slad du log sred can zhes gdags /
translated: If it is not cut off, why is it called ‘one with perverted craving’?

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa ni ma nges pa zhes bgyi'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa ni ma nges pa zhes bgyi'o //
translated: the one who has damaged the four roots is called ‘indeterminate.’

original: shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde la skur ba dang / mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba bgyis pa dang / log sred can yang ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde la skur ba dang / mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba bgyis pa dang / log sred can yang ma nges pa'o //
translated: The one who has reviled the Vaipulya sūtras, committed the five heinous sins, and is one with perverted craving is also indeterminate.

original: gal te de dag nges pa zhig lags na ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de dag nges pa zhig lags na ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur /
translated: If they were determinate, how could they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du'ang ma nges pa'o; ;gal te rgyun du zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du nges pa lags na /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du'ang ma nges pa'o; ;gal te rgyun du zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du nges pa lags na /
translated: Even the stream-enterers up to the pratyekabuddhas are indeterminate. If the stream-enterers up to the pratyekabuddhas were determinate,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i yang mi rigs so; ;bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas pa'i yang mi rigs so; ;bcom ldan 'das /
translated: it would not be reasonable for them to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. Blessed One,

original: gal te rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa ma nges pa lags na /
analyzed: gal te rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa ma nges pa lags na /
translated: If the four roots are not definite,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du'ang ma nges so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du'ang ma nges so //
translated: then stream-enterers up to pratyekabuddhas are also not definite.

original: de ltar de dag ma nges na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang ma nges so //
analyzed: de ltar de dag ma nges na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyang ma nges so //
translated: If those are not definite, then even the Bhagavān Buddha is not definite.

original: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ma nges na mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma nges te /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ma nges na mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma nges te /
translated: If the Bhagavān Buddha is not definite, then the nature of nirvāṇa is also not definite,

original: chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang ma nges so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bar du'ang ma nges so //
translated: and all phenomena are also not definite.

original: ji ltar de ma nges she na /
analyzed: ji ltar de ma nges she na /
translated: How are they not definite?

original: gal te log sred can dag log sred can gyi las spangs pas mngon par 'tshang rgya na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang de ltar @6b yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas slar yang byung ste /
analyzed: gal te log sred can dag log sred can gyi las spangs pas mngon par 'tshang rgya na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang de ltar @6b yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas slar yang byung ste /
translated: If those with wrong views attain manifest complete buddhahood by abandoning the karma of those with wrong views, then the Bhagavān Buddhas, having passed into parinirvāṇa in that way, would arise again

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'jug pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'jug pa'i rigs so //
translated: and it would not be right that they would not enter parinirvāṇa.

original: gal te de lta bu lags na mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yang ma nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta bu lags na mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yang ma nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then the nature of nirvāṇa would also be indefinite.

original: de ltar ma nges pas na rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa ma mchis par rig na /
analyzed: de ltar ma nges pas na rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa ma mchis par rig na /
translated: Since it is not so determined, it is known to be without permanence, bliss, self, and purity.

original: ci'i slad du log sred can dag la sogs pa mya ngan las 'da' ba thob par 'gyur zhes gsungs /
analyzed: ci'i slad du log sred can dag la sogs pa mya ngan las 'da' ba thob par 'gyur zhes gsungs /
translated: Why is it that those with perverted desires and so forth attain nirvāṇa?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu snang ba mtho btsun dpal gyi rgyal po la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu snang ba mtho btsun dpal gyi rgyal po la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantaprabhāsa-udāraśrī-rāja:

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: Excellent, excellent!

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis sems can tshad med pa snyed la phan pa dang bde ba'i don gyi phyir 'jig rten la byams shing snying brtse ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dag gong nas gong du 'phar bar bya ba'i phyir de lta bu dag dris pa legs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis sems can tshad med pa snyed la phan pa dang bde ba'i don gyi phyir 'jig rten la byams shing snying brtse ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dag gong nas gong du 'phar bar bya ba'i phyir de lta bu dag dris pa legs so //
translated: Son of good family, for the sake of benefiting and bringing happiness to immeasurable sentient beings, out of love and compassion for the world, and in order to generate the mind of enlightenment, you have asked such questions in order to make the bodhisattvas progress higher and higher.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod ni sngon 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byas shing sangs rgyas de dag las dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskrun pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod ni sngon 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das tshad med pa rnams la bsnyen bkur byas shing sangs rgyas de dag las dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams bskrun pa'o //
translated: “Son of good family, you have served immeasurable, countless, and limitless bhagavat buddhas of the past and have planted roots of virtue with those buddhas.

original: yun ring po nas byang chub kyi yon tan sgrub cing bdud kyi 'khor bcom nas rnam par bshig pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring po nas byang chub kyi yon tan sgrub cing bdud kyi 'khor bcom nas rnam par bshig pa'o //
translated: For a long time you have cultivated the qualities of enlightenment and have destroyed and annihilated the māras.

original: sems can tshad med mtha' yas pa snyed kyi don byas nas thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bkod pa'o //
analyzed: sems can tshad med mtha' yas pa snyed kyi don byas nas thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la bkod pa'o //
translated: You have benefited immeasurable and limitless sentient beings and have established them all in unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: @7a *// yun ring po nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po shin tu zab mo rtogs pa'o //🔽'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma tshad med pa /
analyzed: @7a *// yun ring po nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po shin tu zab mo rtogs pa'o // 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma tshad med pa /
translated: For a long time you have realized the extremely profound essence of the tathāgatas’ teachings.

original: mtha' yas pa snyed la shin tu zab mo'i don dam pa 'di dag zhus te /
analyzed: mtha' yas pa snyed la shin tu zab mo'i don dam pa 'di dag zhus te /
translated: You have asked the bhagavat buddhas of the past, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, about the extremely profound ultimate.

original: ngas 'jig rten thams cad na lha'am /
analyzed: ngas 'jig rten thams cad na lha'am /
translated: I have not seen anyone in all the worlds, whether gods or humans,

original: mi'am / dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: mi'am / dge sbyong ngam /
translated: a śramaṇa,

original: bram ze'am / bdud dam /
analyzed: bram ze'am / bdud dam /
translated: a brāhmaṇa, a māra,

original: tshangs pa la sogs pa gang gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la don 'di dag zhu ba gcig kyang ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pa gang gis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa la don 'di dag zhu ba gcig kyang ma mthong ngo //
translated: a Brahmā, or anyone else, who has asked the Tathāgata about these matters.

original: da khyod kyis rab tu yid la byas te shin tu brtags par nyon cig dang ngas rnam par phye ste bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: da khyod kyis rab tu yid la byas te shin tu brtags par nyon cig dang ngas rnam par phye ste bstan par bya'o //
translated: Now, you should pay close attention and listen carefully as I explain and analyze them for you.

original: rigs kyi bu //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu //
translated: Son of good family!

original: log sred can ni nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: log sred can ni nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Those with wrong views are not fixed.

original: gal te nges pa zhig yin na log sreng can des nam yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nges pa zhig yin na log sreng can des nam yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were fixed, those with wrong views would never attain unsurpassed perfect awakening.

original: ma nges pa'i phyir thob pa yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir thob pa yin te /
translated: Because they are not fixed, they can attain it.🔽Therefore, if the buddha-nature is uncut, why are they called those with wrong views?

original: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma bcad na ci'i phyir log sred can zhes bya; dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ma bcad na ci'i phyir log sred can zhes bya; dge ba'i rtsa ba bcad pa ni /
translated: Cutting off the roots of goodness,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: son of good family!

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The roots of goodness are of two kinds:

original: nang dang / phyi rol lo //
analyzed: nang dang / phyi rol lo //
translated: inner and outer.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni nang ma yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni nang ma yin //
translated: The nature of the Buddha is not internal.

original: phyi rol ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol ma yin te /
translated: It is not external.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni ma bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni ma bcad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the Buddha is not cut off.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “ There are two other aspects:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: that which is defiled and that which is undefiled.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni zag pa dang bcas pa ma @7b yin; zag pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni zag pa dang bcas pa ma @7b yin; zag pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: The nature of the Buddha is not defiled and is not undefiled.

original: de bas na ma bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na ma bcad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not cut off.

original: yang rnam par gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam par gnyis te /
translated: “ There are two other aspects:

original: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'o //
translated: that which is permanent and that which is impermanent.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni rtag pa ma yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin ni rtag pa ma yin //
translated: The nature of the Buddha is not permanent.

original: mi rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not impermanent.

original: de bas na ma bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na ma bcad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not cut off.

original: gal te bcad pa yin na phyir yang thob par rigs so //
analyzed: gal te bcad pa yin na phyir yang thob par rigs so //
translated: If it were cut off, it would be reasonable to obtain it again.

original: phyir mi thob na ma bcad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyir mi thob na ma bcad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: If it could not be obtained again, it would not be called cut off.

original: gang bcad nas thob pa ni log sred can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang bcad nas thob pa ni log sred can zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is obtained after being cut off is called ‘the one with perverted craving.’

original: rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa'ang ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa'ang ma nges pa'o //
translated: The one who destroys the four roots is also not definite.

original: gal te nges pa zhig yin na rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa dag nam yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nges pa zhig yin na rtsa ba bzhi nyams pa dag nam yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were certain, those who have violated the four basic precepts would never attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde la skur ba'ang ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde la skur ba'ang ma nges pa'o //
translated: Denigrating the Vaipulya sūtras is also uncertain.

original: gal te nges pa zhig na dam pa'i chos la skur ba dag nam yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nges pa zhig na dam pa'i chos la skur ba dag nam yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were certain, those who have denigrated the true Dharma would never attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba byas pa'ang ma nges pa'o /
analyzed: mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba byas pa'ang ma nges pa'o /
translated: Even committing the five heinous acts is uncertain.

original: gal te nges pa zhig yin na mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dag nam yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te nges pa zhig yin na mtshams med pa lnga byas pa dag nam yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were certain, those who have committed the five heinous acts would never attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: gzugs dang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gnyi ga ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid gnyi ga ma nges pa'o //
translated: Both form and the characteristics of form are uncertain.

original: dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i mtshan nyid dang / skye ba'i mtshan nyid nas ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bar dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi mtshan nyid dang / srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga dang / skye ba bzhi dang /
analyzed: dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i mtshan nyid dang / skye ba'i mtshan nyid nas ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bar dang / phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched kyi mtshan nyid dang / srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga dang / skye ba bzhi dang /
translated: the characteristics of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, the characteristics of smell, taste, and tactility, the characteristics of birth up to the characteristics of ignorance, the characteristics of the aggregates, elements, and sense sources, the twenty-five existences, the four types of birth,

original: chos thams cad kyi bar du thams cad ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi bar du thams cad ma nges pa'o //
translated: and all phenomena are indeterminate.

original: rigs kyi bu //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu //
