translated: He is not existent.🔽He is not nonexistent.

original: med pa ma yin pa ma yin //
analyzed: med pa ma yin pa ma yin //
translated: He is not non-existent.

original: brjod pa ma yin //
analyzed: brjod pa ma yin //
translated: He is not expressible.

original: mi brjod pa ma yin //🔽de bzhing shegs pa ma yin //
analyzed: mi brjod pa ma yin // de bzhing shegs pa ma yin //
translated: He is not inexpressible.🔽He is not a Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa ma yin te /
translated: He is not a non-Tathāgata.

original: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni ma nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is indeterminate.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten gyi lha zhes mi gdags she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten gyi lha zhes mi gdags she na /
translated: why is the Tathāgata not called a worldly god?

original: 'jig rten gyi lha ni rgyal po rnams te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi lha ni rgyal po rnams te /
translated: Worldly gods are kings,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yun ring po nas bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du rgyal po'i thabs btang bas de bas na rgyal po ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yun ring po nas bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du rgyal po'i thabs btang bas de bas na rgyal po ma yin no //
translated: but the Tathāgata, for a long time—for countless eons—has given up the position of king, and therefore is not a king.

original: rgyal po ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa grong khyer ser skyar rgyal po zas gtsang ma'i khab tu skyes pas de bas na rgyal po ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyal po ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa grong khyer ser skyar rgyal po zas gtsang ma'i khab tu skyes pas de bas na rgyal po ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: He is not a non-king, because the Tathāgata was born in the city of Kapilavastu in the palace of King Śuddhodana, and therefore is not a non-king.

original: skye ba'i lha ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa yun ring po nas srid pa rnams dang bral bas de bas na skye ba'i lha ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i lha ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa yun ring po nas srid pa rnams dang bral bas de bas na skye ba'i lha ma yin no //
translated: The non-divine of birth means that the Tathāgata has long been free from existence, and therefore he is the non-divine of birth.

original: skye ba'i lha ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni dga' ldan gnam nas dzambu'i gling du babs pas de bas @11a *//
analyzed: skye ba'i lha ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni dga' ldan gnam nas dzambu'i gling du babs pas de bas @11a *//
translated: The non-non-divine of birth means that he descended from Tuṣita Heaven to Jambudvīpa,

original: na de bzhin gshegs pa ni skye ba'i lha ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: na de bzhin gshegs pa ni skye ba'i lha ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: and therefore the Tathāgata is also not the non-non-divine of birth.

original: rnam par dag pa'i lha ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rgyun du zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i lha ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rgyun du zhugs pa nas rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du ma yin te /
translated: The pure divine means that the Tathāgata is not a stream-enterer up to a pratyekabuddha,

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par dag pa'i lha ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par dag pa'i lha ma yin no //
translated: and therefore the Tathāgata is the pure divine.

original: rnam par dag pa'i lha ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis mi gos te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i lha ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis mi gos te /
translated: The non-pure divine means that he is not tainted by the eight worldly dharmas,🔽and therefore the Tathāgata is the non-pure divine.

original: ji ltar padmo la chu dang rdul gyis mi gos pa dang 'dra bas de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par dag pa'i lha ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar padmo la chu dang rdul gyis mi gos pa dang 'dra bas de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam par dag pa'i lha ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as a lotus is not soiled by water or mud, so the Tathāgata is not soiled by non-gods.

original: don gyi lha ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa ma yin te /
analyzed: don gyi lha ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa ma yin te /
translated: As for the phrase “not a non-god in the sense of meaning,” the Tathāgata is not a bodhisattva on the tenth stage.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni don gyi lha ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni don gyi lha ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the Tathāgata is not a non-god in the sense of meaning.

original: don gyi lha ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu stong pa rnam pa bco brgyad la nan tan mdzad pas de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni don gyi lha ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyi lha ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu stong pa rnam pa bco brgyad la nan tan mdzad pas de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni don gyi lha ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: As for the phrase “not a non-god in the sense of reality,” the Tathāgata always practices the eighteen kinds of emptiness. Therefore the Tathāgata is not a non-god in the sense of reality.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa yun ring po bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du mi'i srid pa yongs su spangs pas de bas na mi ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa yun ring po bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du mi'i srid pa yongs su spangs pas de bas na mi ma yin no //
translated: As for the phrase “not a human,” the Tathāgata has long ago, for immeasurable eons, abandoned human existence. Therefore he is not a human.

original: mi ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni grong khyer ser skyar skyes pas de bas na mi ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni grong khyer ser skyar skyes pas de bas na mi ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: He is not a non-human being, because he was born in the city of Kapilavastu.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa srin po ma yin zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la mi 'tshe ba'i @11b phyir de bas na srin po ma yin no /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa srin po ma yin zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la mi 'tshe ba'i @11b phyir de bas na srin po ma yin no /
translated: He is not a rakshasa, because he does not harm any living being.🔽He is not a non-rakshasa, because he manifests in the form of a rakshasa in order to tame living beings.

original: srin po ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni srin po'i gzugs lta bur sprul zhing sems can dag 'dul te /🔽de bas na srin po ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: srin po ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni srin po'i gzugs lta bur sprul zhing sems can dag 'dul te / de bas na srin po ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: He is not a non-rakshasa, because he manifests in the form of a rakshasa in order to tame living beings.

original: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is the Tathagata not a hell being, an animal, or a hungry ghost?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yun ring po nas ngan par lta ba rnams spangs pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yun ring po nas ngan par lta ba rnams spangs pas /
translated: The Tathagata has abandoned wrong views for a long time.

original: de bas na sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is not a hell being, an animal, or a hungry ghost.

original: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gdul ba'i phyir ngan song gsum du'ang mngon du gshegs te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas sems can gdul ba'i phyir ngan song gsum du'ang mngon du gshegs te /
translated: “Not a hell being, animal, or hungry ghost” means that the Tathāgata, in order to tame sentient beings, manifests in the three lower realms.

original: de bas na sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi dvags ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is not a hell being, animal, or hungry ghost.

original: sems can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas sems can gyi rang bzhin spangs pas de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas sems can gyi rang bzhin spangs pas de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can ma yin no //
translated: “Not a sentient being” means that for a long time he has abandoned the nature of a sentient being. Therefore, the Tathāgata is not a sentient being.

original: sems can ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni ched 'ga' ched 'gra'i dus na sems can gyi mtshan nyid kyang gsung bas de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni ched 'ga' ched 'gra'i dus na sems can gyi mtshan nyid kyang gsung bas de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni sems can ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: “Not not a sentient being” means that at times he teaches the characteristics of a sentient being. Therefore, the Tathāgata is not not a sentient being.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni so so nas tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yod la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa chos ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni so so nas tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yod la /
translated: “The Tathāgata is not a phenomenon” means that all phenomena have the characteristic of being individually distinct.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata is not like that.

original: mtshan nyid gcig tu zad pas de bas na @12a *//
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig tu zad pas de bas na @12a *//
translated: He is exhausted in a single characteristic. Therefore,

original: chos ma yin no //
analyzed: chos ma yin no //
translated: he is not a phenomenon.

original: chos ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings yin te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings yin te /
translated: “He is not a non-phenomenon” means that the Tathāgata is the realm of phenomena.

original: de bas na chos ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na chos ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is not a non-phenomenon.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi skye mched rnam pa bcu la ma gtogs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi skye mched rnam pa bcu la ma gtogs te /
translated: “The Tathāgata is not form” means that he is not included in the ten aspects of the form aggregate.

original: de bas na gzugs ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is not form.

original: gzugs ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni sku la mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu mnga' bas de bas na gzugs ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni sku la mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu mnga' bas de bas na gzugs ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: “He is not a non-form” means that he possesses the thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks of excellence on his body. Therefore, he is not a non-form.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ring po ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs thams cad yongs su bcad pas de bas na ring po ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ring po ma yin zhes bya ba ni gzugs thams cad yongs su bcad pas de bas na ring po ma yin no //
translated: “The Tathāgata is not long” means that he is not long because all forms are eliminated.

original: ring po ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis spyi gtsug gi mtshan mi mthong bas de bas na ring po ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: ring po ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis spyi gtsug gi mtshan mi mthong bas de bas na ring po ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: He is not tall, because the crown of his head is not seen by the whole world.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thung ngu ma yin zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas nga rgyal dang dregs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pas de bas na thung ngu ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thung ngu ma yin zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas nga rgyal dang dregs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pas de bas na thung ngu ma yin no //
translated: He is not short, because he has long since abandoned the defilement of pride and arrogance.

original: thung ngu ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag ku shi la zhes pa la sku mtho gsum pa bstan pas de bas na thung ngu ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: thung ngu ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag ku shi la zhes pa la sku mtho gsum pa bstan pas de bas na thung ngu ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: He is not not short, because he has shown himself to the householder Kuśīla as three cubits in height.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas mtshan nyid rnams dang bral bas de bas na mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni yun ring po nas mtshan nyid rnams dang bral bas de bas na mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: He is not a characteristic, because he has long since been free of characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid thams cad @12b la mkhas shing rtogs pa'i phyir de bas na mtshan nyid ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid thams cad @12b la mkhas shing rtogs pa'i phyir de bas na mtshan nyid ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: And it is not a non-characteristic, because it is skilled in and understands all characteristics.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin pas de bas na sems ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sems ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin pas de bas na sems ma yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is not mind, because he has the characteristic of space.

original: sems ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni stobs bcu'i chos kyi sems mnga' ba dang / gzhan gyi sems kyang mkhyen pas de bas na sems ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sems ma yin pa'ang ma yin zhes bya ba ni stobs bcu'i chos kyi sems mnga' ba dang / gzhan gyi sems kyang mkhyen pas de bas na sems ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And he is not a non-mind, because he has the mind of the Dharma of the ten powers, and because he knows the minds of others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dus byas ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pas de bas na 'dus byas ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'dus byas ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pas de bas na 'dus byas ma yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is not conditioned, because he is permanent, blissful, self, and pure.

original: 'dus ma byas ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'ong ba dang / song ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba yod do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'ong ba dang / song ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba yod do //
translated: And he is not unconditioned, because he has coming, going, sitting, and lying down.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'ang bstan pas de bas na 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'ang bstan pas de bas na 'dus ma byas ma yin no //
translated: Since he also demonstrates complete nirvana, he is not unconditioned.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sku yan lag dang bcas pa'i phyir de bas na rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni sku yan lag dang bcas pa'i phyir de bas na rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: “The Tathāgata is not permanent” means that he is not permanent because he has a body with limbs.

original: rtag pa ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ma yin pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni shes pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He is not impermanent” means that he is not impermanent because he has knowledge.

original: rtag pa'i chos ni shes pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa'i chos ni shes pa med pa ste /
translated: A permanent phenomenon is without knowledge.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like space.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni shes pa dang bcas pas de bas na rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni shes pa dang bcas pas de bas na rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata has knowledge, and therefore he is not permanent.

original: ji ltar rtag pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is he not impermanent?

original: tshig tu smra ba yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshig tu smra ba yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he speaks in words.

original: rtag pa'i chos ni tshig tu smra ba med pas nam mkha' dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rtag pa'i chos ni tshig tu smra ba med pas nam mkha' dang 'dra'o //
translated: A permanent phenomenon does not speak in words, and is like space.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni tshig tu smra ba dang bcas pas de bas na rtag pa ma yin no //🔽rus dang rigs yod pa'i phyir mi @13a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni tshig tu smra ba dang bcas pas de bas na rtag pa ma yin no // rus dang rigs yod pa'i phyir mi @13a *//
translated: The Tathāgata speaks in words, and therefore he is not permanent.

original: rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “impermanent” because he has bones and a family.

original: rus dang rigs med pa ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rus dang rigs med pa ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The absence of a clan or family is called “permanent.”

original: nam mkha' ni rtag pa yin pas rus med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rtag pa yin pas rus med do //
translated: Space is permanent and has no clan.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rus dang rigs su bcas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rus dang rigs su bcas te /
translated: The Tathāgata has a clan and family.

original: goo ta ma'i rigs yin pas de bas na mi rtag go /
analyzed: goo ta ma'i rigs yin pas de bas na mi rtag go /
translated: He is of the Gautama family, and therefore he is impermanent.

original: pha ma dang bcas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha ma dang bcas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he has a father and mother, he is called “impermanent.”

original: pha ma med pa ni rtag pa zhes gdags te /
analyzed: pha ma med pa ni rtag pa zhes gdags te /
translated: The absence of a father and mother is called “permanent.”

original: nam mkha' ni rtag pa'i phyir pha dang ma med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rtag pa'i phyir pha dang ma med do //
translated: Space is permanent and has no father and mother.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni pha dang ma yod pas de bas na mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni pha dang ma yod pas de bas na mi rtag pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata has a father and mother, and therefore he is impermanent.

original: spyod lam bzhi dang bcas pas mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi dang bcas pas mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he has the four modes of behavior, he is called “impermanent.”

original: spyod lam bzhi med pa ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi med pa ni rtag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The absence of the four modes of behavior is called “permanent.”

original: nam mkha' ni rtag pa yin pas spyod lam bzhi med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rtag pa yin pas spyod lam bzhi med do //
translated: Space is permanent and has no four modes of behavior.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni spyod lam bzhi dang bcas pas de bas na mi rtag go /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni spyod lam bzhi dang bcas pas de bas na mi rtag go /
translated: The Tathāgata has the four modes of behavior, and therefore he is impermanent.

original: rtag tu gnas pa'i chos ni gnas dang phyogs med do //
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa'i chos ni gnas dang phyogs med do //
translated: A dharma that always abides has no location or direction.

original: nam mkha' ni rtag pa yin pas gnas dang phyogs med de /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rtag pa yin pas gnas dang phyogs med de /
translated: Space is permanent, so it has no location or direction.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yul shar phyogs su byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yul shar phyogs su byung ste /
translated: The Tathāgata appears in the eastern region.

original: yul mnyan du yod pa dang / rgyal po'i khab na gnas pas de bas na mi rtag go /
analyzed: yul mnyan du yod pa dang / rgyal po'i khab na gnas pas de bas na mi rtag go /
translated: He abides in Śrāvastī and Rājagṛha, so he is impermanent.

original: don de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa ma yin no //
translated: For this reason, the Tathāgata is not permanent.

original: mi rtag pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni skye ba yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni skye ba yongs su bcad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is not impermanent means that he has eliminated birth.

original: gang skye ba dang bcas pa'i chos ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang skye ba dang bcas pa'i chos ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: A dharma that has birth is called impermanent.

original: gang skye ba med pa'i chos ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: gang skye ba med pa'i chos ni rtag pa'o //
translated: A dharma that has no birth is permanent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang skye ba med pas na rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang skye ba med pas na rtag pa'o //
translated: The Tathāgata has no birth, so he is permanent.

original: @13b rtag pa'i chos ni rigs med pa ste /
analyzed: @13b rtag pa'i chos ni rigs med pa ste /
translated: A permanent dharma has no lineage.

original: gang rigs dang bcas pa'i chos ni mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang rigs dang bcas pa'i chos ni mi rtag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: A dharma that has a lineage is called impermanent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni skye ba med pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni skye ba med pa /
translated: The Tathāgata has no birth.

original: rigs med pa ste /
analyzed: rigs med pa ste /
translated: He has no lineage.

original: skye ba dang rigs med pas na rtag pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rigs med pas na rtag pa'o //
translated: Because he has no birth and no lineage, he is permanent.

original: rtag pa'i chos ni thams cad kun tu khyab ste /
analyzed: rtag pa'i chos ni thams cad kun tu khyab ste /
translated: The Dharma of permanence pervades everywhere.

original: ji ltar na mkha' gnas kun tu khyab pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar na mkha' gnas kun tu khyab pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as space pervades everywhere,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra bar kun tu khyab pas rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra bar kun tu khyab pas rtag pa'o //
translated: the Tathāgata is also like this, pervading everywhere, and therefore is permanent.

original: mi rtag pa'i chos ni gnas 'di la yod la gzhan na med do zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i chos ni gnas 'di la yod la gzhan na med do zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Impermanent dharmas are said to exist in this place but not in another.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata is not like this.

original: gnas 'di na yod la gzhan na med ces brjod du med de /
analyzed: gnas 'di na yod la gzhan na med ces brjod du med de /
translated: It cannot be said that he exists in this place but not in another.

original: de bas na rtag pa'o //🔽mi rtag pa'i chos ni res 'ga' ni yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na rtag pa'o // mi rtag pa'i chos ni res 'ga' ni yod par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore he is permanent.

original: res 'ga' ni med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni med par 'gyur te /
translated: Impermanent dharmas sometimes exist and sometimes do not exist.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is not like this.

original: res 'ga' yod la res 'ga' med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' yod la res 'ga' med pa ma yin te /
translated: He is not sometimes existent and sometimes nonexistent.

original: de bas na rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rtag pa'o //
translated: Therefore he is permanent.

original: rtag tu gnas pa'i chos ni ming dang gzugs med de /
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa'i chos ni ming dang gzugs med de /
translated: The Dharma of permanent abiding is devoid of name and form.

original: nam mkha' ni rtag pa yin pas ming dang gzugs med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rtag pa yin pas ming dang gzugs med do //
translated: Space is permanent and therefore devoid of name and form.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra bar ming dang gzugs med pas de bas na rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra bar ming dang gzugs med pas de bas na rtag pa'o //
translated: The Thus-Gone One is also like that, without name and form, and therefore is permanent.

original: rtag tu gnas pa'i chos ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med de /
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa'i chos ni rgyu dang 'bras bu med de /
translated: A permanently abiding dharma has no cause or effect.

original: nam mkha' ni rtag pa yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rtag pa yin pas rgyu dang 'bras bu med do //
translated: Space is permanent and has no cause or effect.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra bar rgyu dang 'bras bu med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang de dang 'dra bar rgyu dang 'bras bu med de /
translated: The Thus-Gone One is also like that, without cause or effect.

original: de bas na rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rtag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is permanent.

original: rtag tu gnas pa'i chos ni dus gsum la ma gtogs te /
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa'i chos ni dus gsum la ma gtogs te /
translated: A permanently abiding dharma is not included in the three times.

original: de bzhin gshegs @14a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @14a *//
translated: The Thus-Gone One

original: pa'ang de dang 'dra bar dus gsum la ma gtogs pas de bas na rtag pa'o //
analyzed: pa'ang de dang 'dra bar dus gsum la ma gtogs pas de bas na rtag pa'o //
translated: is also like that, not included in the three times, and therefore is permanent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang sgyu ma ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su bcad pas de bas na sgyu ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'ang sgyu ma ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi bden pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su bcad pas de bas na sgyu ma ma yin no //
translated: The Thus-Gone One is not an illusion. This means that he is not an illusion because he has completely eliminated all unreal sentient beings.

original: sgyu ma ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas res 'ga' ni sku gcig pu 'di las sku tshad med par sprul pa dang / sku tshad med pa yang sku gcig tu mdzad pa dang / ri dang brag la thogs pa med par 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: sgyu ma ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas res 'ga' ni sku gcig pu 'di las sku tshad med par sprul pa dang / sku tshad med pa yang sku gcig tu mdzad pa dang / ri dang brag la thogs pa med par 'gro ba dang /
translated: The Tathāgata sometimes emanates immeasurable bodies from this single body, and he sometimes makes immeasurable bodies into a single body. He goes without impediment through mountains and rocks.

original: chu la sa bzhin du 'gro ba dang / sa la chu lta bur nub pa dang / nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin du 'gro ba dang / sku la me'i phung po chen po bzhin du dud pa 'thul zhing me 'bar ba dang / sprin dang 'brug sgra bsgrags te sgra 'jigs su rung ba mdzad pa dang /
analyzed: chu la sa bzhin du 'gro ba dang / sa la chu lta bur nub pa dang / nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin du 'gro ba dang / sku la me'i phung po chen po bzhin du dud pa 'thul zhing me 'bar ba dang / sprin dang 'brug sgra bsgrags te sgra 'jigs su rung ba mdzad pa dang /
translated: He goes through water as if it were land, he sinks into the earth as if it were water, he goes through space as if flying, and his body emits smoke and flames like a great mass of fire. He makes clouds and thunder and roars with a terrifying voice.

original: res 'ga' ni grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / khang pa dang / ri dang / ljongs dang / shing la sogs par 'gyur ba dang / res 'ga' ni sku chen por mdzad /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / khang pa dang / ri dang / ljongs dang / shing la sogs par 'gyur ba dang / res 'ga' ni sku chen por mdzad /
translated: Sometimes he becomes a town, a city, a market, a house, a mountain, a country, a tree, and so on. Sometimes he makes his body large,

original: res 'ga' ni sku chung ngur mdzad pa dang / res 'ga' ni pho'i gzugs dang / mo'i gzugs dang / khye'u dang / bu mo'i gzugs ston te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni sku chung ngur mdzad pa dang / res 'ga' ni pho'i gzugs dang / mo'i gzugs dang / khye'u dang / bu mo'i gzugs ston te /
translated: Sometimes he is small, sometimes he is a male form, sometimes he is a female form, sometimes he is a boy, sometimes he is a girl.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni sgyu ma ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni sgyu ma ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is not an illusion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nges pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas grong khyer rtsva mchog tu s'a la'i shing drung @14b na yongs su mya ngan las 'das par ston pas de bas na nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nges pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pas grong khyer rtsva mchog tu s'a la'i shing drung @14b na yongs su mya ngan las 'das par ston pas de bas na nges pa ma yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is not definite means that the Tathāgata demonstrates final nirvāṇa under the sāla tree in the village of Kuśinagara, therefore he is not definite.

original: nges pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa ni nges pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa ni nges pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is he indefinite means that the Tathāgata is not indefinite because of permanence, bliss, self, and purity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa rnam pa gsum yongs su bcad pas zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa rnam pa gsum yongs su bcad pas zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is not contaminated means that he is not contaminated because the three types of contamination are eliminated.

original: zag pa gsum zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zag pa gsum zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The three impurities are:

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad las ma rig pa ma gtogs pa ni 'dod pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad las ma rig pa ma gtogs pa ni 'dod pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The impurity of desire is all the defilements of the realm of desire, with the exception of ignorance.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad las ma rig pa ma gtogs pa ni srid pa'i zag pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad las ma rig pa ma gtogs pa ni srid pa'i zag pa'o //
translated: The impurity of existence is all the defilements of the realms of form and of the formless, with the exception of ignorance.

original: khams gsum gyi ma rig pa ni ma rig pa'i zag pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi ma rig pa ni ma rig pa'i zag pa ste /
translated: The impurity of ignorance is the ignorance of the three realms.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de dag yongs su bcad pas na zag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de dag yongs su bcad pas na zag pa ma yin no //
translated: The Tathagata has completely eliminated them, and therefore he is not subject to impurity.

original: gzhan yang bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bo thams cad ni srid pa'i zag pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bo thams cad ni srid pa'i zag pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: Moreover, all foolish ordinary people do not see the impurity of existence.

original: ji ltar bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bos srid pa'i zag pa mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bos srid pa'i zag pa mi mthong zhe na /
translated: How is it that foolish ordinary people do not see the impurity of existence?

original: bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bo thams cad ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi the tshom gyi sems can 'di lta bu dang bcas so //
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bo thams cad ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi the tshom gyi sems can 'di lta bu dang bcas so //
translated: All foolish ordinary people have the mind of doubt concerning the future:

original: 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus na lus thob par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i dus na lus thob par 'gyur ram /
translated: “Will I obtain a body in the future?

original: thob par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: thob par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: Will it not be obtained?

original: 'das pa'i dus na lus 'di thog ma nas yod pa zhig gam /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na lus 'di thog ma nas yod pa zhig gam /
translated: In the past, was this body something that existed from the beginning?

original: thog ma nas med pa zhig gam /
analyzed: thog ma nas med pa zhig gam /
translated: Or was it something that did not exist from the beginning?

original: da ltar gyi dus na lus 'di yod pa ma yin @15a *//
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na lus 'di yod pa ma yin @15a *//
translated: In the present, does this body exist?

original: nam; med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nam; med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Or does it not exist?

original: bdag ces bya ba yod na gzugs yin nam /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba yod na gzugs yin nam /
translated: If there is something called a self, is it form?

original: gzugs ma yin nam /🔽gzugs kyang yin la gzugs kyang ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin nam / gzugs kyang yin la gzugs kyang ma yin nam /
translated: Or is it not form?🔽Is it both form and not form?

original: gzugs kyang ma yin la gzugs ma yin pa'ang ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzugs kyang ma yin la gzugs ma yin pa'ang ma yin nam /
translated: Or is it neither form nor not form?

original: 'du shes sam /
analyzed: 'du shes sam /
translated: Is it perception?

original: 'du shes ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'du shes ma yin nam /
translated: Or is it not perception?

original: 'du shes kyang yin la 'du shes kyang ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'du shes kyang yin la 'du shes kyang ma yin nam /
translated: Is it both perception and not perception?

original: 'du shes kyang ma yin la 'du shes ma yin pa'ang ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'du shes kyang ma yin la 'du shes ma yin pa'ang ma yin nam /
translated: Or is it neither perception nor not perception?

original: lus 'di gzhan dbang ngam /
analyzed: lus 'di gzhan dbang ngam /
translated: Is this body controlled by another?

original: gzhan mi dbang ngam /🔽gzhan yang dbang la /
analyzed: gzhan mi dbang ngam / gzhan yang dbang la /
translated: Or is it not controlled by another?

original: gzhan dbang ba yang ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan dbang ba yang ma yin nam /
translated: Is it controlled by another and not controlled by another?🔽Or is it neither controlled by another nor not controlled by another?

original: gzhan yang mi dbang la gzhan mi dbang ba yang ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi dbang la gzhan mi dbang ba yang ma yin nam /
translated: Is it neither controlled by another nor not controlled by another?

original: srog ni yod la lus med pa zhig gam /
analyzed: srog ni yod la lus med pa zhig gam /
translated: Is the life-force something that exists while the body does not?

original: lus ni yod la srog med pa zhig gam /
analyzed: lus ni yod la srog med pa zhig gam /
translated: Is there a body but no life?

original: lus kyang yod la srog kyang yod pa zhig gam /
analyzed: lus kyang yod la srog kyang yod pa zhig gam /
translated: Is there both a body and life?

original: lus kyang med la srog kyang med pa zhig gam /
analyzed: lus kyang med la srog kyang med pa zhig gam /
translated: Is there neither a body nor life?

original: lus dang srog rtag pa yin nam /
analyzed: lus dang srog rtag pa yin nam /
translated: Is the body and life permanent?

original: mi rtag pa yin nam /🔽rtag pa'ang yin la mi rtag pa'ang yin nam /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin nam / rtag pa'ang yin la mi rtag pa'ang yin nam /
translated: Are they impermanent?🔽Are they both permanent and impermanent?

original: rtag pa'ang ma yin la rtag pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtag pa'ang ma yin la rtag pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin nam /
translated: Are they neither permanent nor impermanent?

original: lus dang srog 'di dbang sgyur gyis byas sam /
analyzed: lus dang srog 'di dbang sgyur gyis byas sam /
translated: Is the body and life created by a controller?

original: dus kyis byas sam /
analyzed: dus kyis byas sam /
translated: Are they created by time?

original: rgyu med pas byas sam /
analyzed: rgyu med pas byas sam /
translated: Are they created without a cause?

original: 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin gyis byas sam /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin gyis byas sam /
translated: Are they created by the nature of the world?

original: rdul phran gyis byas sam /
analyzed: rdul phran gyis byas sam /
translated: Are they created by atoms?

original: chos dang chos ma yin pas byas sam /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pas byas sam /
translated: Are they created by virtue and nonvirtue?

original: skyes bus byas sam /
analyzed: skyes bus byas sam /
translated: Are they created by a person?

original: nyon mongs pas byas sam /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas byas sam /
translated: Are they created by the afflictions?

original: pha mas byas sam /
analyzed: pha mas byas sam /
translated: Are they created by the parents?

original: bdag sems @15b la gnas sam /
analyzed: bdag sems @15b la gnas sam /
translated: Does the self abide in the mind?

original: mig la gnas sam /
analyzed: mig la gnas sam /
translated: Does it abide in the eyes?

original: lus la khyab par 'jug gam /
analyzed: lus la khyab par 'jug gam /
translated: Does it pervade the body?

original: gzhan zhig nas 'ongs sam /
analyzed: gzhan zhig nas 'ongs sam /
translated: Does it come from somewhere else?

original: gang du 'gro 'am /
analyzed: gang du 'gro 'am /
translated: Where does it go?

original: skye ba ni su /
analyzed: skye ba ni su /
translated: Who is born?

original: 'chi ba ni su /
analyzed: 'chi ba ni su /
translated: Who dies?

original: bdag ces bya ba 'das pa'i dus na bram ze'i rigs sam /🔽rgyal rigs sam /🔽rje'u rigs sam /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba 'das pa'i dus na bram ze'i rigs sam / rgyal rigs sam / rje'u rigs sam /
translated: In the past, I was a Brahmin,🔽a Kshatriya,🔽a Vaishya,🔽

original: rigs ngan gyi rigs sam /
analyzed: rigs ngan gyi rigs sam /
translated: “Am I a Brahmin, a Kshatriya, a Vaishya, or a Shudra?

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rigs ji lta bu zhig thob par 'gyur /🔽bdag gi lus 'di sngon 'das pa'i dus na skyes pa yin nam /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rigs ji lta bu zhig thob par 'gyur / bdag gi lus 'di sngon 'das pa'i dus na skyes pa yin nam /
translated: What kind of family will I be born into in the future?

original: bud med yin nam /
analyzed: bud med yin nam /
translated: Was I a man or a woman in the past?

original: byol song yin nam /
analyzed: byol song yin nam /
translated: Was I an animal?

original: gal te bdag gis srog bcad na kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa yod par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gal te bdag gis srog bcad na kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa yod par 'gyur ram /
translated: If I kill, will I be guilty of a sin or not?

original: kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa med pa nas smyo ba'i khu ba 'thung ba'i bar du sdig par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba'i sdig pa med pa nas smyo ba'i khu ba 'thung ba'i bar du sdig par 'gyur ram /
translated: Will I be guilty of a sin if I drink alcohol or not?

original: sdig pa med par 'gyur ram /🔽bdag nyid kyis byas sam /
analyzed: sdig pa med par 'gyur ram / bdag nyid kyis byas sam /
translated: Will I be guilty of a sin or not?

original: gzhan gyis byas sam /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas sam /
translated: Did I do it myself or did someone else do it?

original: bdag gis 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong ngam /
analyzed: bdag gis 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong ngam /
translated: Did I experience the ripening of the results or will I experience the ripening of the results of the karma?

original: las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur snyam pa'i the tshom du lta ba'i nyon mongs pa tshad med pa'i sems can gyi sems bsgribs so //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur snyam pa'i the tshom du lta ba'i nyon mongs pa tshad med pa'i sems can gyi sems bsgribs so //
translated: ” The minds of countless sentient beings are obscured by the afflictions of such views and doubts.

original: the tshom du lta ba'i rkyen gyis sems rnam pa 'di drug skye'o //
analyzed: the tshom du lta ba'i rkyen gyis sems rnam pa 'di drug skye'o //
translated: The six kinds of mind arise from the condition of the view of doubt.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?🔽They are:

original: nges par bdag yod dam /
analyzed: nges par bdag yod dam /
translated: the view that the self definitely exists,

original: nges par bdag med pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag dang bdag gir lta ba dang / bdag med pa dang bdag med par lta ba dang / bdag gam bdag gis byas pa dang / bdag gis myong ba dang / bdag gis shes pa ste /
analyzed: nges par bdag med pa dang / bdag tu lta ba dang / bdag dang bdag gir lta ba dang / bdag med pa dang bdag med par lta ba dang / bdag gam bdag gis byas pa dang / bdag gis myong ba dang / bdag gis shes pa ste /
translated: the view that the self definitely does not exist, the view of the self, the view of the self and what belongs to the self, the view of the nonexistence of the self, the view of the nonexistence of what belongs to the self, the view that the self acts, the view that the self experiences, the view that the self knows, and the view that the self sees.

original: de dag ni ngan par lta ba zhes bya'o //🔽de bzhin @16a *//
analyzed: de dag ni ngan par lta ba zhes bya'o // de bzhin @16a *//
translated: These are called evil views.🔽The Tathāgata has completely eradicated these views and the immeasurable contaminants associated with them.

original: gshegs pas de ltar lta ba dang bcas pa'i zag pa tshad med pa snyed rtsa ba nas bton pas de bas na zag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gshegs pas de ltar lta ba dang bcas pa'i zag pa tshad med pa snyed rtsa ba nas bton pas de bas na zag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not contaminants.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po las 'phags pa'i spyad pa spyod pa'ang de lta bu'i zag pa rnams yongs su chod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po las 'phags pa'i spyad pa spyod pa'ang de lta bu'i zag pa rnams yongs su chod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices the superior conduct in the Great Parinirvāṇa Sutra will also completely sever these contaminants.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu 'phags pa'i spyad pa spyod pas de bas na zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni rtag tu 'phags pa'i spyad pa spyod pas de bas na zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The Buddhas, the World-Honored Ones, always practice the holy life, so they are free from defilement.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: bus pa ma rabs ni dbang po lnga legs par mi sdud pas zag pa gsum yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs ni dbang po lnga legs par mi sdud pas zag pa gsum yod par 'gyur te /
translated: the five faculties of the foolish are not well controlled, so they have the three defilements.

original: mi dge bas khrid nas mi dge ba'i gnas su 'gro'o //
analyzed: mi dge bas khrid nas mi dge ba'i gnas su 'gro'o //

original: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: dbang po lnga legs par sdud mi nus pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /

analyzed: dper na / ba glang ma rungs pa ma dul ba la la la zhig gis zhon na bsams pa bzhin du 'gror mi btub ste /
translated: It is like an unruly, untamed ox. If someone rides it, it will not go where he wants to go.

original: grong khyer dang bral nas gnas dgon par 'gro'o //
analyzed: grong khyer dang bral nas gnas dgon par 'gro'o //

original: dbang po lnga sdud mi nus pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /

analyzed: shes rab thob pa'i phyir dbang po lnga la rtse gcig par 'gyur te /

analyzed: gal te dran pa mi 'phro na yang dag pa'i dran par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang de dang 'dra ste /

analyzed: dran pa'i shes rab kyi dbang po lnga srung zhing sdud pa'i rkyen gyis kun tu 'phro bar mi byed do //
translated: He protects and gathers the five faculties of the wisdom of mindfulness and does not let them scatter because of conditions.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dran pa'i shes rab yod pa ni bdag gi mtshan nyid mi mthong /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahasattva who has the wisdom of mindfulness does not see the characteristics of self.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i mtshan nyid mi mthong /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba'i mtshan nyid mi mthong /
translated: They do not see the characteristics of self and what belongs to the self.

original: sems can du mi mthong /
analyzed: sems can du mi mthong /
translated: They do not see sentient beings.

original: spyod pa'i dngos por mi mthong ste /
analyzed: spyod pa'i dngos por mi mthong ste /
translated: They do not see the things of conduct.

translated: They see all phenomena in accordance with the characteristics of reality, and so the characteristics of earth, stones, pebbles, and gravel arise.

original: ji ltar khang pa ni rkyen mang po las skyes te /

translated: Just as a house arises from many conditions,

original: gcig tu chad pa'i rang bzhin @17b med pa dang 'dra bar sems can rnams kyang chen po bzhi dang / phung po lnga las byung bas brtags na nges pa'i mtshan nyid med do //

translated: and is without a nature that is cut off, in the same way, since sentient beings arise from the four great elements and the five aggregates, when examined, they have no definitive characteristics.

translated: Since they have no definitive characteristics, bodhisattvas do not give rise to attachment and clinging to them.

analyzed: bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bo thams cad ni sems can yod par mthong bas nyon mongs pa skye bar gyur to //

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po la nan tan byed pa ni dran pa'i shes rab yod pas sems can rnams la chags shing zhen pa mi skyed do //

translated: In this way, bodhisattva great beings thoroughly investigate all sentient beings, and realize that they experience immeasurable suffering due to the causes and conditions of desire.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpas 'khor ba'i 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal de dag gis phyir dran pa'i shes rab nyams par mi byed do //

original: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtshan nyid mthong bar 'dod dam /

original: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sengge'i rgyal po'i ting nge 'dzin sgom par 'dod dam /
analyzed: dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sengge'i rgyal po'i ting nge 'dzin sgom par 'dod dam /
translated: Do you wish to cultivate the samādhi of the heroic stride and the samādhi of the lion king?

original: bdud rnam pa brgyad 'joms par 'dod dam /
analyzed: bdud rnam pa brgyad 'joms par 'dod dam /
translated: Do you wish to conquer the eight māras?

original: bdud rnam pa brgyad ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bdud rnam pa brgyad ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The so-called eight māras are as follows:

original: bdud rnam pa bzhi dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba med pa dang / bdag med pa dang / yongs su dag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bdud rnam pa bzhi dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba med pa dang / bdag med pa dang / yongs su dag pa med pa'o //
translated: the four māras, impermanence, the absence of happiness, the absence of self, and the absence of purity.

original: mir skye bar 'dod dam /
analyzed: mir skye bar 'dod dam /
translated: Do you wish to be born as a human?

original: lha'i bde ba 'dod na mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo gzungs su 'dzin cing yi ger bris sam /
analyzed: lha'i bde ba 'dod na mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo gzungs su 'dzin cing yi ger bris sam /
translated: If you wish for the happiness of the gods, you should hold the dhāraṇī of the Great Parinirvāṇa Sūtra, write it out,

original: klog gam / 'don tam /
analyzed: klog gam / 'don tam /
translated: read it, recite it,

original: dgrol zhing 'chad dam /
analyzed: dgrol zhing 'chad dam /
translated: explain it, and liberate it.

original: don yid la byed pa mthong na de'i gan du bsnyen zhing nye bar 'gro ste /🔽gnas 'cha' zhing gsol ba dang zhu ba byas te /
analyzed: don yid la byed pa mthong na de'i gan du bsnyen zhing nye bar 'gro ste / gnas 'cha' zhing gsol ba dang zhu ba byas te /
translated: If you see someone who is doing this, you should approach them, go near them,🔽make a home for them, and make requests and ask questions.

original: mchod pa dang / rim gro dang / bsti stang byas la /
analyzed: mchod pa dang / rim gro dang / bsti stang byas la /
translated: You should make offerings, serve them, and respect them.

original: rkang @21b pa bkru ba dang / khri stan gding zhing yo byad rnam pa bzhis mchod de brel bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rkang @21b pa bkru ba dang / khri stan gding zhing yo byad rnam pa bzhis mchod de brel bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not be in a hurry to wash one’s feet, to make one’s bed, or to offer the four kinds of offerings.

original: gal te lam ring po nas 'ongs na dpag tshad bcu'i bar du bsu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te lam ring po nas 'ongs na dpag tshad bcu'i bar du bsu bar bya'o //
translated: If the guest has come from far away, one should go out as far as ten yojanas to greet him.

original: mdo sde 'di'i phyir rin che bar bya ba'i nor kun gyis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di'i phyir rin che bar bya ba'i nor kun gyis mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings to this sutra with all the valuable treasures one has.

original: gal te med na bdag gi lus kyang btsong bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te med na bdag gi lus kyang btsong bar bya'o //
translated: If one does not have them, one should sell one’s body to obtain them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: mdo sde 'di ni me tog au dumba ra bas phrad dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde 'di ni me tog au dumba ra bas phrad dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this sutra is more difficult to encounter than the udumbara flower.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Good son,

original: ngas sngon bskal pa tshad med mtha' yas pa khrag khrig 'das pa de'i tshe de'i dus na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba 'dir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: ngas sngon bskal pa tshad med mtha' yas pa khrag khrig 'das pa de'i tshe de'i dus na 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed ces bya ba 'dir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa /
translated: in the past, innumerable, limitless, and incalculable eons ago, in this Sahā world system, there was a buddha named Śākyamuni Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened,

original: mkhyen pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /🔽bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: mkhyen pa dang zhabs su ldan pa / bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: Perfect in Knowledge and Conduct,

original: 'jig rten rig pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten rig pa /
translated: Well-Gone, Knower of the Secular World,🔽Unsurpassed Trainer of Those to Be Tamed,🔽Teacher of Gods and Men,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: unsurpassed,

original: skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul zhing kha lo sgyur ba /
translated: a guide who tames beings,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: a teacher of gods and humans,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das byung ste /
translated: a blessed buddha.

original: 'khor mang po rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di ston to //
analyzed: 'khor mang po rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di ston to //
translated: He taught this Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra to the great assembly.

original: ngas de'i tshe na dge ba'i bshes gnyen las sangs rgyas de'i 'khor mang po rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ston no zhes thos so //
analyzed: ngas de'i tshe na dge ba'i bshes gnyen las sangs rgyas de'i 'khor mang po rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ston no zhes thos so //
translated: At that time, I heard from a spiritual friend that the Buddha was teaching the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra to the great assembly.

original: das de thos nas rab tu dga' bar gyur te mchod pa zhig dbul bar bsams pa las dbul te ci'ang mi bdog go //
analyzed: das de thos nas rab tu dga' bar gyur te mchod pa zhig dbul bar bsams pa las dbul te ci'ang mi bdog go //
translated: Having heard that, I was overjoyed and wished to make an offering, but I was destitute and had nothing.

original: lus btsod bar byas pa las kyang bsod nams chung bas ma dum mo //
analyzed: lus btsod bar byas pa las kyang bsod nams chung bas ma dum mo //
translated: I tried to sell my body, but because of my meager merit, I did not find a buyer.

original: phyir khyim du song ba las la ma du mi gcig dang phrad nas ngas 'di skad du bdag lus 'di btsong na @22a *//
analyzed: phyir khyim du song ba las la ma du mi gcig dang phrad nas ngas 'di skad du bdag lus 'di btsong na @22a *//
translated: Returning home, I met a woman and said, 'If I sell this body of mine,

original: khyod mi nyo'am zhes smras so //
analyzed: khyod mi nyo'am zhes smras so //
translated: will you buy it?'

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: She said,

original: bdag la las shig yod de /
analyzed: bdag la las shig yod de /
translated: 'I have a job.

original: sus kyang byed mi nus so //
analyzed: sus kyang byed mi nus so //
translated: No one can do it.

original: khyod gal te de ltar nus na bdag gis nyo bar bya'o /
analyzed: khyod gal te de ltar nus na bdag gis nyo bar bya'o /
translated: If you can do it, I will buy it.”

original: ngas dris pa /
analyzed: ngas dris pa /
translated: I asked:

original: las ji lta bu zhig yod na sus kyang byed mi nus /
analyzed: las ji lta bu zhig yod na sus kyang byed mi nus /
translated: “What kind of work is it that no one can do?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said:

original: bdag la nad ma rungs pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: bdag la nad ma rungs pa zhig yod de /
translated: “I have a serious illness.

original: sman pa mkhas pa dag gis dpyad byas na nyin re zhing mi'i sha srang gsum zos na phan zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sman pa mkhas pa dag gis dpyad byas na nyin re zhing mi'i sha srang gsum zos na phan zhes zer ro //
translated: The skilled doctors have examined me and said that if I eat three ounces of human flesh every day, it will help me.

original: gal te lus kyi sha nyin re zhing srang gsum gcod cing kho bo la sbyin phod na khyod la gser gyi dong tse lnga byin no //
analyzed: gal te lus kyi sha nyin re zhing srang gsum gcod cing kho bo la sbyin phod na khyod la gser gyi dong tse lnga byin no //
translated: If you can cut three ounces of flesh from your body every day and give it to me, I will give you five gold coins.”🔽When I heard him say this, I was very happy.

original: ngas de'i tshe de skad du smras pa thos nas sems rab tu dga' ste /
analyzed: ngas de'i tshe de skad du smras pa thos nas sems rab tu dga' ste /
translated: I said to him:

original: ngas kyang 'di skad du khyod kyis nga la dong tse byin te /
analyzed: ngas kyang 'di skad du khyod kyis nga la dong tse byin te /
translated: “Give me the gold coins.

original: zhag bdun shol cig dang / nga'i bya ba byas nas khyod ci 'dod pa bzhin du bya'o zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhag bdun shol cig dang / nga'i bya ba byas nas khyod ci 'dod pa bzhin du bya'o zhes smras so //
translated: Wait seven days, and after I have done what I need to do, I will do whatever you want.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said:

original: zhag bdun ni mi rung gi //
analyzed: zhag bdun ni mi rung gi //
translated: “Seven days is too long.

original: yang dag par de ltar rung na zhag gcig cig gnang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par de ltar rung na zhag gcig cig gnang bar bya'o //
translated: If it is really so, I will grant you one day.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: ngas de'i tshe dong tshe blangs nas phyir sangs rgyas gang na ba der song ste mgo bos zhags la phyag byas nas ci bdog pa ma lus par mchod cing phul te /
analyzed: ngas de'i tshe dong tshe blangs nas phyir sangs rgyas gang na ba der song ste mgo bos zhags la phyag byas nas ci bdog pa ma lus par mchod cing phul te /
translated: at that time I took the money and returned to where the Buddha was. I bowed my head to the ground, and with all that I had, I made offerings and gave it all away.

original: bzod sems thag pa nas mdo sde 'di mnyan to //
analyzed: bzod sems thag pa nas mdo sde 'di mnyan to //
translated: With a sincere mind, I listened to this sutra.

original: nga de'i tshe dbang po rtul bas mdo sde 'di thos par 'gyur kyang tshig bzhi pa'i le'u gcig 'ba' zhig zin par gyur to //
analyzed: nga de'i tshe dbang po rtul bas mdo sde 'di thos par 'gyur kyang tshig bzhi pa'i le'u gcig 'ba' zhig zin par gyur to //
translated: At that time, because my faculties were dull, although I was able to hear this sutra, I only retained one chapter of four lines.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan 'da' ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan 'da' ba ni /
translated: The Tathagata's nirvana

original: 'khor ba thams cad yongs su bcad pa ste //
analyzed: 'khor ba thams cad yongs su bcad pa ste //
translated: is the complete severance of all cyclic existence.

original: @22b gang gis rtse gcig sems kyis rab mnyan na //
analyzed: @22b gang gis rtse gcig sems kyis rab mnyan na //
translated: Those who listen to it with a one-pointed mind

original: tshad med bde ba rtag tu thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: tshad med bde ba rtag tu thob par 'gyur //
translated: will always attain immeasurable bliss.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di bzung nas phyir nad pa de'i khyim du 'ongs so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di bzung nas phyir nad pa de'i khyim du 'ongs so //
translated: Having retained this verse, I returned to the sick man's home.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: ngas de'i tshe nyin re zhing sha srang gsum gsum bcad kyang tshigs su bcad pa 'di yid la byas pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis na bar ma gyur to //
analyzed: ngas de'i tshe nyin re zhing sha srang gsum gsum bcad kyang tshigs su bcad pa 'di yid la byas pa'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis na bar ma gyur to //
translated: At that time, although I cut off three sheng of flesh every day, because of the cause and condition of keeping this verse in mind, I did not become ill.

original: nyin gcig kyang bar chad ma byung bar zla ba gcig gi bar du de ltar byin no //
analyzed: nyin gcig kyang bar chad ma byung bar zla ba gcig gi bar du de ltar byin no //
translated: For one month, I gave like this without any interruption.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis nad pa ni sos /
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis nad pa ni sos /
translated: because of that cause and that condition, the sick person recovered.

original: nga'i lus kyang sngon bzhin du rma med par gyur te /
analyzed: nga'i lus kyang sngon bzhin du rma med par gyur te /
translated: My body also became as it was before, without any wounds.

original: ngas de'i tshe ba dag gi lus ma god par mthong nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //🔽tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi mthus kyang de ltar nus na yongs su rdzogs par 'dzin tam /
analyzed: ngas de'i tshe ba dag gi lus ma god par mthong nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do // tshigs su bcad pa gcig gi mthus kyang de ltar nus na yongs su rdzogs par 'dzin tam /
translated: At that time, seeing that the bodies of the deer were not harmed, I gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: klog gam // 'don pa lta ci smos //
analyzed: klog gam // 'don pa lta ci smos //
translated: If I was able to do this through the power of just one verse, what need is there to mention someone who upholds, recites, or recites it completely?

original: nas mdo se 'di la de lta bu'i khe phan pa yod par mthong nas sdon pas kyang sems lhag par bskyed de /
analyzed: nas mdo se 'di la de lta bu'i khe phan pa yod par mthong nas sdon pas kyang sems lhag par bskyed de /
translated: Seeing that this sutra has such benefits, I gave rise to the mind set on awakening even more strongly.

original: bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob cing mtshan yang sh'akya thub pa zhes bya bar gyur cig ces smon lam btab bo //
analyzed: bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob cing mtshan yang sh'akya thub pa zhes bya bar gyur cig ces smon lam btab bo //
translated: I pray that in the future I may attain the enlightenment of buddhahood and be called Shakyamuni.’

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Good son,

original: tshigs su bcad pa de gcig gi mthu'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis deng ngas 'khor mang po'i nang na lha dang mi rnams la yongs su rdzogs par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa de gcig gi mthu'i rgyu dang rkyen gyis deng ngas 'khor mang po'i nang na lha dang mi rnams la yongs su rdzogs par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: because of the power of the cause and conditions of this one verse, today I have been able to teach it completely to the gods and humans in this great assembly.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Good son,

original: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: de bas na mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: therefore this Great Nirvana Sutra is inconceivable.

original: yon tan tshad med pa mtha' yas pa dang ldan no //🔽'di ni sangs rgyas @23a *//
analyzed: yon tan tshad med pa mtha' yas pa dang ldan no // 'di ni sangs rgyas @23a *//
translated: It is endowed with limitless, boundless merits.🔽This is the essence of the teachings

original: bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs te gsungs pa'i snying po yin no //
translated: of the buddhas, the bhagavans.

original: de lta bas na gang 'dzin pa des zag pa ngan pa spong zhing chod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na gang 'dzin pa des zag pa ngan pa spong zhing chod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, whoever upholds it will be able to eliminate and cut off evil defilements.

original: ngan pa zhes bya ba ni bal glang ngan pa dang / rta ngan pa dang / be lang ngan pa dang / khyi dang / sbrul gdug pa ngan ba gnas pa'i gnas dang / tsher ma ngan pa'i sa dang / gad pa dang / g-yang sa dang /
analyzed: ngan pa zhes bya ba ni bal glang ngan pa dang / rta ngan pa dang / be lang ngan pa dang / khyi dang / sbrul gdug pa ngan ba gnas pa'i gnas dang / tsher ma ngan pa'i sa dang / gad pa dang / g-yang sa dang /
translated: The “bad” are the places where bad elephants, bad horses, bad oxen, dogs, and poisonous snakes live, as well as places with bad thorns, ravines, precipices,

original: nyam da ba dang / shva dang / dba' klong dang / mi ngan pa dang / yul ngan pa dang / grong khyer ngan pa dang / khyim ngan pa dang / bshes gnyen ngan pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyam da ba dang / shva dang / dba' klong dang / mi ngan pa dang / yul ngan pa dang / grong khyer ngan pa dang / khyim ngan pa dang / bshes gnyen ngan pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: bad people, bad countries, bad cities, bad houses, bad friends, and so on.

original: de lta bu de dag gis gal te zag pa'i rgyu byed na /
analyzed: de lta bu de dag gis gal te zag pa'i rgyu byed na /
translated: If these are causes of defilement,

original: byang chub sems dpas de spong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de spong ngo //
translated: the bodhisattva abandons them.

original: gal te mi byed na mi spong ngo //
analyzed: gal te mi byed na mi spong ngo //
translated: If they are not causes of defilement, he does not abandon them.

original: gal te zag pa skyed na spong bar byed do //
analyzed: gal te zag pa skyed na spong bar byed do //
translated: If they produce defilement, he abandons them.

original: gal te mi skyed na mi spong ngo //
analyzed: gal te mi skyed na mi spong ngo //
translated: If they do not produce defilement, he does not abandon them.

original: gal te chos sdig pa byed na yongs su spong ngo //
analyzed: gal te chos sdig pa byed na yongs su spong ngo //
translated: If they cause unwholesome dharmas, he abandons them.

original: gal te dge ba byed na mi spong ngo //
analyzed: gal te dge ba byed na mi spong ngo //
translated: If they cause wholesome dharmas, he does not abandon them.

original: ci ltar spong bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci ltar spong bar byed ce na /
translated: How does he abandon them?

original: mtshon cha mi thogs par rtag tu dpen pa'i blo'i thabs kyi spong bar byed de /
analyzed: mtshon cha mi thogs par rtag tu dpen pa'i blo'i thabs kyi spong bar byed de /
translated: He abandons them by means of the wisdom of solitude, without taking up weapons.

original: de bas na bden pa'i blos spong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bden pa'i blos spong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “abandonment by means of the wisdom of the truth.”

original: dge ba skye bar bya ba'i sdig pa'i chos spong ngo //
analyzed: dge ba skye bar bya ba'i sdig pa'i chos spong ngo //
translated: He abandons the unwholesome dharmas that give rise to the wholesome.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag gi lus la nad lta bu dang / rma lta bu dang / skrangs pa lta bu dang / dgra lta bu dang / lus la mdas gzer ba lta bur rtogs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag gi lus la nad lta bu dang / rma lta bu dang / skrangs pa lta bu dang / dgra lta bu dang / lus la mdas gzer ba lta bur rtogs te /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva understands the body to be like a disease, like a wound, like a boil, like an enemy, like an arrow piercing the body.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di ni dge ba dang sdig pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin par @23b rtogs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di ni dge ba dang sdig pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin par @23b rtogs so //
translated: He understands that this great mass of suffering is the root of all wholesome and unwholesome [actions].

original: lus 'di ni 'di ltar mi gtsang ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: lus 'di ni 'di ltar mi gtsang ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Although this body is indeed impure,

original: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpas gso zhing ri ma gro byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang byang chub sems dpas gso zhing ri ma gro byed do //
translated: the bodhisattva still nurtures and protects it.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lus la chags pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lus la chags pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not because of attachment to the body,

original: dge ba'i chos kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos kyi phyir ro //
translated: but for the sake of wholesome dharmas.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir gyi 'khor ba'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir gyi 'khor ba'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: It is for the sake of nirvāṇa, not for the sake of saṃsāra.

original: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa'i phyir gyi /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa'i phyir gyi /
translated: because of permanence, happiness, self, and purity,

original: mi rtag pa dang / mi bde ba dang / bdag med pa dang / yongs su dag pa med pa'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / mi bde ba dang / bdag med pa dang / yongs su dag pa med pa'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: not because of impermanence, suffering, no-self, and impurity.

original: byang chub kyi lam gyi phyir gyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi lam gyi phyir gyi /
translated: It is for the path to enlightenment,

original: srid pa'i lam gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i lam gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: not for the path of existence.

original: theg pa gcig gi phyir gyi /
analyzed: theg pa gcig gi phyir gyi /
translated: It is for the one vehicle,

original: theg pa gsum gyi phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: theg pa gsum gyi phyir ma yin no //
translated: not for the three vehicles.

original: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po rgyad cu'i sku dam pa'i phyir gyi 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi lus kyi bar gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po rgyad cu'i sku dam pa'i phyir gyi 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi lus kyi bar gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is for the body of the thirty-two marks and eighty minor characteristics, not for the body up to the non-perception and non-non-perception.

original: chos kyi k'hor lo bskor ba'i rgyal po'i phyir gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi k'hor lo bskor ba'i rgyal po'i phyir gyi /
translated: It is for the king who turns the wheel of the Dharma,

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i phyir ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i phyir ma yin no //
translated: not for the king who turns the wheel of existence.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lus rtag tu bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lus rtag tu bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas should always protect their bodies.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te lus ma bsrungs na srog 'tsho bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lus ma bsrungs na srog 'tsho bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the body is not protected, life cannot be sustained.

original: gal te srog mi 'tsho na mdo sde 'di yi ger 'dri zhing 'dzin pa'am //
analyzed: gal te srog mi 'tsho na mdo sde 'di yi ger 'dri zhing 'dzin pa'am //
translated: If life cannot be sustained, one will be unable to copy, uphold,

original: klog pa'am // 'don pa'am /
analyzed: klog pa'am // 'don pa'am /
translated: read, recite,

original: gzhan la rgyas par ston pa'am //
analyzed: gzhan la rgyas par ston pa'am //
translated: explain in detail to others,

original: don yid la byed par mi nus te /
analyzed: don yid la byed par mi nus te /
translated: or contemplate the meaning of this sutra.

original: de bas na byang chub sems pda' lus shin tu bspud bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems pda' lus shin tu bspud bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, bodhisattvas should protect their bodies well.

original: don de lta bu'i phyir byang chub sems dpas zag pa ngan pa thams cad spong bar gyur to //
analyzed: don de lta bu'i phyir byang chub sems dpas zag pa ngan pa thams cad spong bar gyur to //
translated: For this reason, bodhisattvas abandon all evil defilements.

original: @24a *// rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: @24a *// rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: dper na / chu brgal bas ni gru dang gzings shin tu bsrung ngo //
analyzed: dper na / chu brgal bas ni gru dang gzings shin tu bsrung ngo //
translated: for example, when crossing water, one protects the boat or raft well.

original: mgron po lam du zhugs pa ni rta bzang po la sogs pa shin tu skyong ngo //
analyzed: mgron po lam du zhugs pa ni rta bzang po la sogs pa shin tu skyong ngo //
translated: When travelers set out on a road, they take good care of their fine horses and so forth.

original: zhing bas ni lud la sogs pa shin tu bsrung ngo //
analyzed: zhing bas ni lud la sogs pa shin tu bsrung ngo //
translated: Farmers protect their manure and so on well.

original: dug la phan par 'dod pas ni sbrul gdug pa shin tu bsrung ngo //
analyzed: dug la phan par 'dod pas ni sbrul gdug pa shin tu bsrung ngo //
translated: Those who wish to benefit from poison protect poisonous snakes well.

original: rdzas mang po ba dog pas rigs ngan gdol ba bsrung ngo //
analyzed: rdzas mang po ba dog pas rigs ngan gdol ba bsrung ngo //
translated: Those who have many possessions protect low-caste untouchables well.

original: dgra la rgol bas ni mi rtsal yod pa bsrung ngo //
analyzed: dgra la rgol bas ni mi rtsal yod pa bsrung ngo //
translated: By opposing enemies, one protects the power of the body.

original: ji ltar grang bas me bsrung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar grang bas me bsrung ngo //
translated: Just as one protects a fire from the cold.

original: ji ltar mdze can dag sman gdug pa tshol ba bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar mdze can dag sman gdug pa tshol ba bzhin te /
translated: Just as a leper seeks out poisonous medicine.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang de dang 'dra bar lus 'di la mi gtsang ba tshad med pa dang ldan zhing yongs su gang bar mthong yang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang de dang 'dra bar lus 'di la mi gtsang ba tshad med pa dang ldan zhing yongs su gang bar mthong yang /
translated: In the same way, although the bodhisattva mahāsattva sees this body as full and endowed with immeasurable impurities,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo gzungs su 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir 'on kyang srung zhing rim gro byed de prel zhing phongs par mi byed do //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo gzungs su 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir 'on kyang srung zhing rim gro byed de prel zhing phongs par mi byed do //
translated: in order to uphold the dhāraṇī of the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra, he still protects and serves it, not abandoning it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bal glang ma rungs pa dang / bshes gnyen ma rungs pa la sogs pa brtags na gnyis su med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bal glang ma rungs pa dang / bshes gnyen ma rungs pa la sogs pa brtags na gnyis su med do //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva, when examining evil elephants, evil friends, and so forth, finds that they are not two.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: kun kyang lus 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun kyang lus 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they all destroy the body.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bal glang ma rungs ba la sogs pa la ni 'jigs skrag pa'i sems med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bal glang ma rungs ba la sogs pa la ni 'jigs skrag pa'i sems med do //
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva has no fear of bad elephants, etc.

original: sdig pa'i grogs po la ni shin tu 'jigs skrag pa'i sems bskyed do //
analyzed: sdig pa'i grogs po la ni shin tu 'jigs skrag pa'i sems bskyed do //
translated: He generates a very fearful mind towards bad friends.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bal glang ma rungs pa la sogs pa ni lus 'ba' zhig 'jig nus te sems @24b 'jig mi nus so //
analyzed: bal glang ma rungs pa la sogs pa ni lus 'ba' zhig 'jig nus te sems @24b 'jig mi nus so //
translated: Bad elephants, etc. can only destroy the body, not the mind.

original: grogs po ngan pas ni gnyis ka 'jig nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grogs po ngan pas ni gnyis ka 'jig nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Bad friends can destroy both.

original: bal glang ngan pa la sogs pas ni lus gcig pu 'jig nus kyi /
analyzed: bal glang ngan pa la sogs pas ni lus gcig pu 'jig nus kyi /
translated: Bad elephants, etc. can only destroy the one body.

original: grogs po ngan pas ni dge a'i lus tshad med pa dang / dge ba'i sems tshad med pa'ang 'jig go //
analyzed: grogs po ngan pas ni dge a'i lus tshad med pa dang / dge ba'i sems tshad med pa'ang 'jig go //
translated: Bad friends destroy immeasurable bodies of virtue and immeasurable minds of virtue.

original: bal glang ngan pa la sogs pas ni mi gtsang ba'i lus 'ba' zhig 'jig nus kyi //
analyzed: bal glang ngan pa la sogs pas ni mi gtsang ba'i lus 'ba' zhig 'jig nus kyi //
translated: Bad elephants, etc. can only destroy the impure body.

original: grogs po ngan pas ni rnam par dag pa'i lus dang / rnam par dag pa'i sems 'jig nus so //
analyzed: grogs po ngan pas ni rnam par dag pa'i lus dang / rnam par dag pa'i sems 'jig nus so //
translated: Bad friends can destroy the pure body and the pure mind.

original: bal glang ngan pa la sogs pas ni sha'i lus 'ba' zhig 'jig nus kyi /
analyzed: bal glang ngan pa la sogs pas ni sha'i lus 'ba' zhig 'jig nus kyi /
translated: Bad elephants and so on can only destroy the physical body.

original: grogs po ngan pas ni chos kyi lus 'jig nus so //
analyzed: grogs po ngan pas ni chos kyi lus 'jig nus so //
translated: But bad friends can destroy the Dharma body.

original: bal glang ma rungs bas bsad na ngan song gsum du mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: bal glang ma rungs bas bsad na ngan song gsum du mi 'gro ste /
translated: If you are killed by a bad elephant, you will not go to the three evil destinies.

original: grogs po ngan pas bas da na gdon mi za bar ngan song gsum du 'gro'o //
analyzed: grogs po ngan pas bas da na gdon mi za bar ngan song gsum du 'gro'o //
translated: But if you are killed by a bad friend, you will certainly go to the three evil destinies.

original: bal glang ngan pa la sogs pa ni lus kyi 'khor du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bal glang ngan pa la sogs pa ni lus kyi 'khor du 'gyur te /
translated: Bad elephants and so on are only a physical danger.

original: grogs po ngan pas ni dge pa'i chos kyi 'khon du 'gyur ro //
