analyzed: grogs po ngan pas ni dge pa'i chos kyi 'khon du 'gyur ro //
translated: But bad friends are a danger to the Dharma.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpas grogs po ngan pa dag ring du spang bar bya'o //🔽de lta bu la sogs pa'i zag pa ni bus pa ma rabs dag mi spong bas zag pa skye'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpas grogs po ngan pa dag ring du spang bar bya'o // de lta bu la sogs pa'i zag pa ni bus pa ma rabs dag mi spong bas zag pa skye'o //
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva should avoid bad friends from afar.🔽In this way, the bodhisattva does not give rise to the defilements by abandoning them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni spong bas zag pa mi skye'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni spong bas zag pa mi skye'o //
translated: The bodhisattva does not give rise to the defilements by abandoning them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la'ang de ltar zag pa med na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la'ang de ltar zag pa med na /
translated: If the bodhisattva does not have such defilements,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lta ci smos te /
translated: how much less would the Tathagata!

original: de bas na zag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na zag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is without defilements.

original: zag pa dang nye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa dang nye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is defilement and what is near defilement?

original: bus pa ma rabs thams cad ni lus dang sems bde ba 'dod pa'i phyir gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / nad kyi rkyen sman la sogs pa @25a *//
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs thams cad ni lus dang sems bde ba 'dod pa'i phyir gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / nad kyi rkyen sman la sogs pa @25a *//
translated: All childish ordinary beings, because they desire physical and mental pleasure, accept clothing, food, bedding, medicine for the sick, and so on.

original: len to // de lta bu'i rdzas tshol zhing sdig pa rnam pa sna tshogs byas kyang nyes par mi shes pas ngan song gsum du 'khro te /
analyzed: len to // de lta bu'i rdzas tshol zhing sdig pa rnam pa sna tshogs byas kyang nyes par mi shes pas ngan song gsum du 'khro te /
translated: Even though they seek such things and commit various sins, they do not understand that they are faults, and so they wander in the three lower realms.

original: de bas na zag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na zag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called “defilements.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de lta bu'i nyes pa mthong bas rnam par spong bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de lta bu'i nyes pa mthong bas rnam par spong bar byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva, seeing such faults, abandons them.

original: gal te gos dod na'ang len mod kyi lus kyi phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gos dod na'ang len mod kyi lus kyi phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: Even if they obtain clothing, they accept it, but not for the sake of the body.

original: chos 'ba' zhig gi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos 'ba' zhig gi phyir ro //
translated: It is only for the sake of the Dharma.

original: nga rgyal dang dregs pa mi skyed par rtag tu dma' ba'i sems dang / rgyan dang / bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang dregs pa mi skyed par rtag tu dma' ba'i sems dang / rgyan dang / bzang po 'dod pa'i phyir ni ma yin gyi /
translated: They do not give rise to pride and arrogance, but always have a humble mind. It is not for the sake of ornaments or good things.

original: ngo tsha ba dang / tsha ba dang / grang ba dang / rlung dang / char ba drag po dang / mchu smyung dang / sbrang bu dang / gdug pa dag gis zos kyis dogs pa'i skyabs bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang / tsha ba dang / grang ba dang / rlung dang / char ba drag po dang / mchu smyung dang / sbrang bu dang / gdug pa dag gis zos kyis dogs pa'i skyabs bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: to protect against shame, heat, cold, wind, rain, hail, mosquitoes, and poisonous insects.

original: bca' ba dang / bza' ba len kyang chags pa'i sems med la lus kyi phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bca' ba dang / bza' ba len kyang chags pa'i sems med la lus kyi phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: When accepting food and drink, they do so without a greedy mind, not for the sake of the body,

original: rtag tu dam pa'i chos kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu dam pa'i chos kyi phyir ro //
translated: but always for the sake of the holy Dharma.

original: nyam tshag gi phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyam tshag gi phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not for the sake of pleasure,

original: sems can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi phyir ro //
translated: but for the sake of sentient beings.

original: nga rgyal dang dregs pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang dregs pa'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not for the sake of pride and arrogance,

original: lus dang stobs kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang stobs kyi phyir ro //
translated: but for the sake of physical strength.

original: 'khon pa dang dgra'i phyir ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'khon pa dang dgra'i phyir ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not for the sake of enmity and hatred,

original: bkres pa'i rma gso ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkres pa'i rma gso ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but for the sake of healing the wounds of hunger.

original: ro dam pa rnyed kyang de la chags pa'i sems med do //
analyzed: ro dam pa rnyed kyang de la chags pa'i sems med do //
translated: Even if they find the most delicious food, they have no greedy mind for it.

original: gnas khang dag len pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gnas khang dag len pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Accepting dwellings is the same:

original: chags pa dang dregs pas kun nas nyon mongs par gnas par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: chags pa dang dregs pas kun nas nyon mongs par gnas par mi byed kyi /
translated: they do not dwell in a state of defilement through attachment and arrogance.

original: byang chub kyi gnas su bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi gnas su bya ste /
translated: He takes up residence in the place of enlightenment.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pa dang / @25b rlung dang char drag po'i gnas kyi phyir gnas khang len to //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pa dang / @25b rlung dang char drag po'i gnas kyi phyir gnas khang len to //
translated: He takes up residence in the place of the enemy, the afflictions, and in the place of the storm and rain of the Dharma.

original: nad kyi rkyen sman tshol ba la'ang chags pa'i sems med de /
analyzed: nad kyi rkyen sman tshol ba la'ang chags pa'i sems med de /
translated: He does not seek medicine with a greedy mind.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi phyir gyi srog 'tsho ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi phyir gyi srog 'tsho ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: He does not seek the holy Dharma for the sake of his life,

original: 'tsho ba rtag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'tsho ba rtag par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but for the sake of his eternal life.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: dper na / shu ba'i nad kyis btab pa phye dang mar gyis bskus te /
analyzed: dper na / shu ba'i nad kyis btab pa phye dang mar gyis bskus te /
translated: it is like a man afflicted with leprosy who anoints himself with sesame oil

original: gos kyi dkris shing rag dang khrag byung ba la shu ba sos par 'dod pa'i phyir sman gyis byugs te /
analyzed: gos kyi dkris shing rag dang khrag byung ba la shu ba sos par 'dod pa'i phyir sman gyis byugs te /
translated: and, in order to cure his leprosy, wraps himself in a woolen blanket.🔽In order to let the wind out, he enters a deep house.

original: rlung btsa' ba'i phyir khang pa zab mor 'dug pa dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rlung btsa' ba'i phyir khang pa zab mor 'dug pa dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva is like that.

original: lus la rma lta bur rtog cing gos kyis g-yogs pa dang / bu ga dgu nas rang zag pa'i phyir zas tshol ba dang / rlung dang char drag po'i skyabs kyi phyir gnas khang len pa dang / dug rnam pa bzhi'i phyir sman tshol ba ste /
analyzed: lus la rma lta bur rtog cing gos kyis g-yogs pa dang / bu ga dgu nas rang zag pa'i phyir zas tshol ba dang / rlung dang char drag po'i skyabs kyi phyir gnas khang len pa dang / dug rnam pa bzhi'i phyir sman tshol ba ste /
translated: He conceives of the body as a wound and covers it with clothing, he seeks food in order to heal the nine orifices that secrete, he accepts a dwelling in order to avoid wind and rain, and he seeks medicine in order to avoid the four kinds of poison.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yo byad rnam pa bzhi len pa'ang byang chub kyi lam gyi phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yo byad rnam pa bzhi len pa'ang byang chub kyi lam gyi phyir te /
translated: The bodhisattva accepts the four kinds of necessities for the sake of the path to enlightenment,

original: 'tsho ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: not for the sake of life.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di snyam du gal te bdag gis yo byad rnam pa bzhi 'di ma blangs na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'di snyam du gal te bdag gis yo byad rnam pa bzhi 'di ma blangs na /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva thinks like this: “If I do not accept these four kinds of necessities,

original: lus med cing mi brtan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus med cing mi brtan par 'gyur ro //
translated: the body will be without strength and unstable.

original: gal te mi brtan par gyur na sdug bsngal mi bzod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi brtan par gyur na sdug bsngal mi bzod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is unstable, I will be unable to endure suffering.

original: gal te sdug bsngal mi bzod par gyur na dge pa'i chos thams cad yongs su spyod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal mi bzod par gyur na dge pa'i chos thams cad yongs su spyod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If I am unable to endure suffering, I will not be able to practice all virtuous dharmas.”

original: gal te sdug bsngal bzod na dge ba'i chos tshad med pa sgom par 'gyur ro //🔽gal te bdag @26a *//
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal bzod na dge ba'i chos tshad med pa sgom par 'gyur ro // gal te bdag @26a *//
translated: If one can endure suffering, one can cultivate immeasurable virtuous qualities.🔽If one cannot endure suffering,

original: sdug bsngal la bzod mi nus na sdug bsngal myong ba la zhe sdang gi sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bzod mi nus na sdug bsngal myong ba la zhe sdang gi sems skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one will give rise to a mind of hatred toward the experience of suffering.

original: bde ba myong ba la chags pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bde ba myong ba la chags pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: One will give rise to a mind of attachment toward the experience of happiness.

original: gal te bde ba tshol ba las ma rnyed na ma rig pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te bde ba tshol ba las ma rnyed na ma rig pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one seeks happiness but does not obtain it, ignorance will arise.

original: de bas na bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bo ni yo byad rnam pa bzhi las zag pa skye bar gyur to //
analyzed: de bas na bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bo ni yo byad rnam pa bzhi las zag pa skye bar gyur to //
translated: Thus, the childish and ordinary beings give rise to defilements due to four kinds of objects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rab tu rtog cing rtogs pas zag pa mi skyed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rab tu rtog cing rtogs pas zag pa mi skyed do //
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, through thorough understanding and realization, do not give rise to defilements.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' la'ang zag pa med pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' la'ang zag pa med pa zhes bya na /
translated: Therefore, even bodhisattvas are called 'without defilements.'

original: ci ste de bzhin gshegs pa la zag pa mnga' ba'o zhes bya /
analyzed: ci ste de bzhin gshegs pa la zag pa mnga' ba'o zhes bya /
translated: How can it be said that the Tathāgata has defilements?

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa la ni zag pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa la ni zag pa mi mnga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is called 'without defilements.'

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of good family!

original: bus pa ma rabs thams cad ni lus dang sems shin tu srung yang mi dge ba'i rtog pa rnam pa gsum skye'o //
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs thams cad ni lus dang sems shin tu srung yang mi dge ba'i rtog pa rnam pa gsum skye'o //
translated: All childish ordinary beings, even though they protect their bodies and minds, give rise to three kinds of unwholesome thoughts.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis nyon mongs pa yongs su bcad de /
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis nyon mongs pa yongs su bcad de /
translated: Because of those causes and conditions, they do not eliminate the afflictions.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi gnas su skyes kyang phyir ngan song gsum du ltung ngo //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min gyi gnas su skyes kyang phyir ngan song gsum du ltung ngo //
translated: Even if they are born in the state of neither perception nor non-perception, they fall back into the three lower realms.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: dper na / mi zhig rgya mtsho brgal ba pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin du nye ba las chur nub ste shi'o //
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig rgya mtsho brgal ba pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin du nye ba las chur nub ste shi'o //
translated: For example, a person who has crossed the ocean and is close to the other shore drowns and dies.

original: bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bo'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bo'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Childish ordinary beings are also like that.

original: srid pa gsum zad du nye ba las phyir yang ngan song gsum du ltung ngo //
analyzed: srid pa gsum zad du nye ba las phyir yang ngan song gsum du ltung ngo //
translated: Even though they are close to exhausting the three existences, they fall back into the three lower realms.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dge ba'i rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they lack wholesome thoughts.

original: dge ba'i rtog pa zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtog pa zhes bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What are called wholesome thoughts?

original: 'di @26b lta ste; dran pa nye bar bzhag pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di @26b lta ste; dran pa nye bar bzhag pa drug go /
translated: They are the six close mindfulnesses.

original: bus pa ma rabs dge ba'i sems ni zhan gyi /
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs dge ba'i sems ni zhan gyi /
translated: The minds of the ignorant and the childish are weak in virtue,

original: mi dge ba ni rab tu 'bar ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni rab tu 'bar ro //
translated: but their nonvirtue blazes.

original: dge ba'i sems zhan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi sems srab par gyur to; ;shes rab kyi sems srab pas zag pa thams cad skye zhing 'phel bar gyur to //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems zhan pa'i phyir shes rab kyi sems srab par gyur to; ;shes rab kyi sems srab pas zag pa thams cad skye zhing 'phel bar gyur to //
translated: Because their minds are weak in virtue, their minds of wisdom are thin. Because their minds of wisdom are thin, all their defilements increase and grow.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi mig yongs su dag pas rtog pa gsum gyi skyon mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni shes rab kyi mig yongs su dag pas rtog pa gsum gyi skyon mthong ngo //
translated: “The bodhisattva-mahāsattva, with the pure eye of wisdom, sees the faults of the three kinds of conceptualization.

original: rtog pa rnam pa gsum po 'di ni skyon rnam pa sna tshogs dang bcas pas rtag tu sems can gyi theg pa gsum gyi dgra yin par rtogs so //
analyzed: rtog pa rnam pa gsum po 'di ni skyon rnam pa sna tshogs dang bcas pas rtag tu sems can gyi theg pa gsum gyi dgra yin par rtogs so //
translated: These three kinds of conceptualization are always the enemy of the three vehicles of sentient beings because they are accompanied by various faults.

original: rtog pa gsum po 'di'i rgyu 'di'i rkyen gyis sems can ma rabs tshad med pa snyed sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi mthong bar byed cing bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du log pa'i sems bskyed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtog pa gsum po 'di'i rgyu 'di'i rkyen gyis sems can ma rabs tshad med pa snyed sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi mthong bar byed cing bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du log pa'i sems bskyed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Because of the causes and conditions of these three kinds of conceptualization, countless ignorant sentient beings do not see the buddha-nature and give rise to wrong thoughts for countless eons.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag ces bya ba med kyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag ces bya ba med kyi /
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, is not permanent, blissful, or a self.

original: yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig yod do //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig yod do //
translated: He is only completely pure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gtan yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gtan yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: The Tathāgata is completely extinguished.

original: sems can thams cad la rtag pa'ang med /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la rtag pa'ang med /
translated: All sentient beings are not permanent,

original: bde ba'ang med /
analyzed: bde ba'ang med /
translated: not blissful,

original: bdag kyang med /
analyzed: bdag kyang med /
translated: not a self,

original: yongs su dag pa'ang med de /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'ang med de /
translated: and not completely pure.

original: phyin ci log gi sems kyis rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa yod do zhes smra'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi sems kyis rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa yod do zhes smra'o //
translated: With a mistaken mind, they say that there is permanence, bliss, a self, and complete purity.

original: yang dag par na theg pa gsum yang med de /
analyzed: yang dag par na theg pa gsum yang med de /
translated: In reality, there are not even three vehicles.

original: phyin ci log pa'i sems kyis theg pa gsum yod do zhes smra'o //🔽bden pa'i lam gcig pu ni yang dag par @27a *//
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i sems kyis theg pa gsum yod do zhes smra'o // bden pa'i lam gcig pu ni yang dag par @27a *//
translated: With a mistaken mind, they say that there are three vehicles.

original: bden pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa ste /
translated: The path of the truth is the only true one.

original: phyin ci log pa'i sems kyis bden pa gcig kyang med pa smra'i /
analyzed: phyin ci log pa'i sems kyis bden pa gcig kyang med pa smra'i /
translated: With a mistaken mind, they say that there is not even one truth.

original: mi dge ba'i rtog pa rnam pa gsum la ni rtag tu sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su smad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtog pa rnam pa gsum la ni rtag tu sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su smad pa yin no //
translated: The three kinds of unwholesome thoughts are always despised by the Buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: mi dge ba'i yongs su rtog pa gsum po 'di ni rtag tu bdag dang / gzhan la'ang rab tu 'tshe'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i yongs su rtog pa gsum po 'di ni rtag tu bdag dang / gzhan la'ang rab tu 'tshe'o //
translated: These three kinds of unwholesome thoughts always harm both oneself and others.

original: rtog pa gsum po 'di yod pas mi dge ba thams cad rtag tu phyi bzhin du 'brang bar gyur to //
analyzed: rtog pa gsum po 'di yod pas mi dge ba thams cad rtag tu phyi bzhin du 'brang bar gyur to //
translated: Because of these three kinds of thoughts, all unwholesomeness always follows after one.

original: rtog pa gsum po 'di nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtog pa gsum po 'di nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: These three kinds of thoughts become the three kinds of afflictions,

original: sems can gyi 'khor ba mtha' yas pa snyed kyi mtshams sbyor ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'khor ba mtha' yas pa snyed kyi mtshams sbyor ro //
translated: and they connect to the endless transmigrations of sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di ltar rtog pa gsum la rtag tu yongs su rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'di ltar rtog pa gsum la rtag tu yongs su rtog go /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva always contemplates these three kinds of thoughts in this way.

original: byang chub sems dpas gal te rgyu dang rkyen zhig gis 'dod pa'i rtog pa skyes na cang mi smra bar mi len to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gal te rgyu dang rkyen zhig gis 'dod pa'i rtog pa skyes na cang mi smra bar mi len to //
translated: If the bodhisattva, due to causes and conditions, gives rise to thoughts of desire, he does not remain silent and accept them.

original: dper na / mi rab tu bzang zhing gtsang sbra che ba ni lud dang / mi gtsang ba thams cad mi len to //
analyzed: dper na / mi rab tu bzang zhing gtsang sbra che ba ni lud dang / mi gtsang ba thams cad mi len to //
translated: For example, a person who is very good and clean will not accept any filth or impurities.

original: me mur rab tu 'bar ba la ni su'ang lag gis mi len to //
analyzed: me mur rab tu 'bar ba la ni su'ang lag gis mi len to //
translated: No one would touch a blazing fire.

original: bram ze ni rang bzhin gyis ba lang gi sha dang mi 'bags so //
analyzed: bram ze ni rang bzhin gyis ba lang gi sha dang mi 'bags so //
translated: Brahmins by nature do not eat beef.

original: ji ltar 'grangs pa dag ni zas ngan pa mi chud do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'grangs pa dag ni zas ngan pa mi chud do //
translated: Those who are full do not eat bad food.

original: ji ltar 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po ni gdol pa rigs ngan thams cad dang stan gcig la mi 'dug pa dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtog pa gsum mi len cing myong bar mi byed pa'ang de @27b dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po ni gdol pa rigs ngan thams cad dang stan gcig la mi 'dug pa dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtog pa gsum mi len cing myong bar mi byed pa'ang de @27b dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as a universal monarch does not sit on the same seat as any outcastes or low-caste people, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not accept or experience the three thoughts.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The bodhisattva thinks like this:

original: sems can thams cad kyis bdag la bsod nams kyi zhing yin par shes na bdag gis ji ltar mi dge ba'i chos 'di dag spyod par bya /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis bdag la bsod nams kyi zhing yin par shes na bdag gis ji ltar mi dge ba'i chos 'di dag spyod par bya /
translated: “If all sentient beings know that I am a field of merit, how could I engage in these non-virtuous dharmas?

original: gal te mi dge ba'i rtog pa de dag spyod na sems can gyi bsod nams kyi zhing du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mi dge ba'i rtog pa de dag spyod na sems can gyi bsod nams kyi zhing du mi rung ngo //
translated: If I were to act on these unwholesome thoughts, I would not be a field of merit for sentient beings.

original: bdag la bdag gis bsod nams kyi zhing yin no zhes ma byas kyang sems can gyis tshul 'di bltas nas bdag la bsod nams kyi zhing yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bdag la bdag gis bsod nams kyi zhing yin no zhes ma byas kyang sems can gyis tshul 'di bltas nas bdag la bsod nams kyi zhing yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Even if I do not think of myself as a field of merit, sentient beings, seeing this way of being, will say that I am a field of merit.

original: bdag gis da gal te mi dge ba'i rtog pa de lta bu bskyed na sems can thams cad bslus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis da gal te mi dge ba'i rtog pa de lta bu bskyed na sems can thams cad bslus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If I were now to give rise to such unwholesome thoughts, I would be deceiving all sentient beings.

original: bdag sngon yang bslus pas bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du 'khor bar 'khor te /
analyzed: bdag sngon yang bslus pas bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du 'khor bar 'khor te /
translated: In the past, I was deceived and for immeasurable eons I wandered in saṃsāra,

original: ngan song gsum du ltung bar gyur to //
analyzed: ngan song gsum du ltung bar gyur to //
translated: falling into the three lower realms.

original: bdag gis gal te mi dge ba'i sems kyis sbyin bdag dad pa'i byin pa blangs na lha dang / mi dang / drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa thams cad kyis dbang byas shing smad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis gal te mi dge ba'i sems kyis sbyin bdag dad pa'i byin pa blangs na lha dang / mi dang / drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa thams cad kyis dbang byas shing smad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If I were to accept the offerings of faithful donors with an unwholesome mind, I would be controlled and disparaged by all gods, humans, and sages endowed with the five superknowledges.

original: bdag gis gal te mi dge ba'i rtog pas sbyin bdag dad pas byin pa blangs sam /
analyzed: bdag gis gal te mi dge ba'i rtog pas sbyin bdag dad pas byin pa blangs sam /
translated: If I were to take the offerings of faithful donors with unwholesome thoughts,

original: gal te sbyin bdag gi 'bras bu chung bar gyur tam /
analyzed: gal te sbyin bdag gi 'bras bu chung bar gyur tam /
translated: if the donors’ rewards were to be small,

original: 'bras bu'i don med par gyur tam /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i don med par gyur tam /
translated: if their rewards were to be nonexistent,

original: bdag gis gal te mi dge ba'i sems kyis sbyin bdag gis byin pa blangs na sbyin bdag dad pa'i dgrar 'gyur ro //🔽sbyin bdag thams cad kyis bdag la bu gcig pa bzhin du 'du shes bskyed na bdag gis ci'i @28a *//
analyzed: bdag gis gal te mi dge ba'i sems kyis sbyin bdag gis byin pa blangs na sbyin bdag dad pa'i dgrar 'gyur ro // sbyin bdag thams cad kyis bdag la bu gcig pa bzhin du 'du shes bskyed na bdag gis ci'i @28a *//
translated: if I were to take the offerings of faithful donors with an unwholesome mind, I would be an enemy to the donors.

original: phyir de dag la slu zhing dgrar 'du shes bskyed /
analyzed: phyir de dag la slu zhing dgrar 'du shes bskyed /
translated: If all donors were to think of me as their only child, why would I deceive them and think of them as enemies?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sbyin bdag gis 'bras bu ma thob pa'am /
analyzed: sbyin bdag gis 'bras bu ma thob pa'am /
translated: If donors do not obtain rewards,

original: 'bras bu chung bar gyur na rtag tu bdag ni rab tu byung ba zhes brjod pa'ang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'bras bu chung bar gyur na rtag tu bdag ni rab tu byung ba zhes brjod pa'ang mi rung ngo //
translated: or if their rewards are small, it is not right to say that I am always an ascetic.

original: rab tu byung ba ni mi dge ba skyed pa'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni mi dge ba skyed pa'i mi rigs so //
translated: It is not right for an ascetic to give rise to unwholesomeness.

original: gal te mi dge ba skyed na rab tu byung ba zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mi dge ba skyed na rab tu byung ba zhes mi bya'o //
translated: If one gives rise to unwholesomeness, one is not called an ascetic.

original: rab tu byung ba ni lus dang ngag tu ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni lus dang ngag tu ldan pa'o //
translated: The one who has gone forth is endowed with body and speech.

original: gal te mi ldan na rab tu byung ba zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mi ldan na rab tu byung ba zhes mi bya'o //
translated: If one is not endowed with them, one is not called one who has gone forth.

original: bdag pha ma dang / phu nu dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / gnyen bshes thams cad btang ste rab tu byung nas lam bsgom pa 'di dge ba'i rtog pa rnams yongs su bsgom pa'i dus la bab kyi /
analyzed: bdag pha ma dang / phu nu dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / gnyen bshes thams cad btang ste rab tu byung nas lam bsgom pa 'di dge ba'i rtog pa rnams yongs su bsgom pa'i dus la bab kyi /
translated: I have given up my father, mother, brothers, wife, children, and all my relatives. I have gone forth and am cultivating the path. This is the time to cultivate wholesome thoughts.

original: mi dge ba'i rtog pa bsgom pa'i dus ni ma yin no //🔽dper na / mi la la zhig rgya mtshor zhugs te rin po che tshol ba las rin po che yang dag pa ni mi len par chu shel len pa dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtog pa bsgom pa'i dus ni ma yin no // dper na / mi la la zhig rgya mtshor zhugs te rin po che tshol ba las rin po che yang dag pa ni mi len par chu shel len pa dang mtshungs so //
translated: This is not the time to cultivate unwholesome thoughts.🔽It is like someone who has gone to sea in search of jewels, but instead of taking the real jewels, takes only water-crystals.

original: gzhan yang la la zhig rol mo dam pa spong zhing lud dang mi gtsang pa'i gnas su rtse ba dang / ji ltar rin po che'i bu mo bor te bran mo dang nyal ba dang / ji ltar gser gyi snod spangs te kham phor spyod pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang la la zhig rol mo dam pa spong zhing lud dang mi gtsang pa'i gnas su rtse ba dang / ji ltar rin po che'i bu mo bor te bran mo dang nyal ba dang / ji ltar gser gyi snod spangs te kham phor spyod pa dang /
translated: It is like someone who abandons the best music and delights in the sounds of farting, or like someone who abandons a precious jewel and sleeps with a servant, or like someone who abandons a golden vessel and uses a clay one instead.

original: ji ltar bdud rtsi spong zhing dug 'thung ba dang / ji ltar mdza' zhing nye ba'i sman pa mkhas pa spangs te dgra dang 'khon du gyur pa'i sman pa ma rungs pa las sman len cing 'thung ba dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar bdud rtsi spong zhing dug 'thung ba dang / ji ltar mdza' zhing nye ba'i sman pa mkhas pa spangs te dgra dang 'khon du gyur pa'i sman pa ma rungs pa las sman len cing 'thung ba dang mtshungs te /
translated: It is like rejecting nectar and drinking poison, and like rejecting a skilled and loving physician and taking medicine from a quack doctor, an enemy and a source of resentment.

original: bdag kyang de dang 'dra bar ston pa chen po sangs rgyas @28b bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi ro bdud rtsi dang 'dra ba spangs shing /
analyzed: bdag kyang de dang 'dra bar ston pa chen po sangs rgyas @28b bcom ldan 'das kyi chos kyi ro bdud rtsi dang 'dra ba spangs shing /
translated: I am like that, having rejected the nectar-like Dharma of the great teacher, the Bhagavan Buddha,

original: bdud kyi mi dge ba'i rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'thung ba dang 'dra'o //🔽mi'i lus shin tu rnyed dka' ba med tog au dumba ra dang 'dra ba ni bdag gis da thob par gyur /
analyzed: bdud kyi mi dge ba'i rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs 'thung ba dang 'dra'o // mi'i lus shin tu rnyed dka' ba med tog au dumba ra dang 'dra ba ni bdag gis da thob par gyur /
translated: I am like someone who drinks the various nonvirtuous thoughts of Mara.🔽I have now obtained a human body, so difficult to find, which is like the udumbara flower.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang phrad dka' ba med tog au dumba ra dang 'dra ba ni da bdag gis phrad par gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang phrad dka' ba med tog au dumba ra dang 'dra ba ni da bdag gis phrad par gyur /
translated: I have now met the Tathagata, so difficult to meet, who is like the udumbara flower.

original: rnam par dag pa'i chos dkon mchog mthong ba dang thos pa dka' ba ni ji ltar rus sbal long ba gnya' shing gi bu ga dang phrad pa dang 'dra ba ni bdag gis da thos par gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i chos dkon mchog mthong ba dang thos pa dka' ba ni ji ltar rus sbal long ba gnya' shing gi bu ga dang phrad pa dang 'dra ba ni bdag gis da thos par gyur te /
translated: The pure and precious Dharma is difficult to see and hear, just like a blind turtle rising to the surface of the ocean to meet a yoke floating on the sea.

original: mi'i tshe mi sdod pa ni ri gzar po'i shva bas mgyogs te /
analyzed: mi'i tshe mi sdod pa ni ri gzar po'i shva bas mgyogs te /
translated: Human life does not last long, like a waterfall on a steep mountain.

original: deng yod kyang sang yod par mi mngon na ci'i phyir sems phyal par mi dge ba'i chos la gnas /
analyzed: deng yod kyang sang yod par mi mngon na ci'i phyir sems phyal par mi dge ba'i chos la gnas /
translated: If I am here today, it is not certain that I will be here tomorrow. Why, then, should I be careless and indulge in nonvirtue?

original: lang tsho yang mi sdod pa ni rtag rgyug pa bas kyang mgyogs na ci ste de la bsnyems shing nga rgyal dang dregs pa skyed /
analyzed: lang tsho yang mi sdod pa ni rtag rgyug pa bas kyang mgyogs na ci ste de la bsnyems shing nga rgyal dang dregs pa skyed /
translated: Youth does not last long, it passes faster than a galloping horse. Why, then, should I be conceited, arrogant, and proud?

original: ji ltar yi dvags ma rungs pa mi la skabs chol ba ltar chen po bzhi'i yi dvags kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar yi dvags ma rungs pa mi la skabs chol ba ltar chen po bzhi'i yi dvags kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as a malicious ghost looks for an opportunity to harm a person, the four great elements are also like that.

original: rtag tu bdag la nyes pa'i skabs tshol na ci ste mi dge ba'i rtog pa bskyed par bya /
analyzed: rtag tu bdag la nyes pa'i skabs tshol na ci ste mi dge ba'i rtog pa bskyed par bya /
translated: They are always looking for an opportunity to harm me. Why, then, should I generate nonvirtuous thoughts?

original: dper na / khang pa rul pa rdib tu nye ba dang 'dra bar bdag gi tshe yang de dang 'dra na ci'i phyir mi dge ba bskyed /
analyzed: dper na / khang pa rul pa rdib tu nye ba dang 'dra bar bdag gi tshe yang de dang 'dra na ci'i phyir mi dge ba bskyed /
translated: If my life is like that, why would I generate nonvirtue?

original: bdag ni dge sbyong zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag ni dge sbyong zhes bya ste /
translated: I am called an ascetic.

original: dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtog pa la rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtog pa la rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: An ascetic is called one who contemplates virtuous thoughts.

original: bdag gis da mi dge ba'i rtog pa bskyed na dge sbyong zhes ji skad gdags /
analyzed: bdag gis da mi dge ba'i rtog pa bskyed na dge sbyong zhes ji skad gdags /
translated: If I now generate nonvirtuous thoughts, how can I be called an ascetic?

original: bdag ni rab tu byung ba zhes bya ste /🔽rab tu byung ba ni dge ba'i lam bsgom @29a *//
analyzed: bdag ni rab tu byung ba zhes bya ste / rab tu byung ba ni dge ba'i lam bsgom @29a *//
translated: I am called one who has gone forth.

original: pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pa zhes bya ste /
translated: One who has gone forth is called one who cultivates the path of virtue.

original: bdag gis da mi dge ba spyod na ji ltar rab tu byung ba zhes bya /
analyzed: bdag gis da mi dge ba spyod na ji ltar rab tu byung ba zhes bya /
translated: If I now engage in nonvirtue, how can I be called one who has gone forth?

original: bdag ni bram ze zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag ni bram ze zhes bya ste /
translated: I am called a brahmin.

original: bram ze zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bram ze zhes bya ba ni tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: A brahmin is one who practices pure conduct.

original: bdag gis mi tshangs pa mi dge ba'i rtog pa spyod na /
analyzed: bdag gis mi tshangs pa mi dge ba'i rtog pa spyod na /
translated: If I engage in impure, nonvirtuous thoughts,

original: ji ltar bram ze zhes bya /
analyzed: ji ltar bram ze zhes bya /
translated: how can I be called a brahmin?

original: bdag ni rgyal rigs chen po zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: bdag ni rgyal rigs chen po zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: I am also called a great kṣatriya.

original: rgyal rigs zhes bya ba ni dgra thul ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyal rigs zhes bya ba ni dgra thul ba yin no //
translated: The so-called kṣatriya is one who conquers enemies.

original: bdag da mi dge ba'i dgra mi thul na /
analyzed: bdag da mi dge ba'i dgra mi thul na /
translated: If I am unable to conquer the enemy of nonvirtue,

original: ji ltar rgyal rigs zhes bya /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal rigs zhes bya /
translated: how can I be called a kṣatriya?

original: bdag ni dge slong zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: bdag ni dge slong zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: I am also called a bhikṣu.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa 'joms pa zhes bya na bdag deng mi dge ba'i rtog pa nyon mongs pa ma bcom na ji ltar dge slong zhes gdags /
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa 'joms pa zhes bya na bdag deng mi dge ba'i rtog pa nyon mongs pa ma bcom na ji ltar dge slong zhes gdags /
translated: The so-called bhikṣu is one who conquers the afflictions. If I am unable to conquer the afflictions of unwholesome thoughts, how can I be called a bhikṣu?

original: 'jig rten na rnam pa 'di drug ni shin tu phrad par dka' ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na rnam pa 'di drug ni shin tu phrad par dka' ste /
translated: In the world, these six things are extremely difficult to encounter:

original: bdag gis da phrad par gyur na ci'i phyir mi dge ba'i rtog pa sems la gnas par bya /
analyzed: bdag gis da phrad par gyur na ci'i phyir mi dge ba'i rtog pa sems la gnas par bya /
translated: If I have now encountered them, why should I allow unwholesome thoughts to remain in my mind?

original: rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽The arising of a Buddha in the world is difficult to encounter, hearing the true Dharma is difficult, giving rise to a fearful mind is difficult, being born in the central land is difficult, obtaining a human body is difficult,

original: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba phrad par dka' ba dang / dam pa'i chos thos par dka' ba dang / 'jigs pa'i sems skye bar dka' ba dang / yul gyi dbus su skye bar dka' ba dang / mi'i lus thob par dka' ba dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ba phrad par dka' ba dang / dam pa'i chos thos par dka' ba dang / 'jigs pa'i sems skye bar dka' ba dang / yul gyi dbus su skye bar dka' ba dang / mi'i lus thob par dka' ba dang /
translated: and being born in a time when the Dharma is taught is difficult.

original: dbang po rnams dang ldan par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams dang ldan par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to be endowed with the faculties.

original: de lta bu'i dngos po rnam pa drug thob par dka' ba ni thob par gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dngos po rnam pa drug thob par dka' ba ni thob par gyur te /
translated: “It is difficult to obtain such six kinds of things, but I have obtained them.

original: de bas na mi dge ba'i rtog pa bskyed pa'i mi rigs so snyam sems so //
analyzed: de bas na mi dge ba'i rtog pa bskyed pa'i mi rigs so snyam sems so //
translated: Therefore, it is not right to give rise to unwholesome thoughts.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i @29b mdo la nan tan byed pa ni rtag tu mi dge ba'i sems la brtson 'grus su rab tu rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i @29b mdo la nan tan byed pa ni rtag tu mi dge ba'i sems la brtson 'grus su rab tu rtog go /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva thus practices the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra and always diligently contemplates unwholesome thoughts.

original: bus pa ma rabs thams cad ni de lta bu'i mi dge ba'i sems kyi skyon mi mthong bas rtog pa gsum len te /
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs thams cad ni de lta bu'i mi dge ba'i sems kyi skyon mi mthong bas rtog pa gsum len te /
translated: All foolish ordinary people do not see the faults of such unwholesome thoughts and give rise to three kinds of thoughts.

original: de bas na zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na zag pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called those with outflows.

original: byang chub sems dpas mthong nas mi len /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas mthong nas mi len /
translated: The bodhisattva sees and does not accept them.

original: mi chags / yongs su gtong zhing mi srung la /
analyzed: mi chags / yongs su gtong zhing mi srung la /
translated: He is not attached, gives them up, and does not protect them.

original: 'phags pa'i lam brgyad la brten te skrod pa dang yongs su gcod par byed de /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam brgyad la brten te skrod pa dang yongs su gcod par byed de /
translated: Relying on the eightfold noble path, he expels and completely eliminates them.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' yang zag pa mi len na /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' yang zag pa mi len na /
translated: Therefore, if the bodhisattva does not take on the outflows,

original: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la zag pa yod ces smra /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la zag pa yod ces smra /
translated: why do you say that the Tathāgata has outflows?

original: don de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don de lta bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
translated: For this reason, the Tathāgata is not one who has outflows.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: bus pa ma rabs ni gal te lus dang sems la sdug bsngal gyis gdungs na mi dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs skye'o //
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs ni gal te lus dang sems la sdug bsngal gyis gdungs na mi dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs skye'o //
translated: The childish and ignorant, if their bodies and minds are tormented by suffering, give rise to various kinds of nonvirtue.

original: gal te lus na'am /
analyzed: gal te lus na'am /
translated: If their bodies are sick

original: sems na na lus dang ngag dang yid kyis mi dge ba'i las rnam pa sna tshogs byed do //
analyzed: sems na na lus dang ngag dang yid kyis mi dge ba'i las rnam pa sna tshogs byed do //
translated: or their minds are sick, they do various kinds of nonvirtuous actions with their bodies, speech, and minds.

original: mi dge ba byas pas ngan song gsum du 'khor zhing sdug bsngal rdzogs par myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: mi dge ba byas pas ngan song gsum du 'khor zhing sdug bsngal rdzogs par myong bar gyur to //
translated: Because of doing nonvirtue, they wander in the three lower realms and fully experience suffering.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bus pa ma rabs ni dran pa dang shes rab med pa'i phyir zag pa rnam pa sna tshogs skyes te de ni dran pa'i zag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs ni dran pa dang shes rab med pa'i phyir zag pa rnam pa sna tshogs skyes te de ni dran pa'i zag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the childish and ignorant, lacking mindfulness and wisdom, give rise to various kinds of outflows. This is called the outflow of mindfulness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rtag tu 'di snyam du bdag sngon bskal pa grangs med pa'i bar du lus dang sems 'di'i dbang gis mi dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs byas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rtag tu 'di snyam du bdag sngon bskal pa grangs med pa'i bar du lus dang sems 'di'i dbang gis mi dge ba rnam pa sna tshogs byas so //
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva always thinks like this: “In the past, for countless eons, because of this body and mind, I have committed various non-virtuous actions.

original: de ltar byas pa'i rgyu dang rkyen @30a *//
analyzed: de ltar byas pa'i rgyu dang rkyen @30a *//
translated: Because of the causes and conditions of such actions,

original: gyis 'khor bar rab tu 'khor te /
analyzed: gyis 'khor bar rab tu 'khor te /
translated: I have been wandering in saṃsāra.

original: ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal mang po rdzogs par myong zhing bdag theg pa gsum gyi lam las thag ring du byas so snyam bsams nas /
analyzed: ngan song gsum du sdug bsngal mang po rdzogs par myong zhing bdag theg pa gsum gyi lam las thag ring du byas so snyam bsams nas /
translated: I have experienced the sufferings of the three lower realms, and I have distanced myself from the path of the three vehicles.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i rgyu /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i rgyu /
translated: The bodhisattva, because of this cause and condition,

original: de'i rkyen gyis bdag gis lus dang sems la rab tu 'jigs pa chen po bskyed de /
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis bdag gis lus dang sems la rab tu 'jigs pa chen po bskyed de /
translated: generates great fear towards his own body and mind.

original: mi dge ba mang po yongs su spong zhing dge ba'i lam la rab tu 'jug go /
analyzed: mi dge ba mang po yongs su spong zhing dge ba'i lam la rab tu 'jug go /
translated: He completely abandons many non-virtuous actions and enters the path of virtue.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / rgyal po zhig gis sbrul gdug pa bzhi snod gcig gi nang du bcug nas mi zhig bsrung zhing bsnyod pa dang; bsnyal ba dang / bslang ba dang / bkru ba la sogs pa'i las byed du bcug go /
analyzed: dper na / rgyal po zhig gis sbrul gdug pa bzhi snod gcig gi nang du bcug nas mi zhig bsrung zhing bsnyod pa dang; bsnyal ba dang / bslang ba dang / bkru ba la sogs pa'i las byed du bcug go /
translated: It is like the story of the king who put four poisonous snakes in a box and ordered a man to take care of them, to feed and water them, to take them out and dust them, and to put them back in the box again.

original: gal te sbrul de las gcig khros par gyur na ngas khrims bzhin du mi mang po 'dus pa'i nang du bsad do zhes bsgo'o //
analyzed: gal te sbrul de las gcig khros par gyur na ngas khrims bzhin du mi mang po 'dus pa'i nang du bsad do zhes bsgo'o //
translated: He warned the man that if one of the snakes became angry, he would behead him in the marketplace.

original: de nas mi des rgyal pos bsgo ba thos nas shin tu skrag pa'i sems skyes te sbrul gyi snod bor nas bros so //
analyzed: de nas mi des rgyal pos bsgo ba thos nas shin tu skrag pa'i sems skyes te sbrul gyi snod bor nas bros so //
translated: When the man heard the king’s order, he was terrified. He threw down the box and ran away.

original: de nas rgyal pos rigs ngan gdol pa ral gri thogs pa lnga phyi bzhin du snyegs su bkye'o //
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos rigs ngan gdol pa ral gri thogs pa lnga phyi bzhin du snyegs su bkye'o //
translated: The king then ordered five low-caste men with swords to pursue him.

original: mi des phyir bltas pa dang / phyi nas mi lnga 'ong ba mthong nas de bas kyang myur bar song ngo //
analyzed: mi des phyir bltas pa dang / phyi nas mi lnga 'ong ba mthong nas de bas kyang myur bar song ngo //
translated: When the man looked back and saw the five men coming after him, he ran even faster.

original: de nas mi lngas log pa'i thabs kyis thogs pa'i ral gri sbas nas mi gcig nye zhing mdza' ba ltar sgyus nye bar bsnyen te /
analyzed: de nas mi lngas log pa'i thabs kyis thogs pa'i ral gri sbas nas mi gcig nye zhing mdza' ba ltar sgyus nye bar bsnyen te /
translated: Then the five men, having hidden their swords under their clothes, pretended to be friends and approached the man.

original: de la 'di skad du khyod phyir shog cig ces smras so //
analyzed: de la 'di skad du khyod phyir shog cig ces smras so //
translated: They said to him, “Come back!”

original: mi des yid ma ches @30b nas gab tu 'gro ba'i phyir grong khyer zhig tu song ngo //
analyzed: mi des yid ma ches @30b nas gab tu 'gro ba'i phyir grong khyer zhig tu song ngo //
translated: The man did not believe them and went to a town to hide.

original: grong khyer du zhugs nas khang pa thams cad du bltas na mi gcig kyang mi snang la /
analyzed: grong khyer du zhugs nas khang pa thams cad du bltas na mi gcig kyang mi snang la /
translated: When he entered the town and looked in all the houses, he did not see a single person.

original: rdza ma dang snod dag gi nang du bltas na thams cad stong ste ci'ang med par mthong ngo //
analyzed: rdza ma dang snod dag gi nang du bltas na thams cad stong ste ci'ang med par mthong ngo //
translated: When he looked in the pots and vessels, he saw that they were all empty and had nothing in them.

original: des mi yang ma mthong /
analyzed: des mi yang ma mthong /
translated: He did not see a single person.

original: rdzas kyang ma rnyed nas sa la 'dug pa dang / nam mkha' stong pa las /
analyzed: rdzas kyang ma rnyed nas sa la 'dug pa dang / nam mkha' stong pa las /
translated: When he did not find any goods, he sat down on the ground, and from the empty sky

original: kye rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: kye rigs kyi bu /
translated: a voice said, “O son of noble family!

original: grong khyer stong pa 'di na mi gcig kyang mi gnas la /
analyzed: grong khyer stong pa 'di na mi gcig kyang mi gnas la /
translated: In this empty town not a single person lives.

original: do nub dgra ma rungs pa drug 'ong ngo //
analyzed: do nub dgra ma rungs pa drug 'ong ngo //
translated: Tonight six fierce enemies will come.

original: gal te khyod de dang phrad na srog gson par mi 'gyur na khyod ci ste le lo byed ces pa'i sgra grags so //
analyzed: gal te khyod de dang phrad na srog gson par mi 'gyur na khyod ci ste le lo byed ces pa'i sgra grags so //
translated: If you meet him, you will lose your life. Why are you so lazy?”

original: de nas mi de de bas kyang 'jigs skrag nas yang de nas byung ste song ba las /
analyzed: de nas mi de de bas kyang 'jigs skrag nas yang de nas byung ste song ba las /
translated: Then that man, even more frightened, went out from there.

original: lam du chu chen po zhig dang phrad do //
analyzed: lam du chu chen po zhig dang phrad do //
translated: On the road, he came to a great river.

original: chu de shin tu drag ste /
analyzed: chu de shin tu drag ste /
translated: The water was very strong,

original: gru dang gzings med mod kyi /
analyzed: gru dang gzings med mod kyi /
translated: and there were no boats or rafts.

original: 'jigs skrag pa'i phyir rtsva dang shing mang po bsdus nas gzings bcas so //
analyzed: 'jigs skrag pa'i phyir rtsva dang shing mang po bsdus nas gzings bcas so //
translated: But because of his fear, he gathered a lot of grass and wood and made a raft.

original: yang 'di snyam du bdag gal te 'dir 'dug na sbrul gdug pa dang / rigs ngan gdol pa lnga dang / sgyus nye ba gcig dang / dgra ma rungs pa drug gis gnod pas 'tshe bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du bdag gal te 'dir 'dug na sbrul gdug pa dang / rigs ngan gdol pa lnga dang / sgyus nye ba gcig dang / dgra ma rungs pa drug gis gnod pas 'tshe bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He thought, “If I stay here, I will be harmed by the five poisonous snakes, the five low-caste outcasts, the one who is deceitful, and the six fierce enemies.

original: chu 'di la rgal na'ang gzings brtan du mi rung ste /🔽chur nub cing shi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu 'di la rgal na'ang gzings brtan du mi rung ste / chur nub cing shi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if I cross this water, the raft is not secure.🔽I will sink in the water and die.

original: chur nub ste shi na'ang sla'i /
analyzed: chur nub ste shi na'ang sla'i /
translated: It is better to sink in the water and die.

original: sbrul dang dgras gtse bar mi bya'o snyam bsams nas de nas rtsva'i gzings phul te chu'i nang du bcug nas de'i steng du lus 'dug ste lag pas ni brus /
analyzed: sbrul dang dgras gtse bar mi bya'o snyam bsams nas de nas rtsva'i gzings phul te chu'i nang du bcug nas de'i steng du lus 'dug ste lag pas ni brus /
translated: Thinking, ‘I will not be harmed by snakes and enemies,’ he then took a bundle of straw, put it in the water, and sat on top of it. With his hands he dug,

original: rkang pas ni 'phras nas chu yang chod @31a *//
analyzed: rkang pas ni 'phras nas chu yang chod @31a *//
translated: and with his feet he kicked, and the water was cut off.

original: de; pha rol gyi 'gram du bde bar phyin nas sems dang yid bde bar gyur te /
analyzed: de; pha rol gyi 'gram du bde bar phyin nas sems dang yid bde bar gyur te /
translated: He safely reached the other shore, and his mind and thoughts were happy.

original: 'jigs pa dang / skrag pa med par gyur to //
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang / skrag pa med par gyur to //
translated: He was free from fear and terror.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di thos nas gzungs su 'dzin pa'ang lus la ni snod dang 'dra bar rtog /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di thos nas gzungs su 'dzin pa'ang lus la ni snod dang 'dra bar rtog /
translated: “Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas who hear this Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra and uphold it in memory should understand that the body is like a vessel,

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung la ni sbrul gdug pa bzhi lta bur rtog ste /
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung la ni sbrul gdug pa bzhi lta bur rtog ste /
translated: and that earth, water, fire, and wind are like the four poisonous snakes.

original: lta ba'i gdug pa dang / reg pa'i gdug pa dang / dbugs kyi gdug pa dang / zos pa'i gdug pa lta bur rtog go /
analyzed: lta ba'i gdug pa dang / reg pa'i gdug pa dang / dbugs kyi gdug pa dang / zos pa'i gdug pa lta bur rtog go /
translated: They should understand them as being like the poison of views, the poison of contact, the poison of breath, and the poison of ingestion.

original: sems can thams cad kyang gdug pa de bzhi dang phrad na tshe'i dus byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang gdug pa de bzhi dang phrad na tshe'i dus byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If all sentient beings were to encounter these four poisons, they would lose their lives.

original: sems can gyi chen po bzhi yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi chen po bzhi yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The four great elements of sentient beings are also like this.

original: mthong bas mi dge ba byed pa dang / reg pas mi dge ba byed pa dang / dris mi dge ba byed pa dang / zos pas mi dge ba byed de /
analyzed: mthong bas mi dge ba byed pa dang / reg pas mi dge ba byed pa dang / dris mi dge ba byed pa dang / zos pas mi dge ba byed de /
translated: They commit nonvirtuous actions through seeing, through contact, through smell, and through taste.

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis dge ba thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis dge ba thams cad spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of these causes and conditions, they abandon all that is virtuous.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbrul gdug pa bzhi rtog par rigs bzhi yod do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sbrul gdug pa bzhi rtog par rigs bzhi yod do //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva should understand that the four poisonous snakes are the four castes.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rgyal rigs dang / bram ze'i rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / gdol rigs so //
analyzed: rgyal rigs dang / bram ze'i rigs dang / rje'u rigs dang / gdol rigs so //
translated: the kṣatriya caste, the brahmin caste, the vaiśya caste, and the śūdra caste.

original: chen po bzhi'i sbrul yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: chen po bzhi'i sbrul yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The four great elements are also like this,

original: rang bzhin rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: having four natures.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sra ba'i rang bzhin dang / gsher ba'i rang bzhin dang / dro ba'i rang bzhin dang / g-yo ba'i rang @31b bzhin no //
analyzed: sra ba'i rang bzhin dang / gsher ba'i rang bzhin dang / dro ba'i rang bzhin dang / g-yo ba'i rang @31b bzhin no //
translated: the nature of solidity, the nature of fluidity, the nature of heat, and the nature of motion.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni chen po bzhi dang / sbrul gdug pa bzhi rang bzhin gyis 'dra bar rtog go /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni chen po bzhi dang / sbrul gdug pa bzhi rang bzhin gyis 'dra bar rtog go /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva considers the four great elements to be the same as the four poisonous snakes.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni chen po bzhi la sbrul gdug pa bzhi lta bur rtog go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni chen po bzhi la sbrul gdug pa bzhi lta bur rtog go //
translated: the bodhisattva considers the four great elements to be like the four poisonous snakes.

original: ji ltar rtog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtog ce na /
translated: How does he consider them?

original: sbrul gdug pa bzhi ni rtag tu mi la skabs tshol te /
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa bzhi ni rtag tu mi la skabs tshol te /
translated: The four poisonous snakes are always on the lookout for an opportunity to harm people.

original: ji ltar nam zhig mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar nam zhig mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: They think, “When will I see him?

original: nam zhig reg par 'gyur /
analyzed: nam zhig reg par 'gyur /
translated: When will I touch him?

original: nam zhig dbugs kyis rngub par 'gyur /
analyzed: nam zhig dbugs kyis rngub par 'gyur /
translated: When will I breathe on him?

original: nam zhig bza' bar 'gyur snyam sems so //
analyzed: nam zhig bza' bar 'gyur snyam sems so //
translated: When will I bite him?”

original: chen po bzhi'i sbrul gdug pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: chen po bzhi'i sbrul gdug pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The poisonous snakes of the four great elements are just like that.

original: rtag tu sems can gyi nyes pa'i skyon tshol lo //
analyzed: rtag tu sems can gyi nyes pa'i skyon tshol lo //
translated: They are always on the lookout for the faults of sentient beings.

original: gal te sbrul gdug pa bzhis bsad na nam du'ang ngan song gsum du mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: gal te sbrul gdug pa bzhis bsad na nam du'ang ngan song gsum du mi 'gro'o //
translated: If one is killed by the four poisonous snakes, one will never go to the three evil destinies.

original: gal te chen po bzhis bsad par gyur na gdon mi za bar ngan song gsum du 'gro bar nges te /
analyzed: gal te chen po bzhis bsad par gyur na gdon mi za bar ngan song gsum du 'gro bar nges te /
translated: If one is killed by the four great elements, one will certainly go to the three evil destinies.

original: the tshom med do //
analyzed: the tshom med do //
translated: There is no doubt about it.

original: sbrul gdug pa bzhi ni legs par gsos kyang phyir mi la gsod par sems so //
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa bzhi ni legs par gsos kyang phyir mi la gsod par sems so //
translated: The four poisonous snakes, even if well cared for, will still think of killing people.

original: chen po bzhi yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: chen po bzhi yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The four great elements are also like this.

original: rtag tu gso zhing rim gro byas kyang rtag tu mi dge ba thams cad byed du bcug go /
analyzed: rtag tu gso zhing rim gro byas kyang rtag tu mi dge ba thams cad byed du bcug go /
translated: Even if one always cares for and serves them, they will always make one commit all kinds of unwholesome actions.

original: sbrul gdug pa bzhi las gal te gcig khros na mi la gsod par nus so //
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa bzhi las gal te gcig khros na mi la gsod par nus so //
translated: If one of the four poisonous snakes is angry, it can kill a person.

original: chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The nature of the four great elements is also like this.

original: gal te chen po bzhi gcig gi shas ma mnyam na'ang mi la gsod par nus so //
analyzed: gal te chen po bzhi gcig gi shas ma mnyam na'ang mi la gsod par nus so //
translated: If one of the four great elements is out of balance, it can kill a person.

original: sbrul gdug pa bzhi ni lhan cig tu gnas kyang bzhi po'i sems so so'o //
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa bzhi ni lhan cig tu gnas kyang bzhi po'i sems so so'o //
translated: The four poisonous snakes may coexist, but the minds of the four are different.

original: chen po bzhi'i sbrul gdug pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: chen po bzhi'i sbrul gdug pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The poisonous snakes of the four great elements are also like this.

original: @32a *// lhan cig gnas kyang rang bzhin so so'o //
analyzed: @32a *// lhan cig gnas kyang rang bzhin so so'o //
translated: Even if they live together, their natures are different.

original: sbrul gdug pa bzhi la bkur sti byas kyang nye bar bsten dka'o //
analyzed: sbrul gdug pa bzhi la bkur sti byas kyang nye bar bsten dka'o //
translated: Even if you serve the four poisonous snakes, it is difficult to get close to them.

original: chen po bzhi'i sbrul gdug pa'ang de dang 'dra ste; bkur sti byas kyang nye bar bsten dka'o //
analyzed: chen po bzhi'i sbrul gdug pa'ang de dang 'dra ste; bkur sti byas kyang nye bar bsten dka'o //
translated: The four great poisonous snakes are also like this. Even if you serve them, it is difficult to get close to them.

original: gal te sbrul gdug pa bzhis zin na dge sbyong ngam bram ze la sogs pas rig sngags dang sman gyis gso nus so //
analyzed: gal te sbrul gdug pa bzhis zin na dge sbyong ngam bram ze la sogs pas rig sngags dang sman gyis gso nus so //
translated: If you are bitten by the four poisonous snakes, śramaṇas, brahmans, and others can cure you with mantras and medicine.

original: chen po bzhis bsad na dge sbyong ngam bram ze la sogs pa dag gis rig sngags dang sman bzang pos gsos kyang mi sos so //
analyzed: chen po bzhis bsad na dge sbyong ngam bram ze la sogs pa dag gis rig sngags dang sman bzang pos gsos kyang mi sos so //
translated: If you are killed by the four great ones, even if śramaṇas, brahmans, and others treat you with good mantras and medicine, you cannot be cured.

original: sbrul la rtse ba dag kyang sbrul gdug pa bzhi'i dri mnam pas phog na rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbrul la rtse ba dag kyang sbrul gdug pa bzhi'i dri mnam pas phog na rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who play with snakes will avoid the smell of the four poisonous snakes.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Buddhas and bodhisattvas are also like this.

original: chen po bzhi'i mnam pa tshor na rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: chen po bzhi'i mnam pa tshor na rab tu spong ngo //
translated: If they smell the smell of the four great ones, they will avoid them.

original: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' yang 'di snyam du chen po bzhi'i sbrul gdug pa la rab tu 'jigs pa bskyed de rgyab kyis phyogs nas myur bar bros te /
analyzed: de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' yang 'di snyam du chen po bzhi'i sbrul gdug pa la rab tu 'jigs pa bskyed de rgyab kyis phyogs nas myur bar bros te /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva thinks, “I will generate a great fear of the four great poisonous snakes and turn my back on them, quickly fleeing.

original: 'phags pa'i lam brgyad la bsgom par bya'o snyam sems so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam brgyad la bsgom par bya'o snyam sems so //
translated: I will cultivate the eightfold noble path.”

original: rigs ngan lnga zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i dpe'o //
analyzed: rigs ngan lnga zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i dpe'o //
translated: “Five low-class people” is an analogy for the five aggregates.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la rigs ngan lta bur rtog ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la rigs ngan lta bur rtog ce na /
translated: How do bodhisattvas regard the five aggregates as being like low-class people?

original: rigs ngan zhes bya ba ni rtag tu mdza' zhing sdug pa dang so sor phral te /
analyzed: rigs ngan zhes bya ba ni rtag tu mdza' zhing sdug pa dang so sor phral te /
translated: “Low-class people” always separate from what is dear and pleasant

original: dgra sdang ba dang lhan cig sprod do //
analyzed: dgra sdang ba dang lhan cig sprod do //
translated: and join with what is hateful and hostile.

original: phung po lnga'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The five aggregates are also like that.

original: 'gro ba mang po mi dge ba'i chos la chags shing nye bar byed de /
analyzed: 'gro ba mang po mi dge ba'i chos la chags shing nye bar byed de /
translated: They cause many beings to be attached to and close to nonvirtuous qualities,

original: phyogs gcig tu dge ba'i @32b chos thams cad dang ni bral bar byed do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu dge ba'i @32b chos thams cad dang ni bral bar byed do //
translated: and they separate them from all virtuous qualities in one place.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: dper na / rigs ngan ni ral gri dang / phub dang / mda' gzhu dang / go cha dang / mdung dang / mtshon cha rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bdag la brgyan cing gzhan la gnod par byed do //
analyzed: dper na / rigs ngan ni ral gri dang / phub dang / mda' gzhu dang / go cha dang / mdung dang / mtshon cha rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bdag la brgyan cing gzhan la gnod par byed do //
translated: the low-caste person adorns himself with various weapons such as swords, spears, arrows, bows, armor, and lances, and harms others.

original: phung po lnga'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The five aggregates are also like this.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis shin tu brgyan nas gti mug can la 'tshe zhing srid pa rnams su ltung bar byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis shin tu brgyan nas gti mug can la 'tshe zhing srid pa rnams su ltung bar byed do //
translated: Adorned with afflictions, they harm the ignorant and cause them to fall into existence.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: rigs ngan ni 'gro ba nyes pa byung ba yod na gsod do //
analyzed: rigs ngan ni 'gro ba nyes pa byung ba yod na gsod do //
translated: The low-caste person kills when there is a crime committed.

original: phung po lnga'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The five aggregates are also like this.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa dang bcas pas rtag tu gsod do //🔽de bas na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la rigs ngan lnga lta bur rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa dang bcas pas rtag tu gsod do // de bas na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la rigs ngan lnga lta bur rab tu rtogs so //
translated: Having the crime of affliction, they always kill.🔽Therefore, the bodhisattva fully understands the five aggregates to be like the five low-caste people.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la rigs ngan lta bur rtogs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la rigs ngan lta bur rtogs te /
translated: Furthermore, the bodhisattva understands the five aggregates to be like the five low-caste people.

original: rigs ngan ni byams pa dang brtse ba'i sems med de /
analyzed: rigs ngan ni byams pa dang brtse ba'i sems med de /
translated: The low-caste person has no thought of love or compassion.

original: dgra dang gnyen gnyis ka gsod do //
analyzed: dgra dang gnyen gnyis ka gsod do //
translated: He kills both enemies and friends.

original: phung po lnga'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The five aggregates are like that.

original: byams pa dang brtse ba'i sems med pas dge ba dang / mi dge ba gnyis ka gsod do //
analyzed: byams pa dang brtse ba'i sems med pas dge ba dang / mi dge ba gnyis ka gsod do //
translated: Because they have no thought of love or compassion, they kill both good and evil.

original: rigs ngan ni mi thams cad la 'tshe'o //
analyzed: rigs ngan ni mi thams cad la 'tshe'o //
translated: The low-caste person is a threat to all people.

original: phung po lnga'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: phung po lnga'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The five aggregates are like that.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rtag tu 'khor ba'i sems can rnams la 'tshe'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis rtag tu 'khor ba'i sems can rnams la 'tshe'o //
translated: Because of the afflictions, they are always a threat to sentient beings in cyclic existence.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la rigs ngan lta bur rtog go //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la rigs ngan lta bur rtog go //
translated: Therefore, bodhisattvas consider the five aggregates to be like a low-caste person.

original: rigs ngan ni rtag tu 'tshe ba'i sems dang bcas so //
analyzed: rigs ngan ni rtag tu 'tshe ba'i sems dang bcas so //
translated: The low-caste person always has a thought of harming.

original: phung po lnga'ang de dang 'dra bar rtag tu kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas @33a *//
analyzed: phung po lnga'ang de dang 'dra bar rtag tu kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas @33a *//
translated: The five aggregates are like that. Because they are always associated with afflictions,

original: pas 'tshe ba'i sems dang bcas so //
analyzed: pas 'tshe ba'i sems dang bcas so //
translated: they have a thought of harming.

original: ji ltar mi rkang pa med pa la ral gri dang / mtshon cha dang / g-yog med na gdon mi za bar rigs ngan gyis gsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mi rkang pa med pa la ral gri dang / mtshon cha dang / g-yog med na gdon mi za bar rigs ngan gyis gsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as a man without legs, without a sword, and without attendants will certainly be killed by a low-class man,

original: sems can yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sems can yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: so it is with sentient beings.

original: rkang pa med cing mtshon cha med de /
analyzed: rkang pa med cing mtshon cha med de /
translated: Without legs and without a sword,

original: g-yog med na phung po lngas gsod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yog med na phung po lngas gsod par 'gyur ro //
translated: without attendants, they will be killed by the five aggregates.

original: rkang pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: rkang pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Legs means morality.

original: ral gri zhes bya ba ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: ral gri zhes bya ba ni shes rab bo //
translated: A sword means wisdom.

original: g-yog ces bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
analyzed: g-yog ces bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
translated: Attendants means spiritual friends.

original: de gsum med na phung po lnga'i dgras 'tshe bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gsum med na phung po lnga'i dgras 'tshe bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Without these three, one will be harmed by the enemy of the five aggregates.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la rigs ngan lta bur rtog go /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la rigs ngan lta bur rtog go /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattvas regard the five aggregates as a low-class man.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos phung po lnga la rigs ngan pas kyang lhag par rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos phung po lnga la rigs ngan pas kyang lhag par rtog go /
translated: bodhisattva-mahāsattvas regard the five aggregates as even worse than a low-class man.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te sems can gang rigs ngan gyis bsad na sems can dmyal bar mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: gal te sems can gang rigs ngan gyis bsad na sems can dmyal bar mi ltung ngo //
translated: If a sentient being is killed by a low-caste person, he does not fall into hell.

original: phung po lngas bsad na sems can dmyal bar ltung ste /
analyzed: phung po lngas bsad na sems can dmyal bar ltung ste /
translated: If he is killed by the five aggregates, he falls into hell.

original: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la rigs ngan pas lhag par rtog go //
analyzed: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga la rigs ngan pas lhag par rtog go //
translated: For this reason, the bodhisattva considers the five aggregates to be worse than a low-caste person.

original: de ltar rtogs nas 'di skad ces dam 'cha'o //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs nas 'di skad ces dam 'cha'o //
translated: Having understood this, he makes the following vow:

original: bdag tshe gcig gi bar du rigs ngan dang lhan cig gnas kyang sla'i /
analyzed: bdag tshe gcig gi bar du rigs ngan dang lhan cig gnas kyang sla'i /
translated: “It would be better for me to live for one lifetime with a low-caste person

original: skad cig tsam yang phung po lnga dang nye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: skad cig tsam yang phung po lnga dang nye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: than for me to want to be near the five aggregates even for a moment.”

original: rigs ngan ni 'dod khams kyi glen pa 'ba' zhig 'tshe bar nus kyi /
analyzed: rigs ngan ni 'dod khams kyi glen pa 'ba' zhig 'tshe bar nus kyi /
translated: A low-caste person can only harm those who are fools in the desire realm.

original: phung po lnga'i dgras ni khams @33b gsum gyi bus pa ma rabs glen pa kun la 'tshe'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i dgras ni khams @33b gsum gyi bus pa ma rabs glen pa kun la 'tshe'o //
translated: But the enemy, the five aggregates, harm all the foolish, low-class people in the three realms.

original: rigs ngan ni nyes pa yod pa'i mi 'ba' zhig gsod kyi /🔽phung po lnga'i dgras ni sems can nyes pa yod kyang rung /
analyzed: rigs ngan ni nyes pa yod pa'i mi 'ba' zhig gsod kyi / phung po lnga'i dgras ni sems can nyes pa yod kyang rung /
translated: A low-caste person can only kill a person who has faults.

original: med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: med kyang rung ste /
translated: But the enemy, the five aggregates, harm sentient beings whether or not they have faults.

original: kun la gnod par byed cing rab tu 'tshe'o //
analyzed: kun la gnod par byed cing rab tu 'tshe'o //
translated: It harms and injures everyone.

original: rigs ngan ni zhan pa rgas pa dang / bud med dang / bu chung ngu rnams la mi 'tshe'o //
analyzed: rigs ngan ni zhan pa rgas pa dang / bud med dang / bu chung ngu rnams la mi 'tshe'o //
translated: But a low-caste person does not harm or injure the weak, the old, women, or children.

original: phung po lnga'i dgra ni sems can rgan yang rung /🔽gzhon yang rung /
analyzed: phung po lnga'i dgra ni sems can rgan yang rung / gzhon yang rung /
translated: The enemy, the five aggregates, harms🔽both the old and the young,

original: bud med kyang rung ste /
analyzed: bud med kyang rung ste /
translated: both men and women.

original: thams cad kun la 'tshe'o //
analyzed: thams cad kun la 'tshe'o //
translated: It harms everyone.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpas phung po 'di la rigs ngan pas lhag par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpas phung po 'di la rigs ngan pas lhag par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, a bodhisattva should think of the five aggregates as a low-caste person.

original: de bas na tshe gcig gi bar du rigs ngan dang lhan cig gna kyang sla'i /
analyzed: de bas na tshe gcig gi bar du rigs ngan dang lhan cig gna kyang sla'i /
translated: Therefore, it is better to live for a hundred years with a low-caste person than for an instant with the five aggregates.

original: skad cig tsam yang phung po lnga dang nye ba dang bsten par mi bya'o zhes yi dam 'cha'o //
analyzed: skad cig tsam yang phung po lnga dang nye ba dang bsten par mi bya'o zhes yi dam 'cha'o //
translated: Therefore, I will not live even for an instant with the five aggregates.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Moreover, son of noble family,

original: rigs ngan ni pha rol po 'ba' zhig la 'tshe'i /
analyzed: rigs ngan ni pha rol po 'ba' zhig la 'tshe'i /
translated: a low-caste person harms only others,

original: bdag la mi 'tshe'o //
analyzed: bdag la mi 'tshe'o //
translated: not himself.

original: phung po lnga'i dgra ni bdag dang / gzhan dang / rigs ngan pa'ang 'tshe'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga'i dgra ni bdag dang / gzhan dang / rigs ngan pa'ang 'tshe'o //
translated: But the enemy, the five aggregates, harms both himself and others, as well as the low-caste person.

original: rigs ngan la ni tshig 'jam po dang nor rin po che byin pas thar bar rung gi /
analyzed: rigs ngan la ni tshig 'jam po dang nor rin po che byin pas thar bar rung gi /
translated: It is possible to escape from a low-caste man by giving him sweet words and precious things.

original: phung po lnga ni de lta ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phung po lnga ni de lta ma yin gyi /
translated: But the five aggregates are not like that.

original: tshig 'jam pos brid cing nor rin po che la sogs pa phul yang thar bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig 'jam pos brid cing nor rin po che la sogs pa phul yang thar bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if you try to bribe them with sweet words and precious things, you will not escape.

original: rigs ngan ni dus bzhi thams cad du rtag tu gsod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs ngan ni dus bzhi thams cad du rtag tu gsod pa ma yin no //
translated: A low-caste man does not always kill you at all times.

original: phung po lnga ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po lnga ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But the five aggregates are not like that.

original: skad cig skad cig tsam yang rtag tu sems can rnams gsod do //🔽rigs ngan ni gnas gcig tu zad pas 'byol zhing @34a *//
analyzed: skad cig skad cig tsam yang rtag tu sems can rnams gsod do // rigs ngan ni gnas gcig tu zad pas 'byol zhing @34a *//
translated: They always kill sentient beings, even for a moment.

original: 'bros su yod do //
analyzed: 'bros su yod do //
translated: A low-caste man is exhausted in one place, so you can escape by running away.

original: phung po lnga ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po lnga ni de lta ma yin te /
