translated: But the five aggregates are not like that.

original: gnas thams cad kun tu khyab pas 'byol zhing 'bros pa'i sa med do //
analyzed: gnas thams cad kun tu khyab pas 'byol zhing 'bros pa'i sa med do //
translated: They pervade all places, so there is no place to escape.

original: rigs ngan ni mi la gsod mod kyi /
analyzed: rigs ngan ni mi la gsod mod kyi /
translated: A low-caste man kills people,

original: bsad nas rjes su mi 'brang ngo //
analyzed: bsad nas rjes su mi 'brang ngo //
translated: but after killing them, he does not follow them.

original: phung po lnga ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po lnga ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But the five aggregates are not like that.

original: sems can bsad nas kyang rjes su 'brang zhing mi 'bral lo //
analyzed: sems can bsad nas kyang rjes su 'brang zhing mi 'bral lo //
translated: Even after killing sentient beings, they follow them and do not leave.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' nam 'tsho'i bar du rigs ngan dang lhan cig gnas kyang sla'i /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' nam 'tsho'i bar du rigs ngan dang lhan cig gnas kyang sla'i /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattvas may live with the lowliest of people for their whole lives,

original: skad cig tsam yang phung po lnga dang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: skad cig tsam yang phung po lnga dang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: but they will not be contaminated by the five aggregates even for an instant.

original: shes rab can dag ni thabs mkhas pas phung po lnga las thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab can dag ni thabs mkhas pas phung po lnga las thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The wise, through skillful means, are liberated from the five aggregates.

original: thabs mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam brgyad dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / tshad med pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam brgyad dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / tshad med pa bzhi ste /
translated: “Skillful means” refers to the eightfold noble path, the six perfections, and the four immeasurables.

original: de lta bu'i thabs kyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i thabs kyis rnam par grol bar 'gyur te /
translated: Through such means, one is liberated.

original: lus dang sems la phung po lngas mi 'che bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang sems la phung po lngas mi 'che bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The five aggregates do not oppress the body and mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: lus ni rdo rje lta bu /
analyzed: lus ni rdo rje lta bu /
translated: The body is like a vajra.

original: sems ni nam mkha' lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems ni nam mkha' lta bu ste /
translated: The mind is like space.

original: de'i phyir lus dang sems gzhig par rab tu dka'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus dang sems gzhig par rab tu dka'o //
translated: Therefore, it is very difficult to destroy the body and mind.

original: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga ni mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan par rtogs nas rab tu 'jigs pa chen po skyes te; 'phags pa'i lam brgyad la nan tan byed pa ni ji ltar mi des sbrul gdug pa
analyzed: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas phung po lnga ni mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan par rtogs nas rab tu 'jigs pa chen po skyes te; 'phags pa'i lam brgyad la nan tan byed pa ni ji ltar mi des sbrul gdug pa
translated: For this reason, when bodhisattvas realize that the five aggregates are endowed with various unwholesome qualities, they give rise to great fear and practice the eightfold noble path.

original: bzhi dang / rigs ngan lnga la 'jigs nas thogs pa med par lam du zhugs te song ba @34b dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bzhi dang / rigs ngan lnga la 'jigs nas thogs pa med par lam du zhugs te song ba @34b dang 'dra'o //
translated: This is like the man who, fearing the four poisonous snakes and five candālas, entered the road without hesitation and went on his way.

original: sgyus mdza' ba ltar byed pa ni 'dod chags pa'o //
analyzed: sgyus mdza' ba ltar byed pa ni 'dod chags pa'o //
translated: Desire is like a deceitful friend.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'dod pa kun nas nyon mongs pa la dgra sgyus mdza' bar byed pa lta bur rtogs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'dod pa kun nas nyon mongs pa la dgra sgyus mdza' bar byed pa lta bur rtogs te /
translated: Bodhisattva mahāsattvas realize that desire is like an enemy who acts like a friend.

original: gang gis de ltar shes pa la ni cis kyang mi tshugs so //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar shes pa la ni cis kyang mi tshugs so //
translated: Those who know this will not be harmed by anything.

original: gang mi shes pa la ni gdon mi za bar 'tshe bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang mi shes pa la ni gdon mi za bar 'tshe bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who do not know this will certainly be harmed.

original: 'dod chags pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Desire is also like this.

original: gang de'i tshe mtshan nyid shes pa'i 'gro ba dag ni 'khor bar 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang de'i tshe mtshan nyid shes pa'i 'gro ba dag ni 'khor bar 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal myong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who know the characteristics of the mind will not experience the suffering of samsara.

original: gal te mi shes na rgyud drug tu 'khor zhing sdug bsngal mang po ma lus par myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mi shes na rgyud drug tu 'khor zhing sdug bsngal mang po ma lus par myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you do not know, you will wander in the six realms and experience all kinds of suffering.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod chags las nad du 'gyur ba ni shin tu spong dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags las nad du 'gyur ba ni shin tu spong dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is very difficult to abandon the disease of desire.

original: de'ang ji ltar dgra sgyus mdza' ba ltar byed pa spong dka' ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'ang ji ltar dgra sgyus mdza' ba ltar byed pa spong dka' ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like an enemy pretending to be a friend, which is difficult to abandon.

original: dgra sgyus mdza' ba ltar byed pa ni rtag tu skabs tshol te /
analyzed: dgra sgyus mdza' ba ltar byed pa ni rtag tu skabs tshol te /
translated: An enemy pretending to be a friend always looks for an opportunity.

original: mdza' zhing sdug pa dang phral nas dgra sdang ba dang sprod par byed do //
analyzed: mdza' zhing sdug pa dang phral nas dgra sdang ba dang sprod par byed do //
translated: Having separated you from your loved ones, he will unite you with your enemies.

original: 'dod chags kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Desire is like that.

original: skye bo dag dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ring du 'gyur zhing mi dge ba'i chos thams cad dang nye bar byed do //
analyzed: skye bo dag dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ring du 'gyur zhing mi dge ba'i chos thams cad dang nye bar byed do //
translated: It causes people to be far from all virtuous dharmas and close to all nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'dod chags la ji ltar dgra sgyus mdza' bar byed pa dang 'dra bar rtogs te /
analyzed: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'dod chags la ji ltar dgra sgyus mdza' bar byed pa dang 'dra bar rtogs te /
translated: For this reason, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva understands desire to be like an enemy disguised as a friend.

original: mi mthang ba mthong ba dang / ma thos pa thos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthang ba mthong ba dang / ma thos pa thos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he sees what should not be seen and hears what should not be heard.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo ni 'khor ba'i skyon mthong ste /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo ni 'khor ba'i skyon mthong ste /
translated: The foolish ordinary person, seeing the faults of saṃsāra,

original: shes rab @35a *//
analyzed: shes rab @35a *//
translated: has wisdom.

original: yod mod kyi gti mug gis khebs pas phyis kyang mi mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod mod kyi gti mug gis khebs pas phyis kyang mi mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But because he is covered by delusion, he will not see again.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are also like this.

original: mthong mod kyi mi mthong ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mthong mod kyi mi mthong ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: Although they see, it is as if they do not see.

original: thos mod kyi mi thos pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: thos mod kyi mi thos pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: Although they hear, it is as if they do not hear.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'dod pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sems dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have a mind attached to desires.

original: de'ang ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang ji lta zhe na /
translated: And how is this?

original: 'khor ba'i skyon mthong yang myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro mi nus so //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i skyon mthong yang myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro mi nus so //
translated: Although they see the faults of saṃsāra, they are unable to quickly go to unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.

original: don de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'dod chags kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'di la dgra sgyus mdza' ba ltar byed pa dang 'dra bar rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: don de bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni 'dod chags kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i 'di la dgra sgyus mdza' ba ltar byed pa dang 'dra bar rab tu rtogs so //
translated: For this reason, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva fully understands that the afflictions of desire are like enemies pretending to be friends.

original: dgra sgyus mdza' ba ltar byed pa'i mtshan ma ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: dgra sgyus mdza' ba ltar byed pa'i mtshan ma ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of enemies pretending to be friends?

original: dper na / dgra mi bden par sgyus bden pa'i mtshan ma ston pa dang / nye zhing mdza' mi rung bar sgyus nye ba'i mtshan ma ston pa dang / yang dag par dge ba ma yin par sgyus dge ba'i mtshan ma ston pa dang / yang dag par sdug pa ma yin par sgyus sdug pa'i mtshan ma ston to //
analyzed: dper na / dgra mi bden par sgyus bden pa'i mtshan ma ston pa dang / nye zhing mdza' mi rung bar sgyus nye ba'i mtshan ma ston pa dang / yang dag par dge ba ma yin par sgyus dge ba'i mtshan ma ston pa dang / yang dag par sdug pa ma yin par sgyus sdug pa'i mtshan ma ston to //
translated: For example, it is like an enemy using deception to show the characteristics of a true friend, using deception to show the characteristics of being close and suitable to be a friend, using deception to show the characteristics of virtue when they are not truly virtuous, and using deception to show the characteristics of beauty when they are not truly beautiful.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rtag tu skabs tshol te /
analyzed: rtag tu skabs tshol te /
translated: Because they are always looking for an opportunity.

original: 'che bar 'dod pa'i phyir 'dod pa'ang de dang 'dra bar rtag tu sems can ranms la mi bden par sgyus bden pa dang / mi nye bar sgyus nye ba dang / mi dge bar sgyus dge ba dang / mi sdug par sgyus sdug pa ltar byed de /
analyzed: 'che bar 'dod pa'i phyir 'dod pa'ang de dang 'dra bar rtag tu sems can ranms la mi bden par sgyus bden pa dang / mi nye bar sgyus nye ba dang / mi dge bar sgyus dge ba dang / mi sdug par sgyus sdug pa ltar byed de /
translated: Desire is like that, always deceiving sentient beings with false truth, with false proximity, with false virtue, and with false beauty.

original: rtag tu thams cad la slu zhing 'khor bar 'khor bar byed do //
analyzed: rtag tu thams cad la slu zhing 'khor bar 'khor bar byed do //
translated: It always deceives everyone and makes them revolve in cyclic existence.

original: don @35b de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags la dgra sgyus nye bar byed pa lta bu rtog go /
analyzed: don @35b de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags la dgra sgyus nye bar byed pa lta bu rtog go /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva considers desire to be like an enemy who acts as a friend.

original: dgra sgyus nye ba ltar byed pa ni lus dang ngag gi las mthong gi /
analyzed: dgra sgyus nye ba ltar byed pa ni lus dang ngag gi las mthong gi /
translated: The enemy who acts as a friend is seen in bodily and verbal actions,

original: sems ni mi mthong ste /
analyzed: sems ni mi mthong ste /
translated: but not in the mind.

original: de bas na slu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na slu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he deceives.

original: 'dod pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Desire is also like that.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i slu ba 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i slu ba 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: It is only a false deception.

original: bden pa med do //
analyzed: bden pa med do //
translated: It has no truth.

original: de bas na sems can thams cad kyang bslus so //
analyzed: de bas na sems can thams cad kyang bslus so //
translated: Therefore, it deceives all sentient beings.

original: dgra sgyus nye ba ltar byed pa ni thog ma dang tha ma yod de /
analyzed: dgra sgyus nye ba ltar byed pa ni thog ma dang tha ma yod de /
translated: The enemy who acts as a friend has a beginning and an end.

original: spong bar sla'o //
analyzed: spong bar sla'o //
translated: It is easy to abandon.

original: 'dod chags ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: But desire is not like that.

original: thog ma dang tha ma med pas spong bar rab tu dka'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma med pas spong bar rab tu dka'o //
translated: Because it has no beginning or end, it is difficult to abandon.

original: dgra sgyus nye ba ltar byed pa ni thag ring na shes par dka'i /
analyzed: dgra sgyus nye ba ltar byed pa ni thag ring na shes par dka'i /
translated: An enemy who acts like a friend is hard to know if he is far away,

original: nye na shes par sla'o //
analyzed: nye na shes par sla'o //
translated: but easy to know if he is near.

original: 'dod pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But desire is not like that.

original: nye na'ang shes par dka' na ring ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: nye na'ang shes par dka' na ring ba lta ci smos te /
translated: If it is hard to know even when it is near, what can be said if it is far away?

original: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags la sgyus nye bar byed pa bas kyang lhag par rtog go /
analyzed: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags la sgyus nye bar byed pa bas kyang lhag par rtog go /
translated: For this reason, the bodhisattva considers desire to be more deceitful than an enemy who acts like a friend.

original: sems can thams cad ni 'dod chags kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po dang thag ring zhing; 'khor ba dang dus nye bar gyur to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni 'dod chags kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po dang thag ring zhing; 'khor ba dang dus nye bar gyur to //
translated: All sentient beings, afflicted by desire, are far from great nirvana and close to saṃsāra.

original: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa dang thag ring zhing mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dag yongs su ma dag pa dang nye bar gyur to //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa dang thag ring zhing mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dag yongs su ma dag pa dang nye bar gyur to //
translated: It is far from permanence, bliss, self, and purity, and is close to impermanence, suffering, and no-self.

original: de bas na ngas mdo sde kun las dri ma rnam pa gsum bshad de /
analyzed: de bas na ngas mdo sde kun las dri ma rnam pa gsum bshad de /
translated: Therefore, I have explained in all the sūtras that there are three kinds of defilements.

original: ma rig pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po la nyes pa'i skyon ma mthong ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po la nyes pa'i skyon ma mthong ste /
translated: Because of ignorance, one does not see the faults and problems in present things.

original: spong mi nas @36a *//
analyzed: spong mi nas @36a *//
translated: One is unable to abandon them.

original: so // 'dod chags kyi dgra sgyus nye ba ltar byed pa ni nam yang mkhas pa shes rab can la gnod pa byed mi nus so //
analyzed: so // 'dod chags kyi dgra sgyus nye ba ltar byed pa ni nam yang mkhas pa shes rab can la gnod pa byed mi nus so //
translated: The enemy of desire acts like a deceitful friend, but can never harm the wise and the discerning.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod pa 'di rab tu rtogs shing 'jigs pa chen po skyes nas /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod pa 'di rab tu rtogs shing 'jigs pa chen po skyes nas /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva, having realized this desire and given rise to great fear,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad la nan tan byed pa ni ji ltar mi de sbrul gdug pa bzhi dang / rigs ngan lnga dang sgyus nye ba gcig la 'jigs pas lam du zhugs nas phyir mi ldog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad la nan tan byed pa ni ji ltar mi de sbrul gdug pa bzhi dang / rigs ngan lnga dang sgyus nye ba gcig la 'jigs pas lam du zhugs nas phyir mi ldog pa bzhin no //
translated: Diligence in the eightfold noble path is like that person who, fearing the four poisonous snakes, the five kinds of foul refuse, and the deceptive friend, enters the road and does not turn back.

original: grong khyer stong pa zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug go /
analyzed: grong khyer stong pa zhes bya ba ni skye mched drug go /
translated: “An empty city” refers to the six sense bases.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi skye mched drug la stong pa ci'ang med pa grong khyer stong pa dang 'dra bar rtog go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi skye mched drug la stong pa ci'ang med pa grong khyer stong pa dang 'dra bar rtog go /
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas contemplate the six internal sense bases as empty and nonexistent, like an empty city.

original: ji ltar 'jigs pa'i mi de grong khyer stong par zhugs nas mi gcig kyang ma mthong zhing /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jigs pa'i mi de grong khyer stong par zhugs nas mi gcig kyang ma mthong zhing /
translated: Just as that fearful person, having entered the empty city, does not see a single person,

original: rdza ma dang snod kun tu bltas kyang rdzas gcig kyang ma rnyed pa bzhin te /
analyzed: rdza ma dang snod kun tu bltas kyang rdzas gcig kyang ma rnyed pa bzhin te /
translated: and even though looking in all the pots and vessels, does not find a single thing,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang de dang 'dra bar skye mched drug la yang dag par brtags na stong pa ci'ang med pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang de dang 'dra bar skye mched drug la yang dag par brtags na stong pa ci'ang med pa /
translated: in the same way, when bodhisattvas correctly investigate the six sense bases, they are empty and nonexistent,

original: sems can gyi rdzas gcig kyang bden pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: sems can gyi rdzas gcig kyang bden pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: Not a single sentient being has seen the truth.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpas nang gi skye mched drug la stong pa /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpas nang gi skye mched drug la stong pa /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva should contemplate the six inner sense bases as being empty,

original: ci'ang med pa grong khyer stong pa de dang 'dra bar rtog go /
analyzed: ci'ang med pa grong khyer stong pa de dang 'dra bar rtog go /
translated: like that empty city.

original: rigs kyi bu; grong khyer stong pa de la dgra dang rkun po rnams kyis rgyang nas bltas na stong pa'i 'du shes yang mi skye'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; grong khyer stong pa de la dgra dang rkun po rnams kyis rgyang nas bltas na stong pa'i 'du shes yang mi skye'o //
translated: “Son of noble family, when enemies and thieves look from afar at that empty city, they do not think of it as empty.

original: bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bo'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bo'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Foolish ordinary beings are like that,

original: skye mched drug @36b gi grong khyer la stong pa'i 'du shes mi skye'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug @36b gi grong khyer la stong pa'i 'du shes mi skye'o //
translated: for they do not think of the city of the six sense bases as empty.

original: stong pa'i 'du shes ma skyes pa'i phyir 'khor bar 'khor te /
analyzed: stong pa'i 'du shes ma skyes pa'i phyir 'khor bar 'khor te /
translated: Because they do not think of it as empty, they circle in saṃsāra

original: sdug bsngal tshad med pa snyed myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tshad med pa snyed myong bar gyur to //
translated: and experience immeasurable suffering.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dgra dang rkun po rnams der phyin nas /
analyzed: dgra dang rkun po rnams der phyin nas /
translated: when enemies and thieves arrive there

original: gdod stong pa'i 'du shes bskyed pa dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: gdod stong pa'i 'du shes bskyed pa dang 'dra bar byang chub sems dpa' yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: and think of it as empty, the bodhisattva is like that.

original: skye mched drug po 'di la brtags na rtag tu stong pa'i 'du shes skye'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug po 'di la brtags na rtag tu stong pa'i 'du shes skye'o //
translated: If one examines these six sense bases, one will always give rise to the perception of emptiness.

original: stong pa'i 'du shes bskyed pas 'khor bar mi 'khor zhing sdug bsngal mi myong bar gyur to //
analyzed: stong pa'i 'du shes bskyed pas 'khor bar mi 'khor zhing sdug bsngal mi myong bar gyur to //
translated: By giving rise to the perception of emptiness, one will not revolve in saṃsāra and will not experience suffering.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni skye mched drug po 'di la phyin ci log tu ma gyur to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni skye mched drug po 'di la phyin ci log tu ma gyur to //
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not have any distortions regarding these six sense bases.

original: phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa'i phyir 'khor bar 'khor bar ma gyur to //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa'i phyir 'khor bar 'khor bar ma gyur to //
translated: Because he does not have any distortions, he does not revolve in saṃsāra.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: rkun po rnams ni grong khyer stong par zhugs na bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkun po rnams ni grong khyer stong par zhugs na bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: when thieves enter an empty town, they obtain happiness.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rkun po rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rkun po rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The thieves of the afflictions are also like that.

original: skye mched drug po de la zhugs na bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug po de la zhugs na bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they enter those six sense bases, they obtain happiness.

original: de ltar rkun po rnams grong khyer stong par gnas na 'jigs pa'i sems med pa ltar /
analyzed: de ltar rkun po rnams grong khyer stong par gnas na 'jigs pa'i sems med pa ltar /
translated: Just as when thieves dwell in an empty town, they have no fear,

original: nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: the enemies of the afflictions are also like that.

original: skye mched drug po de la gnas na 'jigs pa med do //🔽ji ltar grong khyer stong pa de ni sengge dang / stag dang / spyang ki dang / gcan gzan ma rungs pa thams cad kyi gnas dang 'dra ba ltar nang gi skye mched drug po de'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: skye mched drug po de la gnas na 'jigs pa med do // ji ltar grong khyer stong pa de ni sengge dang / stag dang / spyang ki dang / gcan gzan ma rungs pa thams cad kyi gnas dang 'dra ba ltar nang gi skye mched drug po de'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: If one abides in the six sense sources, there is no fear.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gcan gzan ma rungs pa mang po thams cad kyi gnas @37a *//🔽so; ;de bas na byang chub sems dpas skye mched drug ni stong pa ci'ang med pa /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gcan gzan ma rungs pa mang po thams cad kyi gnas @37a *// so; ;de bas na byang chub sems dpas skye mched drug ni stong pa ci'ang med pa /
translated: Just as that empty city is the abode of lions, tigers, wolves, and all kinds of vicious beasts, so too are the six inner sense sources the abode of many vicious beasts of afflictions.

original: mi dge ba thams cad kyi gnas yin par rab tu rtog go /
analyzed: mi dge ba thams cad kyi gnas yin par rab tu rtog go /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattvas thoroughly understand that the six sense sources are empty, devoid of anything, and the abode of all nonvirtue.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Moreover, son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi skye mched drug la stong pa ci'ang med pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi skye mched drug la stong pa ci'ang med pa /
translated: bodhisattva great beings should understand the six inner sense sources to be empty, devoid of anything,

original: grong khyer stong pa de dang 'dra bar rtog go /
analyzed: grong khyer stong pa de dang 'dra bar rtog go /
translated: like that empty city.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pas slu ba'i phyir stong pa ci'ang med pa la yod par 'du shes pa dang / yang dag par bde ba med par bde bar 'du shes pa dang / yang dag par mi med par mir 'du shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pas slu ba'i phyir stong pa ci'ang med pa la yod par 'du shes pa dang / yang dag par bde ba med par bde bar 'du shes pa dang / yang dag par mi med par mir 'du shes so //
translated: Because of being unreal and deceptive, one perceives what is empty and nonexistent as existent, one perceives what is not real and blissful as blissful, and one perceives what is not real and personal as personal.

original: nang gi skye mched drug kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The six internal sense bases are also like this.

original: stong pa ci'ang med pa la yod par 'du shes pa dang / yang dag par bde ba med par bde bar 'du shes pa dang / yang dag par mi med par mir 'du shes te /
analyzed: stong pa ci'ang med pa la yod par 'du shes pa dang / yang dag par bde ba med par bde bar 'du shes pa dang / yang dag par mi med par mir 'du shes te /
translated: One perceives what is empty and nonexistent as existent, one perceives what is not real and blissful as blissful, and one perceives what is not real and personal as personal.

original: mkhas pa shes rab can 'ba' zhig gis ni yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rig par nus so //
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can 'ba' zhig gis ni yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rig par nus so //
translated: Only the wise and the learned are able to know this as it truly is.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /

original: grong khyer stong pa ni res 'ga' mi yod /
analyzed: grong khyer stong pa ni res 'ga' mi yod /

original: res 'ga' mi med do //
analyzed: res 'ga' mi med do //

original: skye mched drug ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: skye mched drug ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The six sense bases are not like this.

original: phyogs gcig tu mi byed do //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu mi byed do //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can gyis shes pa ni mig gis mthong ba ma yin no //

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpas nang gi skye mched drug la dgra dang 'tshe ba mang bar rtogs nas mi sdod @37b mi dal bar 'phags pa'i lam brgyad la nan tan byed pa ni ji ltar mi nges sbrul gdug pa bzhi dang / rigs ngan lnga dang /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpas nang gi skye mched drug la dgra dang 'tshe ba mang bar rtogs nas mi sdod @37b mi dal bar 'phags pa'i lam brgyad la nan tan byed pa ni ji ltar mi nges sbrul gdug pa bzhi dang / rigs ngan lnga dang /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva, having understood that the six inner sense-spheres are full of enemies and dangers, does not linger or relax, but diligently practices the eightfold noble path, just as one would enter the true path out of fear of the four poisonous snakes, the five low-class people,

original: mdza' zhing nye ba ltar sgyus 'chos pa gcig dang / rkun po drug la 'jigs nas bden pa'i lam du zhugs pa bzhin no //

original: yul drug gi dgra'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: yul drug gi dgra'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The enemy of the six objects is also like that.

original: dge ba'i chos 'phrog par bsams na /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos 'phrog par bsams na /

analyzed: dgra chen po drug po la rgyal po dag gis rkang lag bcad kyang de'i sems ni zhi bar byed mi nus so //

original: yul drug gi dgra ma rungs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: yul drug gi dgra ma rungs pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /

translated: Even if stream-enterers, once-returners, and non-returners have their limbs cut off, they cannot steal their virtue.

analyzed: skyes bu dpa' bo dag gis ni dgra chen po drug gdul zhing dbab nus so //

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang de dang 'dra ste / yul drug gi dgra chen po gdul @39a *//

original: zhing dbab nus so //
analyzed: zhing dbab nus so //
translated: They can subdue and defeat the six great enemies of the objects.

analyzed: dper na / pha tshan che zhing rags pa la ni dgra drug pos 'phrog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, a large and powerful family cannot be stolen from by the six enemies.

original: sems can yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sems can yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Sentient beings are also like this.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yod na yul drug gi dgra ma rungs pas 'phrog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen yod na yul drug gi dgra ma rungs pas 'phrog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they have a spiritual teacher, they will not be robbed by the vicious enemies of the six sense objects.

analyzed: dgra chen po drug po des gal te mi'i nor mthong na gzod rku'am 'phrog nus so //

original: yul drug ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: yul drug ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The six sense objects are not like this.

original: mthong ngam / shes sam /
analyzed: mthong ngam / shes sam /

original: thos sam / dri bro'am /
analyzed: thos sam / dri bro'am /

analyzed: reg gam / tshor ba tsam gyis kyang 'phrog nus so //

analyzed: dgra chen po drug ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi'i nor rdzas 'ba' zhig 'phrog nus kyi /
translated: The six great enemies can only steal the wealth and possessions of humans in the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'phrog mi nus so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi 'phrog mi nus so //
translated: They cannot steal from the form and formless realms.

original: yul drug gi dgra ma rungs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: yul drug gi dgra ma rungs pa ni de lta ma yin te /

analyzed: khams gsum gyi dge ba'i nor rin po che thams cad 'phrog nus so //
translated: They can steal all the precious wealth of virtue in the three realms.

analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpas yul drug la dgra drug pas lhag par yang dag par rab tu rtog go /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattvas should correctly and thoroughly investigate the six sense objects as being worse than the six enemies.

analyzed: de ltar rtogs nas 'phags pa'i lam brgyad la nan tan byed pa la phyin ci log tu mi ldog pa ni /
translated: Having understood in this way, one should not turn back from the effort to practice the eightfold noble path.

original: ji ltar 'jigs pa de sbrul gdug pa bzhi dang / rigs ngan lnga dang / nye ba ltar sgyus 'chos pa gcig dang / dgra chen po drug dang / grong khyer stong pas 'jigs shing lam du zhugs te song ba dang 'dra'o //

translated: This is like the fear of the four poisonous snakes, the five low-caste people, the one deceitful friend, the six great enemies, and the empty city.

analyzed: lam du chu chen po dang phrad pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa yin te /
translated: Encountering a great river on the road means afflictions.

analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems @39b dpas nyon mongs pa de la chu chen po dang 'dra bar rtog ce na /

analyzed: chu drag pos spos kyi bal glang yang khyer zhing g-yeng nus pa ltar /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i chu drag po'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The great river of afflictions is like that.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyang g-yeng nus so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyang g-yeng nus so //

analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpas nyon mongs pa la chu drag po dang 'dra bar rab tu rtog go /

analyzed: de la zab cing gting dpag dka' bas na chu'i klung zhes bya'o //

original: mthar thug pa med pas che zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mthar thug pa med pas che zhes bya ste /

analyzed: de'i nang na reg bya ma rungs pa la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs yod do //
translated: Within it there are various kinds of bad sensations and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa'i klung chen po'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i klung chen po'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The great river of the afflictions is like that.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig gis gting la thug pa'i phyir shin tu zab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig gis gting la thug pa'i phyir shin tu zab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “deep” because only the Buddhas and bodhisattvas reach its bottom.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig gis mthar gtugs pa'i phyir yangs shing che ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig gis mthar gtugs pa'i phyir yangs shing che ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “vast and great” because only the Buddhas and bodhisattvas reach its end.

original: rtag tu sems can thams cad la 'tshe ba'i phyir reg bya ma rungs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rtag tu sems can thams cad la 'tshe ba'i phyir reg bya ma rungs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called “bad sensations” because it always harms all sentient beings.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpas nyon mongs pa de la chu chen po dang 'dra bar rtog go; klung chen po'i chu ni rtsa dang shing dang nags tshal thams cad skyed nus so //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpas nyon mongs pa de la chu chen po dang 'dra bar rtog go; klung chen po'i chu ni rtsa dang shing dang nags tshal thams cad skyed nus so //
translated: The water of a great river is able to produce all the grass, trees, forests, and so on.

original: nyon mongs pa'i klung chen po'i chu 'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i klung chen po'i chu 'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The water of the great river of afflictions is also like that,

original: sems can gyi srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga skyed nus so //
analyzed: sems can gyi srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga skyed nus so //
translated: for it is able to produce the twenty-five forms of existence of sentient beings.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa la klung chen po dang 'dra bar rtog go /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa la klung chen po dang 'dra bar rtog go /
translated: Therefore, bodhisattvas consider afflictions to be like a great river.

original: dper na / mi zhig chu klung chen por lhung na khrel ba dang 'dzem pa med do //🔽sems can dag kyang de @40a *//
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig chu klung chen por lhung na khrel ba dang 'dzem pa med do // sems can dag kyang de @40a *//
translated: For example, if a person falls into a great river, he will have no sense of shame or embarrassment.

original: dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dang 'dra ste /
translated: Sentient beings are also like that.

original: nyon mongs pa'i chur lhung na khrel ba dang 'dzem pa med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i chur lhung na khrel ba dang 'dzem pa med do //
translated: When they fall into the water of afflictions, they have no sense of shame or embarrassment.

original: chu chen por lhung na gting du ma phyin par tshe'i dus byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu chen por lhung na gting du ma phyin par tshe'i dus byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you fall into a great river, you will die before you reach the bottom.

original: nyon mongs ba'i chur lhung ba'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs ba'i chur lhung ba'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Falling into the water of afflictions is also like that.

original: gting la ma thug par srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga'i nang du 'khor zhing 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gting la ma thug par srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga'i nang du 'khor zhing 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Without reaching the bottom, they will continue to circle in the twenty-five forms of existence.

original: gting zhes bya ba ni stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gting zhes bya ba ni stong pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The “bottom” is the characteristic of emptiness.

original: gang stong pa'i mtshan nyid la nan tan ma byas na /
analyzed: gang stong pa'i mtshan nyid la nan tan ma byas na /
translated: If one does not practice the characteristic of emptiness,

original: de ni srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga las ring du 'gyur ba ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga las ring du 'gyur ba ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: one should know that one will not go beyond the twenty-five forms of existence.

original: sems can thams cad ni stong pa dang mtshan med pa la nan tan ma byas pas rtag tu nyon mongs pa'i chu drag pos khyer ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni stong pa dang mtshan med pa la nan tan ma byas pas rtag tu nyon mongs pa'i chu drag pos khyer ro //
translated: Because all sentient beings do not practice emptiness and signlessness, they are constantly carried away by the strong current of the afflictions.

original: chu chen po ni lus 'ba' zhig g-yeng zhing 'jig nus kyi /
analyzed: chu chen po ni lus 'ba' zhig g-yeng zhing 'jig nus kyi /
translated: A great river can only disturb and destroy the body.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad la g-yeng mi nus so //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad la g-yeng mi nus so //
translated: It cannot disturb all wholesome dharmas.

original: nyon mongs pa'i chu chen po ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i chu chen po ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: But the great current of the afflictions is not like that.

original: lus dang sems kyi dge ba'i chos thams cad gzhig nus so //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi dge ba'i chos thams cad gzhig nus so //
translated: It can destroy all the wholesome dharmas of body and mind.

original: chu drag po chen po ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi 'ba' zhig g-yeng zhing khyer nus kyi; nyon mongs pa'i chu chen po ni khams gsum gyi lha dang mi thams cad g-yeng zhing khyer nus so //🔽'jig rten gyi chu chen po ni lag pas bru zhing rkang pas 'phras na pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu drag po chen po ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi mi 'ba' zhig g-yeng zhing khyer nus kyi; nyon mongs pa'i chu chen po ni khams gsum gyi lha dang mi thams cad g-yeng zhing khyer nus so // 'jig rten gyi chu chen po ni lag pas bru zhing rkang pas 'phras na pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The great flood of desire can only disturb and carry away the people of the desire realm, but the great flood of afflictions can disturb and carry away all the gods and humans of the three realms.

original: nyon mongs pa'i chu chen po ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i chu chen po ni /
translated: The great flood of the world can be crossed by wading through it with one’s hands and feet, but the great flood of afflictions

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi grus pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi grus pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: can only be crossed by the bodhisattvas with the boat of the six perfections.

original: ji ltar chu chen @40b po ni shin tu rgal dka' ste /
analyzed: ji ltar chu chen @40b po ni shin tu rgal dka' ste /
translated: Just as the great flood is very difficult to cross,

original: nyon mongs pa'i chu chen po'ang de dang 'dra bar shin tu rgal dka'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i chu chen po'ang de dang 'dra bar shin tu rgal dka'o //
translated: so too the great flood of afflictions is very difficult to cross.

original: de la ji ltar na shin tu rgal dka' ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na shin tu rgal dka' ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called very difficult to cross?

original: 'di ltar sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bar du'ang mthar rgal bar ma gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bcu pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bar du'ang mthar rgal bar ma gyur te /
translated: Because even the bodhisattvas on the tenth ground have not yet fully crossed it.

original: sangs rgyas 'ba' zhig gis mthar brgal bar gyur pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'ba' zhig gis mthar brgal bar gyur pas /
translated: Only the Buddha has crossed to the other shore.

original: de bas na shin tu rgal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na shin tu rgal dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “very difficult to cross.”

original: dper na / mi la la zhig chu chen pos g-yengs na dge ba'i chos spu'i nyag ma tsam yang spyod mi nus so //
analyzed: dper na / mi la la zhig chu chen pos g-yengs na dge ba'i chos spu'i nyag ma tsam yang spyod mi nus so //
translated: For example, if a person is carried away by a great river, he is unable to practice even a single hair’s breadth of good dharmas.

original: sems can yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: sems can yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Sentient beings are also like this.

original: nyon mongs pa'i chus g-yengs na dge ba'i chos spyod mi nus so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i chus g-yengs na dge ba'i chos spyod mi nus so //
translated: If they are carried away by the river of afflictions, they are unable to practice good dharmas.

original: ji ltar mi dag chur lhung zhing g-yeng bar gyur na mthu yod pa dag gis dbyung nus so //
analyzed: ji ltar mi dag chur lhung zhing g-yeng bar gyur na mthu yod pa dag gis dbyung nus so //
translated: If people fall into the water and are carried away, those with strength can pull them out.

original: nyon mongs pa'i chur lhung ba'i log sred can ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar du'ang dbyung mi nus so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i chur lhung ba'i log sred can ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bar du'ang dbyung mi nus so //
translated: But those with wrong views who have fallen into the river of afflictions cannot be pulled out by śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, or even tathāgatas.

original: 'jig rten na chu chen po ni bskal pa byung ba'i tshe nyi ma bdun gyis gdungs na skam par nus so //
analyzed: 'jig rten na chu chen po ni bskal pa byung ba'i tshe nyi ma bdun gyis gdungs na skam par nus so //
translated: In the world, when a great flood occurs, the seven suns can burn it up and dry it out.

original: nyon mongs pa'i chu klung chen po ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i chu klung chen po ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But the great river of afflictions is not like that.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgoms kyang skam par mi nus so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis byang chub kyi yan lag bdun bsgoms kyang skam par mi nus so //
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, though they cultivate the seven factors of enlightenment, are unable to dry up the afflictions.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpas nyon mongs pa rnams la chu drag po dang 'dra bar rtog ste /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpas nyon mongs pa rnams la chu drag po dang 'dra bar rtog ste /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva considers the afflictions to be like a strong current.

original: ji ltar mi des sbrul gdug pa bzhi dang / rigs ngan lnga dang / nye ba ltar sgyus 'chos pa gcig dang / dgra chen po drug gis 'jigs te grong khyer @41a *//
analyzed: ji ltar mi des sbrul gdug pa bzhi dang / rigs ngan lnga dang / nye ba ltar sgyus 'chos pa gcig dang / dgra chen po drug gis 'jigs te grong khyer @41a *//
translated: Just as that man, fearing the four poisonous snakes, the five families of outcasts, the one who disguises himself as a friend, and the six great enemies, left the empty city,

original: stong pa btang nas lam du zhugs te song ba las chu chen po dang phrad nas rtsva bsdus te gzings bcas pa dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: stong pa btang nas lam du zhugs te song ba las chu chen po dang phrad nas rtsva bsdus te gzings bcas pa dang mtshungs so //
translated: entered the road, and proceeded. Having encountered a great river, he gathered grass, made a raft, and crossed over.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The bodhisattva is also like this.

original: chen po bzhi'i sbrul gdug pa dang / phung po lnga'i rigs ngan dang / 'dod chags kyi nye ba ltar sgyus 'chos pa dang / skye mched drug gi grong khyer stong pa dang / yul drug gi dgra ma rungs pas 'jigs nas /
analyzed: chen po bzhi'i sbrul gdug pa dang / phung po lnga'i rigs ngan dang / 'dod chags kyi nye ba ltar sgyus 'chos pa dang / skye mched drug gi grong khyer stong pa dang / yul drug gi dgra ma rungs pas 'jigs nas /
translated: He is frightened by the four great poisonous snakes, the five evil families, the five desires, the six empty cities, the six objects, and the six enemies.

original: nyon mongs pa'i chu'i 'gram du phyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i mkhyen cing gzigs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms pas gru dang gzings byas te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i chu'i 'gram du phyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i mkhyen cing gzigs pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgoms pas gru dang gzings byas te /
translated: He has built a boat and a raft by means of the practice of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, the knowledge and insight of liberation, the six perfections, and the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: gzings de la brten nas nyon mongs pa'i chu la brgal te /
analyzed: gzings de la brten nas nyon mongs pa'i chu la brgal te /
translated: He has crossed the river of afflictions

original: pha rol gyi 'gram du rtag pa dang bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das par phyin to //
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'gram du rtag pa dang bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das par phyin to //
translated: and has reached the other shore, the eternal bliss of nirvana.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das pa chen po sgom pas 'di snyam du sems so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das pa chen po sgom pas 'di snyam du sems so //
translated: The bodhisattva who cultivates the great nirvana thinks like this:

original: bdag gal te lus kyi sdug bsngal dang sems kyi sdug bsngal de lta bu bzod mi nus na sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa'i chu las sgrol mi nus so snyam sems so //
analyzed: bdag gal te lus kyi sdug bsngal dang sems kyi sdug bsngal de lta bu bzod mi nus na sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa'i chu las sgrol mi nus so snyam sems so //
translated: If I cannot bear such physical and mental suffering, I will not be able to deliver all sentient beings from the flood of afflictions.

original: de ltar bsams pas lus dang sems la de lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa yod kyang kha rog par bzod pa nyams su len to //
analyzed: de ltar bsams pas lus dang sems la de lta bu'i sdug bsngal gyis gdungs pa yod kyang kha rog par bzod pa nyams su len to //
translated: Thinking in this way, even though his body and mind are tormented by such suffering, he endures it silently.

original: bzod pa nyams su @41b blangs pas zag pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzod pa nyams su @41b blangs pas zag pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By practicing patience, the outflows do not arise.

original: de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' la'ang zag pa rnams med na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la zag pa mi mnga' ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa' la'ang zag pa rnams med na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la zag pa mi mnga' ba lta ci smos te /
translated: If such a bodhisattva has no outflows, how much less would the Bhagavat Buddhas have them.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is not called one with outflows.

original: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa med pa'ang ma yin pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa med pa'ang ma yin pa zhe na /
translated: How is it that the Tathāgata is not without outflows?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu zag pa dang bcas pa'i nang du gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu zag pa dang bcas pa'i nang du gshegs pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata always enters into those with outflows.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga yin pas de bas na nyan thos dang / bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bo dag gis bcom ldan 'das la zag pa yod do zhes zer te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga yin pas de bas na nyan thos dang / bus pa ma rabs so so'i skye bo dag gis bcom ldan 'das la zag pa yod do zhes zer te /
translated: The twenty-five existences are defiled, and therefore the śrāvakas and foolish ordinary beings say that the Bhagavān has defilements.

original: yang dag par na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni zag pa med pa'o //
translated: But in reality, the Bhagavān Buddhas are without defilements.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nges pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni nges pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: For this reason, the Bhagavān Buddhas have no fixed characteristics.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de bas na tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi bshig pa dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo la skur pa dang / log sred can yang ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na tshul khrims kyi rtsa ba bzhi bshig pa dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo la skur pa dang / log sred can yang ma nges pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the one who has destroyed the four roots of discipline, the one who has reviled the Vaipulya sūtras, and the one with wrong desires are also indeterminate.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu snang ba mtho btsun dpal gyi rgyal pos gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu snang ba mtho btsun dpal gyi rgyal pos gsol pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantaprabhāsa-udgata-śrī-rāja said:

original: de de bzhin no //🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te /
translated: It is so!

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa bzhin te /
translated: It is just as the Bhagavān has said.

original: chos thams cad kyang ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang ma nges pa'o //
translated: All dharmas are also indeterminate.

original: de ltar ma nges pas na de bzhin gshegs pa mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ma zhugs par rig go /
analyzed: de ltar ma nges pas na de bzhin gshegs pa mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar ma zhugs par rig go /
translated: Since they are indeterminate, know that the Tathāgata has not entered final nirvāṇa.

original: ji ltar @42a *//
analyzed: ji ltar @42a *//
translated: How is it so?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar gsungs pa las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po bsgoms pas ma thos pa thos pa'i nang nas mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa chen po mchis so zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar gsungs pa las byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po bsgoms pas ma thos pa thos pa'i nang nas mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa chen po mchis so zhes gsungs te /
translated: As the Bhagavān previously taught, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who cultivates great nirvāṇa, from among those who have not heard, hears: ‘There is nirvāṇa, there is great nirvāṇa.’

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang lags /
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang lags /
translated: What is nirvāṇa?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bgyi ba ni gang lags /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bgyi ba ni gang lags /
translated: What is called great nirvāṇa?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu snang ba mtho btsun dpal gyi rgyal po la legs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu snang ba mtho btsun dpal gyi rgyal po la legs so //
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantaprabhāsa-udgata-śrī-rāja:

original: legs so zhes bya ba byin no //
analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba byin no //
translated: “Excellent, excellent!

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: gal te byang chub sems dpa' gang dran pa'i gzungs thob pa ni gzod khyed dang 'dra bar 'dri nus so //
analyzed: gal te byang chub sems dpa' gang dran pa'i gzungs thob pa ni gzod khyed dang 'dra bar 'dri nus so //
translated: If a bodhisattva has attained the dhāraṇī of mindfulness, he can then ask questions like you have.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family,

original: 'jig rten pa dag ni mtsho dang mtsho chen por gdags pa dang / klung dang klung chen po dang / ri dang ri chen po dang / sa dang sa chen po dang / grong khyer dang grong khyer chen po dang / sems can dang sems can chen po dang /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dag ni mtsho dang mtsho chen por gdags pa dang / klung dang klung chen po dang / ri dang ri chen po dang / sa dang sa chen po dang / grong khyer dang grong khyer chen po dang / sems can dang sems can chen po dang /
translated: the worldly designate oceans and great oceans, rivers and great rivers, mountains and great mountains, earth and great earth, cities and great cities, sentient beings and great sentient beings,

original: rgyal po dang rgyal po chen po dang / mi dang mi chen po dang / lha dang lha'i nang na lha dang / lam dang lam chen po yod do zhes gdags pa ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rgyal po dang rgyal po chen po dang / mi dang mi chen po dang / lha dang lha'i nang na lha dang / lam dang lam chen po yod do zhes gdags pa ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: kings and great kings, humans and great humans, gods and gods among gods, paths and great paths. Nirvāṇa is also like that.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa chen po yod do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa chen po yod do //
translated: There is nirvāṇa and great nirvāṇa.

original: ji ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mya ngan las 'das pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is nirvāṇa?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family,

original: ji ltar bkres @42b bas zas cung zad rnyed na bde ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bkres @42b bas zas cung zad rnyed na bde ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Just as when a hungry person finds a little food, it is called “happiness.”

original: de ltar bde ba de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bde ba de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That kind of happiness is also called “nirvāṇa.”

original: nad pa nad sos pa ni bde ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nad pa nad sos pa ni bde ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Just as when a sick person is cured, it is called “happiness.”

original: de ltar bde ba de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bde ba de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That kind of happiness is also called “nirvāṇa.”

original: ji ltar 'jigs pas skyabs dang rten rnyed pa ni bde ba thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jigs pas skyabs dang rten rnyed pa ni bde ba thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Just as when someone in danger finds protection and support, it is called “attaining happiness.”

original: de ltar bde ba de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bde ba de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That kind of happiness is also called “nirvāṇa.”

original: ji ltar dbul pos rin po che sna bdun rnyed na bde ba thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar dbul pos rin po che sna bdun rnyed na bde ba thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Just as when a poor person finds the seven precious substances, it is called “attaining happiness.”

original: de ltar bde ba de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bde ba de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That kind of happiness is also called “nirvāṇa.”

original: ji ltar keng rus la rtog pa 'dod chags mi skye bar gyur pa ni bde ba thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar keng rus la rtog pa 'dod chags mi skye bar gyur pa ni bde ba thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Just as when the thought of a skeleton arises, desire does not arise, it is called “attaining happiness.”

original: de ltar bde ba de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bde ba de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That kind of happiness is also called “nirvāṇa.”

original: de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa de dag ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa de dag ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Such nirvāṇa is not called the great nirvāṇa.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: bkres shing skom pa dang / na ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'dod chags pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bkres shing skom pa dang / na ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'dod chags pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because of hunger and thirst, sickness, fear, and desire, it is called nirvāṇa,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not the great nirvāṇa.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gal te bus pa ma rabs dang nyan thos la sogs pa 'on te kun rdzob bam /
analyzed: gal te bus pa ma rabs dang nyan thos la sogs pa 'on te kun rdzob bam /
translated: if the childish, the lowly, the śrāvakas, and so forth, or even the relative truth,

original: 'on te 'phags pa'i lam gyi rkyen gyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa chod na bde ba thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te 'phags pa'i lam gyi rkyen gyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa chod na bde ba thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: or the conditions of the noble path, cut through the afflictions of the desire realm, it is called the attainment of happiness.

original: de ltar bde ba thob pa de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar bde ba thob pa de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya mod kyi /
translated: That attainment of happiness is indeed called nirvāṇa,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes mi bya'o //
translated: but it is not called the great nirvāṇa.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i kun nas nyon mongs pa chod pa nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i kun nas nyon mongs pa chod pa nas /
translated: The cutting through of the afflictions of the first concentration,

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched @43a *//
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched @43a *//
translated: up to the cutting through of the afflictions of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception,

original: stong gi bar gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa chod pa'ang bde ba thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong gi bar gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa chod pa'ang bde ba thob par 'gyur te /
translated: They will also attain bliss by severing the afflictions up to the peak of existence.🔽

original: de ltar bde ba de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bde ba de'ang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The attainment of this bliss is called “nirvāṇa,”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes mi bya'o //
translated: but it is not called “great nirvāṇa.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: nyon mongs pa skye zhing srid pa'i bag chags kyi phyir yang skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa skye zhing srid pa'i bag chags kyi phyir yang skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because afflictions arise and because the latent tendencies of existence arise.

original: ji ltar na nyon mongs pa'i bag chags zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nyon mongs pa'i bag chags zhes bya zhe na /
translated: What are the latent tendencies of the afflictions?

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la nyon mongs pa'i bag chags yod do //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas la nyon mongs pa'i bag chags yod do //
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas have the latent tendencies of the afflictions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: bdag gi lus dang / bdag gi gos /
analyzed: bdag gi lus dang / bdag gi gos /
translated: they have the thought “my body,” “my clothes,”

original: bdag 'gro / bdag 'ong /
analyzed: bdag 'gro / bdag 'ong /
translated: “I go,” “I come,”

original: bdag gis bshad /
analyzed: bdag gis bshad /
translated: “I speak,”

original: bdag gis mnyan /
analyzed: bdag gis mnyan /
translated: “I listen,”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das te /
translated: “the buddhas, the blessed ones, have passed into nirvāṇa,”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin ni bdag med /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin ni bdag med /
translated: “the nature of nirvāṇa is selfless,”

original: bde ba med de /
analyzed: bde ba med de /
translated: “there is no bliss,”🔽“there is no self,”

original: rtag pa dang / yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig yod do zhes smra ba de ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig yod do zhes smra ba de ni nyon mongs pa'i bag chags zhes bya'o //
translated: It is said that the existence of only the permanent and the pure is the so-called ‘habit energy of the passions.’

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yod de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la khyad par gyi mtshan nyid yod de /
translated: The Buddha, the Teaching, and the Community have distinctive characteristics.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yun du mya ngan las 'das pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' yun du mya ngan las 'das pas /
translated: The Tathāgata is eternally in nirvana.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni mnyam ste khyad par med do zhes smra ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni mnyam ste khyad par med do zhes smra ste /
translated: The attainment of nirvana by the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, is the same and has no distinctions.

original: don de lta bas na theg pa gnyis kyis thob pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: don de lta bas na theg pa gnyis kyis thob pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ma yin no //
translated: For this reason, the attainment of the two vehicles is not the great nirvana.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag @43b pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag @43b pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not permanent, blissful, selfhood, or pure.

original: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The permanent, the blissful, the self, and the pure are called the great nirvana.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: dper na / chu mang po shong ba'i gnas ni rgya mtsho zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dper na / chu mang po shong ba'i gnas ni rgya mtsho zhes bya ste /
translated: a place that can contain a great deal of water is called an ocean.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jug pa'i gnas ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jug pa'i gnas ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The place where the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and bhagavat buddhas enter is called “great nirvāṇa.”

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / ting nge 'dzin gsum dang / skyes bu ya brgyad dang / gnas dam pa brgyad dang / kun tu 'gro ba bcus dge ba'i chos tshad med pa de rnams sdud pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / ting nge 'dzin gsum dang / skyes bu ya brgyad dang / gnas dam pa brgyad dang / kun tu 'gro ba bcus dge ba'i chos tshad med pa de rnams sdud pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The four dhyānas, the three samādhis, the eight liberations, the eight excellent abodes, and the ten universal [dharmas]—all of these immeasurable virtuous dharmas are included in what is called “great nirvāṇa.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dper na / klung gang spos kyi bal glang mchog gis rkang pa mi tshugs pa ni klung chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dper na / klung gang spos kyi bal glang mchog gis rkang pa mi tshugs pa ni klung chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: for example, a river that the supreme elephant of perfume cannot cross is called a “great river.”

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas nas sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpas /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas nas sa bcu'i byang chub sems dpas /
translated: From the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas up to the bodhisattvas on the tenth bhūmi,

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi mthong ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi mthong ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya'i /
translated: they do not see the buddha-nature, which is called “nirvāṇa.”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not the great nirvana.

original: gang sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gsal bar mthong ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gsal bar mthong ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: If one clearly sees the Buddha-nature, this is called the great nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di la khyu mchog 'ba' zhig gis gting la thug go /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di la khyu mchog 'ba' zhig gis gting la thug go /
translated: Only the supreme person can fathom the great nirvana.

original: khyu mchog ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste; bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: khyu mchog ces bya ba ni 'di lta ste; bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The supreme person is the Bhagavat.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: gyad mah'a na ga dang / pa ra gan da la sogs pas yun ring du bsal te gzegs kyang mi gzegs pa ni ri chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gyad mah'a na ga dang / pa ra gan da la sogs pas yun ring du bsal te gzegs kyang mi gzegs pa ni ri chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: The great mountain is that which the strong men Mahanadi, Pargandi, and so forth cannot move, even though they push it for a long time.

original: nyan thos dang / @44a *//
analyzed: nyan thos dang / @44a *//
translated: The sravakas,

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / gyad mah'a na ga la sogs pas mi mthong ba de ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / gyad mah'a na ga la sogs pas mi mthong ba de ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, and strong men such as Mahanadi cannot see it, and this is called the great nirvana.

original: gzhan yang; rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang; rigs kyi bu /
translated: Furthermore, son of good family!

original: gang nas gang du rgyal po chung ngu 'dug pa'i gnas ni grong khyer chung ngu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang nas gang du rgyal po chung ngu 'dug pa'i gnas ni grong khyer chung ngu zhes bya'o //
translated: Wherever the king of a small country resides is called a small town.

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po gnas pa'i gnas ni grong khyer chen po zhes bya'o; ;nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas brgyad khri'am /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po gnas pa'i gnas ni grong khyer chen po zhes bya'o; ;nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas brgyad khri'am /
translated: The place where eighty thousand,

original: drug khri'am / bzhi khri'am /
analyzed: drug khri'am / bzhi khri'am /
translated: sixty thousand, forty thousand,

original: nyi khri'am / khri gnas pa'i gnas ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya /
analyzed: nyi khri'am / khri gnas pa'i gnas ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya /
translated: twenty thousand, or ten thousand śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas reside is called nirvāṇa.

original: bla na med pa'i chos kyi mnga' bdag 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po gnas pa'i gnas ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i chos kyi mnga' bdag 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po gnas pa'i gnas ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The place where a universal monarch, lord of the unsurpassed Dharma, resides is called great parinirvāṇa.

original: de bas na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called great parinirvāṇa.🔽Son of noble family,

original: rigs kyi bu; dper na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; dper na /
translated: it is like this:

original: mi la la zhig dmag rnam pa bzhi mthong yang 'jigs pa mi skye ba ni sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi la la zhig dmag rnam pa bzhi mthong yang 'jigs pa mi skye ba ni sems can chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: If someone sees the four divisions of the army and does not become afraid, he is called a great being.

original: gal te sems can gang ngan song gsum gyi lam du nyon mongs pa'i las ngan pa la 'jigs pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: gal te sems can gang ngan song gsum gyi lam du nyon mongs pa'i las ngan pa la 'jigs pa mi skye ste /
translated: If there are sentient beings who do not become afraid of the evil karma of the afflictions on the paths of the three lower realms,

original: de dag tu sems can rgyas par sgrol ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po thob pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag tu sems can rgyas par sgrol ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa chen po thob pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that to liberate sentient beings in these ways is to attain great nirvāṇa.

original: gal te gang pha ma la sri zhu byed cing /
analyzed: gal te gang pha ma la sri zhu byed cing /
translated: If someone serves his parents,

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze la bkur sti byed de /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze la bkur sti byed de /
translated: respects śramaṇas and brahmins,

original: dge ba'i chos la nan tan byed cing smras so cog bden la /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la nan tan byed cing smras so cog bden la /
translated: practices virtuous dharmas, and speaks the truth,

original: rdzun dang / slu ba med de /
analyzed: rdzun dang / slu ba med de /
translated: without lies or deception,

original: ngan pa rnams bzod pa dang / @44b dbul phongs pa la gtong zhing sbyin pa byin nus pa ni skyes bu chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngan pa rnams bzod pa dang / @44b dbul phongs pa la gtong zhing sbyin pa byin nus pa ni skyes bu chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: and is able to be patient with the wicked and give generously to the poor and destitute, he is called a great man.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Bodhisattvas are also like this.

original: byams pa dang snying rje chen po thams cad la brtse ba /
analyzed: byams pa dang snying rje chen po thams cad la brtse ba /
translated: They have great love and compassion for all,

original: sems can rnams kyi pha ma lta bur gyur ba /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi pha ma lta bur gyur ba /
translated: are like parents to sentient beings,

original: sems can mang po 'khor ba'i klung las sgrol ba /
analyzed: sems can mang po 'khor ba'i klung las sgrol ba /
translated: liberate many sentient beings from the river of saṃsāra,

original: sems can kun la bden pa gcig pa'i lam ston pa ste /
analyzed: sems can kun la bden pa gcig pa'i lam ston pa ste /
translated: and teach all sentient beings the path of the single truth.

original: de ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called great nirvāṇa.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: “Great” means inconceivable.

original: gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa de la sems can thams cad yid ches par mi nus te /
analyzed: gang bsam gyis mi khyab pa de la sems can thams cad yid ches par mi nus te /
translated: That which is inconceivable cannot be believed by all sentient beings.

original: de ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “great parinirvāṇa.”

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' 'ba' zhig mthong bas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Only buddhas and bodhisattvas see it, and so it is called “great parinirvāṇa.”

original: yang ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis chen po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i rgyu ci'i rkyen gyis chen po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: “What are its causes and conditions? Why is it called great?”

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshad med pas gdod chen po zhes bya ba gyur to //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshad med pas gdod chen po zhes bya ba gyur to //
translated: Because its causes and conditions are immeasurable, it is called great.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son!

original: dper na / 'jig rten pas rgyu rkyen mang pos byas pa ni chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na / 'jig rten pas rgyu rkyen mang pos byas pa ni chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, worldly people say that that which is produced by many causes and conditions is great.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The parinirvāṇa is also like this.

original: rgyu rkyen mang pos thob par gyur pas de'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen mang pos thob par gyur pas de'i phyir chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is attained through many causes and conditions, it is called great.

original: yang ji ltar na chen po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na chen po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: “How is it called great?”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la bdag chen po yod pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la bdag chen po yod pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because there is a great self in nirvana, it is called “great nirvana.”

original: de la mya ngan las 'das pa bdag med cing dbang chen po thob pa'i phyir bdag chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la mya ngan las 'das pa bdag med cing dbang chen po thob pa'i phyir bdag chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: In this regard, because nirvana is without self and one attains great power, it is called “great self.”

original: ji ltar na dbang chen po thob pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dbang chen po thob pa zhe na /
translated: How does one attain great power?

original: dbang @45a *// brgyad thob pa'i phyir bdag ces bya'o //
analyzed: dbang @45a *// brgyad thob pa'i phyir bdag ces bya'o //
translated: Because one attains the eight powers, it is called “self.”

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: lus gcig la lus mang por ston cing /
analyzed: lus gcig la lus mang por ston cing /
translated: One displays many bodies in a single body,

original: lus kyi grangs dang che chung rdul phra rab snyed kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa snyed du 'gengs pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyi grangs dang che chung rdul phra rab snyed kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa snyed du 'gengs pa ste /
translated: and the number of bodies, large and small, fills immeasurable world systems in the ten directions with subtle particles.
