translated: and some do not have causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen yod pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen yod pa ni /
translated: Those that have causes and conditions

original: dper na / sh'a ri'i bu lta bu ma'i ming sh'a ri ka zhes bya ba'i rkyen gyis ming gdags pa'i phyir sh'a ri'i bu zhes btags so //
analyzed: dper na / sh'a ri'i bu lta bu ma'i ming sh'a ri ka zhes bya ba'i rkyen gyis ming gdags pa'i phyir sh'a ri'i bu zhes btags so //
translated: Śāriputra was given the name Śāriputra because of the condition of his mother’s name being Śārikā.

original: dge slong ma du la zhes bya ba yul ma du lar skyes te /
analyzed: dge slong ma du la zhes bya ba yul ma du lar skyes te /
translated: The bhikṣuṇī Duḥlā was born in the country of Duḥlā.

original: yul gyi ming las ma du la zhes btags so //
analyzed: yul gyi ming las ma du la zhes btags so //
translated: She was named Duḥlā because of the name of the country.

original: moong+gal ya na zhes bya ba ni rus yin te /
analyzed: moong+gal ya na zhes bya ba ni rus yin te /
translated: Maudgalyāyana is a clan name.

original: rus las ming btags pa'i phyir moong+gal zhes btags so //
analyzed: rus las ming btags pa'i phyir moong+gal zhes btags so //
translated: He was named Maudgalyāyana because of his clan name.

original: dper na / nga ni goo ta ma'i rigs las skyes te /
analyzed: dper na / nga ni goo ta ma'i rigs las skyes te /
translated: For example, I was born into the Gautama clan.

original: de'i phyir ming goo ta ma zhes btags so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ming goo ta ma zhes btags so //
translated: Therefore, I was named Gautama.

original: dge slong byi sha ka zhes bya ba ni byi sha ka ni skar ma'i ming ste /
analyzed: dge slong byi sha ka zhes bya ba ni byi sha ka ni skar ma'i ming ste /
translated: The bhikṣu Viśākha was named Viśākha because of the name of the constellation.

original: skar ma'i ming las ming thob pas byi sha ka zhes btags so //
analyzed: skar ma'i ming las ming thob pas byi sha ka zhes btags so //
translated: He was named Viśākha because of obtaining his name from the constellation.

original: ji ltar sor mo drug pa sor mo drug yod pa'i rkyen gyis sor mo drug pa zhes ming du btags so //
analyzed: ji ltar sor mo drug pa sor mo drug yod pa'i rkyen gyis sor mo drug pa zhes ming du btags so //
translated: For example, Ṣaḍaṅgulī was named Ṣaḍaṅgulī because of the condition of having six fingers.

original: sangs rgyas sbyin dang / lha sbyin zhes bya ba'ang sangs rgyas dang / lha'i rkyen gyis sangs rgyas sbyin dang / lha sbyin zhes btags so //🔽drod gsher @48a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas sbyin dang / lha sbyin zhes bya ba'ang sangs rgyas dang / lha'i rkyen gyis sangs rgyas sbyin dang / lha sbyin zhes btags so // drod gsher @48a *//
translated: The names Buddhadatta and Devadatta were given because of the conditions of the Buddha and the god.

original: las skyes pa'i rkyen gyis drod gsher skyes zhes btags so //
analyzed: las skyes pa'i rkyen gyis drod gsher skyes zhes btags so //
translated: The name moisture-born is given because of the condition of being born from moisture.

original: dper na / sgra'i rgyus ka ka la zhes bya ba dang / ku ku la zhes bya ba dang / tsu tsu la zhes bya bar ming du btags te /
analyzed: dper na / sgra'i rgyus ka ka la zhes bya ba dang / ku ku la zhes bya ba dang / tsu tsu la zhes bya bar ming du btags te /
translated: For example, because of the cause of sound, the names kaka, kukku, and cacca are given.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa'i ming ni rgyu dang rkyen las btags pa'i ming zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa'i ming ni rgyu dang rkyen las btags pa'i ming zhes bya'o //
translated: Such names are called names designated from causes and conditions.

original: rgyu rkyen med pa ni ji ltar padmo dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' lta bu dang / manda ra ba ni gzhal med khang skom 'thung zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen med pa ni ji ltar padmo dang / sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / nam mkha' lta bu dang / manda ra ba ni gzhal med khang skom 'thung zhes bya ste /
translated: Without causes and conditions, names such as lotus, earth, water, fire, wind, space, and mandarava are called palace of thirst.

original: gzhal med khang skom mi 'thung yang manda ra ba zhes bya ba dang / sarba tsha dan zhes bya ba ni sbrul gyi bla gab ces bya ste /
analyzed: gzhal med khang skom mi 'thung yang manda ra ba zhes bya ba dang / sarba tsha dan zhes bya ba ni sbrul gyi bla gab ces bya ste /
translated: The palace is called “not drinking water,” and “all the grass” is called “the serpent’s covering.”

original: yang dag par sbrul gyi bla gab ma yin pas de ni rgyu med par nan gyis ming du btags pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sbrul gyi bla gab ma yin pas de ni rgyu med par nan gyis ming du btags pa'o //
translated: But it is not really the serpent’s covering, so this is a name that is forcefully given without cause.

original: ji ltar ji la ba yi zhes bya ba ni mar 'thung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar ji la ba yi zhes bya ba ni mar 'thung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: “Just as ‘drinking ghee’ is called ‘drinking butter,’

original: yang dag par mar mi 'thung bar mar 'thung ba zhes btags te /
analyzed: yang dag par mar mi 'thung bar mar 'thung ba zhes btags te /
translated: but it is not really drinking butter, it is called ‘drinking butter.’

original: de ni rgyu med par nan gyis ming du btags pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyu med par nan gyis ming du btags pa'o //
translated: This is a name that is forcefully given without cause.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa chen po 'di yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: This great nirvāṇa is also like that,

original: rgyu dang rkyen med par nan gyis ming btags so //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen med par nan gyis ming btags so //
translated: a name that is forcefully given without cause.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: dper na / nam mkha' ni nam mkha' cung zad kyis chen po zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' ni nam mkha' cung zad kyis chen po zhes mi bya'o //
translated: For example, space is not called ‘great’ because of a little space.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Nirvāṇa is also like that,

original: mtshan nyid cung zad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid cung zad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes mi bya'o //
translated: then it would not be called the Great Nirvana.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son!

original: dper na / chos gzhal @48b du med pa //
analyzed: dper na / chos gzhal @48b du med pa //
translated: For example, the Dharma which is immeasurable

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: and inconceivable is called great.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Nirvana is also like this.

original: gzhal du med bsam gyis mi khyab pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhal du med bsam gyis mi khyab pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is immeasurable and inconceivable, it is called the Great Nirvana.

original: yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig pas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig pas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the Great Nirvana because it is completely pure.

original: ji ltar na yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig ces bya zhe na /
translated: How is it that it is called completely pure?

original: yongs su dag pa la rnam pa bzhi ste; de la srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga po ni ma dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa la rnam pa bzhi ste; de la srid pa nyi shu rtsa lnga po ni ma dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: There are four kinds of purity. The twenty-five existences are called impure.

original: de dag rab tu chos pas yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag rab tu chos pas yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because they are completely pure, they are called completely pure.

original: dag pa 'di nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dag pa 'di nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This purity is called nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de la srid pa zhes bya'ang mya ngan las 'das pa nyid ni yang dag par na srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de la srid pa zhes bya'ang mya ngan las 'das pa nyid ni yang dag par na srid pa ma yin te /
translated: That nirvāṇa is also called “existence.” But in reality, nirvāṇa is not existence.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mya ngan las 'das pa'ang srid par bshad do //🔽dper na / 'jig rten pas pha ma ma yin par pha ma zhes zer te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten pa'i rjes su mya ngan las 'das pa'ang srid par bshad do // dper na / 'jig rten pas pha ma ma yin par pha ma zhes zer te /
translated: The Buddha Bhagavān, following worldly convention, explains nirvāṇa as existence.

original: yang dag par pha ma ma yin par pha ma zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang dag par pha ma ma yin par pha ma zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, worldly people say that what is not a father is a father and what is not a mother is a mother.🔽In reality, what is not a father is not a father and what is not a mother is not a mother.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Nirvāṇa is also like that.

original: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su de bzhin gshegs pa la mya ngan las 'das pa chen po mnga'o //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rjes su de bzhin gshegs pa la mya ngan las 'das pa chen po mnga'o // zhes gsungs pa yin /
translated: Following worldly convention, it is said that the Tathāgata has great nirvāṇa.

original: las rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: las rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: It is pure action.

original: bus pa ma rabs thams cad ni las rnam par ma dag pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa med do //
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs thams cad ni las rnam par ma dag pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa med do //
translated: Because all childish ordinary beings do not have pure action, they do not have nirvāṇa.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni 'phrin las yongs su dag pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni 'phrin las yongs su dag pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The Buddha Bhagavān is called “great purity” because his action is completely pure.

original: @49a *// yongs su dag pa chen po yin pas na mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya ba yin /
analyzed: @49a *// yongs su dag pa chen po yin pas na mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya ba yin /
translated: It is called “great nirvāṇa” because it is a great purity.

original: lus yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: lus yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: It is the purity of the body.

original: gal te lus mi rtag na ma dag pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te lus mi rtag na ma dag pa yin no //
translated: If the body is impermanent, it is impure.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni rtag pa yin pas yongs su dag pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku ni rtag pa yin pas yongs su dag pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The body of the Tathāgata is permanent, and therefore it is called “great purity.”

original: yongs su dag pa chen po'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya ba yin /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa chen po'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya ba yin /
translated: Because it is a great purity, it is called “great nirvāṇa.”

original: sems yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: sems yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: It is the purity of the mind.

original: gal te zag pa dang bcas na ma dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gal te zag pa dang bcas na ma dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: If it is contaminated, it is called “impure.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zag pa mi mnga' bas yongs su dag pa chen po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zag pa mi mnga' bas yongs su dag pa chen po zhes bya ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is not contaminated, and therefore it is called “great purity.”

original: yongs su dag pa chen po'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya ba yin te bzhi'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa chen po'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa chen po zhes bya ba yin te bzhi'o //
translated: Because it is a great purity, it is called “great nirvāṇa.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ni rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di bsgoms pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa gcig ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mos mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di bsgoms pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa gcig ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the first quality possessed by a son of the lineage or daughter of the lineage who cultivates this Great Nirvana Sutra.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Moreover, son of the lineage!

original: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde la nan tan byed pa'i bsod nams gnyis pa dang ldan pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde la nan tan byed pa'i bsod nams gnyis pa dang ldan pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is it that the bodhisattva-mahāsattva is said to possess the second merit of practicing the Great Nirvana Sutra?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of the lineage!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde la nan tan byed pa na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde la nan tan byed pa na /
translated: When the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices the Great Nirvana Sutra,

original: sngon ma thob pa thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon ma thob pa thob par 'gyur /
translated: he will attain what he has not attained before,

original: sngon ma mthong ba mthong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon ma mthong ba mthong bar 'gyur /
translated: he will see what he has not seen before,

original: sngon ma thos pa thos par 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon ma thos pa thos par 'gyur /
translated: he will hear what he has not heard before,

original: sngon ma phyin @49b pa phyin par 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon ma phyin @49b pa phyin par 'gyur /
translated: he will go where he has not gone before,

original: sngon mi shes pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon mi shes pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: and he will know what he has not known before.

original: de la ji ltar na sngon ma thob pa thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na sngon ma thob pa thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that he will attain what he has not attained before?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: rdzu 'phrul sngon ma thob pa de thob par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul sngon ma thob pa de thob par gyur ba'o //
translated: He has attained what he had not attained before.

original: rdzu 'phrul la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of supernatural powers:

original: nang dang / phyi rol lo //
analyzed: nang dang / phyi rol lo //
translated: external and internal.

original: phyi rol ces bya ba ni mu stegs can dang thun mong pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol ces bya ba ni mu stegs can dang thun mong pa'o //
translated: The external are those held in common with the tīrthikas.

original: nang zhes bya ba la'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nang zhes bya ba la'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The internal are also of two kinds:

original: theg pa gnyis dang / byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gnyis dang / byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: those of the two vehicles and those of the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde la nan tan byed pa'i rdzu 'phrul thob pa ni nyan thos pa dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde la nan tan byed pa'i rdzu 'phrul thob pa ni nyan thos pa dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: The supernatural powers of those who practice the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra of the bodhisattvas are not held in common with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de la ji ltar na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa zhe na /
translated: How are they not held in common with the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: theg pa gnyis kyis rdzu 'phrul dang / cho 'phrul sprul to cog ni bsam pa gcig dang / bya ba gcig ste mang por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: theg pa gnyis kyis rdzu 'phrul dang / cho 'phrul sprul to cog ni bsam pa gcig dang / bya ba gcig ste mang por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever supernatural powers and transformations of the two vehicles are all one thought and one action, and do not become many.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas are not like this.

original: bsam pa gcig gis lam rgyud lngar lus yongs su rdzogs par ston nus so //
analyzed: bsam pa gcig gis lam rgyud lngar lus yongs su rdzogs par ston nus so //
translated: With a single thought, he can manifest his body in the five destinies of the five paths.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di'i byin gyi rlabs kyis mthu thob pa'i phyir sngon ma thob pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di'i byin gyi rlabs kyis mthu thob pa'i phyir sngon ma thob pa thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he has attained the power of the transformative blessing of this Great Nirvana Sutra, and so it is called the attainment of what was not previously attained.

original: yang ji ltar na sngon ma thob pa da thob pa zhe na; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na sngon ma thob pa da thob pa zhe na; 'di lta ste /
translated: Again, how is it that what was not previously attained is now attained?

original: lus kyi dbang po thob pa dang / sems kyi dbang po thob pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po thob pa dang / sems kyi dbang po thob pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of the faculty of body and the attainment of the faculty of mind.

original: de'ang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'ang gang zhe na /
translated: What is this?

original: bus pa ma rabs thams cad ni lus dang sems kyi dbang ma thob pas ched 'ga' @50a *//🔽ni lus kyi phyi bzhin sems 'brang /
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs thams cad ni lus dang sems kyi dbang ma thob pas ched 'ga' @50a *// ni lus kyi phyi bzhin sems 'brang /
translated: All childish ordinary beings have not attained the faculties of body and mind. Sometimes🔽the mind follows the body,

original: ched 'ga' ni sems kyi phyi bzhin du lus 'brang ngo //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni sems kyi phyi bzhin du lus 'brang ngo //
translated: and sometimes the body follows the mind.

original: de la ji ltar na lus kyi phyi bzhin sems 'brang ba zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na lus kyi phyi bzhin sems 'brang ba zhe na /
translated: How is it that the mind follows the body?

original: dper na / chang gis myos pa dag lus kyi nang na chang yod pas /
analyzed: dper na / chang gis myos pa dag lus kyi nang na chang yod pas /
translated: For example, those who are drunk on alcohol have alcohol in their bodies,🔽and

original: de'i tshe lus 'gul na sems kyang rjes su 'gul lo //
analyzed: de'i tshe lus 'gul na sems kyang rjes su 'gul lo //
translated: When the body moves, the mind also moves.

original: gzhan yang lus ngan na sems kyang ngal bar gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang lus ngan na sems kyang ngal bar gyur te /
translated: Moreover, when the body is tired, the mind also becomes tired.

original: de ni lus kyi phyi bzhin sems 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi phyi bzhin sems 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the mind following after the body.

original: gzhan yang bus pa lus chung ba ni sems kyang chung ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang bus pa lus chung ba ni sems kyang chung ngo //
translated: Moreover, the mind of a child is small because the body is small.

original: mi chen po ni lus che bas sems kyang de bzhin du che'o //
analyzed: mi chen po ni lus che bas sems kyang de bzhin du che'o //
translated: The mind of an adult is large because the body is large.

original: gzhan yang la la zhig lus rtsub pas na sems la rtag tu snum pa dang / 'jam pa dang / mnyen par 'dod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang la la zhig lus rtsub pas na sems la rtag tu snum pa dang / 'jam pa dang / mnyen par 'dod de /
translated: Moreover, if someone has a rough body, the mind always desires smoothness, softness, and suppleness.

original: de ni lus kyi phyi bzhin sems 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi phyi bzhin sems 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the mind following after the body.

original: de la ji ltar na sems kyi phyi bzhin lus 'brang ba zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na sems kyi phyi bzhin lus 'brang ba zhe na /
translated: “What is the body following after the mind?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: song ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus byed pa ste /
analyzed: song ba dang / 'ong ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus byed pa ste /
translated: going, coming, sitting, lying down, giving, morality, patience, and diligence.

original: gang mya ngan che ba ni nga rod kyang ngan no //
analyzed: gang mya ngan che ba ni nga rod kyang ngan no //
translated: If someone is very sad, the body also becomes sad.

original: dga' ba ni lus tsho zhing mdangs dkar ro //
analyzed: dga' ba ni lus tsho zhing mdangs dkar ro //
translated: Joy is the body being full and radiant.

original: gang 'jigs pa ni lus 'dar ro //
analyzed: gang 'jigs pa ni lus 'dar ro //
translated: Fear is the body trembling.

original: rtse gcig tu chos nyan pa ni lus rab tu dga'o //
analyzed: rtse gcig tu chos nyan pa ni lus rab tu dga'o //
translated: Listening to the Dharma one-pointedly is the body being very happy.

original: cho de rdung zhing ngu ba ni mchi ma dang snabs zag ste /
analyzed: cho de rdung zhing ngu ba ni mchi ma dang snabs zag ste /
translated: Crying and wailing is tears and snot flowing.

original: de ni sems kyi phyi bzhin lus 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sems kyi phyi bzhin lus 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the body following after the mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is not like that.

original: lus dang sems gnyis ka'i @50b dbang thob pas sngon ma thob pa da thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems gnyis ka'i @50b dbang thob pas sngon ma thob pa da thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he has attained mastery over both body and mind, it is said that he has attained what was not attained before.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lus kyi dbang po rdul phra rab lta bur ston te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lus kyi dbang po rdul phra rab lta bur ston te /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva displays the body sense faculty like a subtle particle.

original: rdul tsam gyi lus des sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang+g'a'i klung bye ma tshad med pa mtha' yas pa snyed kun tu thogs pa med par 'gro'ang sems rtag tu 'dug ste /
analyzed: rdul tsam gyi lus des sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang+g'a'i klung bye ma tshad med pa mtha' yas pa snyed kun tu thogs pa med par 'gro'ang sems rtag tu 'dug ste /
translated: With that particle-like body, he goes unimpeded throughout buddha realms as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, beyond measure and limit, yet the mind always remains

original: sngon gyi gnas nas mi g-yo'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas nas mi g-yo'o //
translated: and does not move from its previous state.

original: de ni lus kyi phyi bzhin sems mi 'brang ba dang / sngon ma phyin par phyin pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi phyi bzhin sems mi 'brang ba dang / sngon ma phyin par phyin pa zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called “the mind not following after the body” and “going where one has not gone before.”

original: yang ji ltar na sngon ma phyin par phyin pa zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar na sngon ma phyin par phyin pa zhe na /
translated: How is it “going where one has not gone before?”

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad ni phyin par mi nus te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad ni phyin par mi nus te /
translated: All śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are unable to go there.

original: byang chub sems dpas phyin pas de'i phyir sngon ma phyin par da phyin par zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas phyin pas de'i phyir sngon ma phyin par da phyin par zhes bya'o //
translated: Because bodhisattvas go there, it is called “going where one has not gone before.”

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad ni rdzu 'phrul yod mod kyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad ni rdzu 'phrul yod mod kyi /
translated: All śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do indeed have magical powers.

original: lus rdul phra rab lta bur sprul te /
analyzed: lus rdul phra rab lta bur sprul te /
translated: They can emanate their bodies in the form of subtle atoms.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma tshad med pa snyed kun tu 'gro mi nus so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang+g'a'i klung gi bye ma tshad med pa snyed kun tu 'gro mi nus so //
translated: But they are unable to go everywhere in the buddha-fields, which are as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni lus 'gul ba'i tshe sems kyang rjes su 'gul lo //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni lus 'gul ba'i tshe sems kyang rjes su 'gul lo //
translated: When śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas move their bodies, their minds follow.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Bodhisattvas are not like this.

original: sems mi 'gul mod kyi /
analyzed: sems mi 'gul mod kyi /
translated: Even though their minds do not move,

original: lus ma phyin pa'i gnas med de /
analyzed: lus ma phyin pa'i gnas med de /
translated: there is no place that their bodies do not reach.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' lus kyi rjes su sems mi 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' lus kyi rjes su sems mi 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s mind not following the body.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Moreover, son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpas lus 'di stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang 'dra bar sprul te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas lus 'di stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang 'dra bar sprul te /
translated: the bodhisattva emanates this body to be like the world systems of the trichiliocosm.

original: lus chen po des rdul phra rab gcig gi @51a *//
analyzed: lus chen po des rdul phra rab gcig gi @51a *//
translated: With that great body, he enters into a single atom,

original: nang du zhugs kyang sems de'i tshe de ltar chung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nang du zhugs kyang sems de'i tshe de ltar chung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but at that time, the mind does not become so small.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni lus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tsam du sprul nus kyang lus chen po nges rdul phra rab kyi nang du 'jug mi nus te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni lus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tsam du sprul nus kyang lus chen po nges rdul phra rab kyi nang du 'jug mi nus te /
translated: The śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are able to emanate a body the size of the world systems of the trichiliocosm, but they are unable to make that great body enter into a single atom.

original: dngos po de lta bu dag kyang byed mi nus na sems mi g-yo bar bya ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: dngos po de lta bu dag kyang byed mi nus na sems mi g-yo bar bya ba lta ci smos te /
translated: If they are unable to perform such feats, what need is there to speak of the mind remaining unmoved?

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' lus kyi rjes su sems mi 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' lus kyi rjes su sems mi 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s mind not following the body.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Moreover, son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sgra dbyangs gcig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad kyi rna lam du thos par gyur kyang 'di snyam du nga'i sgra 'dis 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu sems can rnams sngon🔽ma thos pa thos par bya'o snyam mi sems so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sgra dbyangs gcig gis stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can thams cad kyi rna lam du thos par gyur kyang 'di snyam du nga'i sgra 'dis 'jig rten gyi khams kun tu sems can rnams sngon ma thos pa thos par bya'o snyam mi sems so //
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva, with a single sound, causes all beings in the trichiliocosm to hear it in their ears, but he does not think like this: “By my sound, let all worlds hear what they have not heard before.”

original: byang chub sems dpas thog ma nas kyang bdag gis sems can rnams la sngon ma thos pa thos par bya'o zhes ma smras so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas thog ma nas kyang bdag gis sems can rnams la sngon ma thos pa thos par bya'o zhes ma smras so //
translated: The bodhisattva has never said to beings, “Let me make you hear what you have not heard before.”

original: byang chub sems dpas gal ta bdag gis chos bshad pa'i rkyen gyis sems can rnams la ma thos pa thos par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gal ta bdag gis chos bshad pa'i rkyen gyis sems can rnams la ma thos pa thos par bya'o //
translated: If the bodhisattva were to say, “By the condition of my teaching the Dharma, let beings hear what they have not heard before,”

original: zhes smra na de nam yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes smra na de nam yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mi 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: know that he will never attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can gyis mi thos pa las bdag gis bshad do zhes smra ba'i sems de ni @51b 'khor ba'i sems te /
analyzed: sems can gyis mi thos pa las bdag gis bshad do zhes smra ba'i sems de ni @51b 'khor ba'i sems te /
translated: The mind that says, “I will explain the Dharma so that sentient beings can hear it,” is a mind of cyclic existence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ni sems de yongs su zad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ni sems de yongs su zad do //
translated: Bodhisattvas have completely eliminated such a mind.

original: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang sems lhan cig mi 'grogs so //
analyzed: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lus dang sems lhan cig mi 'grogs so //
translated: For this reason, noble sir, the body and mind of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva do not go around together.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble sir,

original: bus pa ma rabs thams cad ni lus dang sems lhan cig 'grogs so //
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs thams cad ni lus dang sems lhan cig 'grogs so //
translated: all childish ordinary beings go around with their body and mind together.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But not so for bodhisattvas.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir lus chung ngur ston mod kyi sems mi chung ngo //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir lus chung ngur ston mod kyi sems mi chung ngo //
translated: For the sake of sentient beings, they may manifest a small body, but their mind is not small.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems kyi rang bzhin ni rtag tu rgya che ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems kyi rang bzhin ni rtag tu rgya che ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the nature of the minds of bodhisattvas is always vast.

original: lus chen po ston kyang sems ni che bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus chen po ston kyang sems ni che bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if they manifest a large body, their mind does not become large.

original: ji ltar lus chen po zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lus chen po zhe na /
translated: And what is a large body?

original: lus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: lus stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The body is like the great trichiliocosm.

original: ji ltar sems chung ngu zhe na; byis pa chung ngu'i spyad pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sems chung ngu zhe na; byis pa chung ngu'i spyad pa spyod pa'o //
translated: How is the mind small? It is like the practice of a small child.

original: don de lta bas na lus kyi rjes su sems mi 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: don de lta bas na lus kyi rjes su sems mi 'brang ba'o //
translated: For this reason, the mind does not follow the body.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bskal pa khrag khrig tshad med pa'i bar du chang spangs te ma 'thungs kyang sems 'gul lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos bskal pa khrag khrig tshad med pa'i bar du chang spangs te ma 'thungs kyang sems 'gul lo //
translated: Even though bodhisattva-mahāsattvas give up alcohol and do not drink for countless millions of eons, their minds are moved.

original: sems la sdug bsngal dang / yid slong ba med kyang lus la mchi ma 'dzag go //
analyzed: sems la sdug bsngal dang / yid slong ba med kyang lus la mchi ma 'dzag go //
translated: Even though their minds have no suffering or agitation, tears flow from their bodies.

original: yang dag par 'jigs pa med kyang lus rab tu 'dar ro //
analyzed: yang dag par 'jigs pa med kyang lus rab tu 'dar ro //
translated: Even though they are truly fearless, their bodies tremble.

original: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni lus dang sems kyi dbang thob pas lhan cig mi 'grogs par rig par bya'o //🔽byang chub sems @52a *//
analyzed: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni lus dang sems kyi dbang thob pas lhan cig mi 'grogs par rig par bya'o // byang chub sems @52a *//
translated: For this reason, bodhisattvas attain mastery over body and mind and are not bound together.

original: dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lus gcig bstan pa las sems can rnams kyis so so nas tha dad par mthong ngo //
analyzed: dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lus gcig bstan pa las sems can rnams kyis so so nas tha dad par mthong ngo //
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, from displaying a single body, sentient beings each see it differently.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of a good family!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde la nan tan byas pas sngon ma thos pa thos par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde la nan tan byas pas sngon ma thos pa thos par 'gyur ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is it that the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra hears that he has not heard before?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems chen pos sngar sgra'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems chen pos sngar sgra'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva previously engaged in the characteristics of sound, namely:

original: bal glang gi sgra dang / rta'i sgra dang / shing rta'i sgra dang / mi'i sgra dang / dung gi sgra dang / rnga'i sgra dang / mchu sbrang gi sgra dang / gling bu la sogs pa'i sgra dang / glu'i sgra dang / du ba'i sgra ste /
analyzed: bal glang gi sgra dang / rta'i sgra dang / shing rta'i sgra dang / mi'i sgra dang / dung gi sgra dang / rnga'i sgra dang / mchu sbrang gi sgra dang / gling bu la sogs pa'i sgra dang / glu'i sgra dang / du ba'i sgra ste /
translated: the sound of elephants, the sound of horses, the sound of chariots, the sound of men, the sound of conches, the sound of drums, the sound of reed pipes, the sound of flutes, and so on, the sound of singing, and the sound of smoke.

original: de dag yongs su sgom mo //
analyzed: de dag yongs su sgom mo //
translated: He thoroughly cultivates those.

original: goms par bsgoms pa'i phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa snyed kyi sems can dmyal ba'i sgra kun thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: goms par bsgoms pa'i phyir stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa snyed kyi sems can dmyal ba'i sgra kun thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of cultivating familiarity, he hears all the sounds of the hells of sentient beings in the immeasurable world systems of the trichiliocosm.

original: yang nas yang du bsgoms pas rna ba'i dbang po tha dad pa thob ste /
analyzed: yang nas yang du bsgoms pas rna ba'i dbang po tha dad pa thob ste /
translated: By cultivating this again and again, one obtains a different auditory sense faculty.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrul gyi rna ba dang tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi 'phrul gyi rna ba dang tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is different from the supernormal hearing of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: theg pa gnyis pas yongs su dag pa'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa thob pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i chen po bzhi dam pa la brten na /
analyzed: theg pa gnyis pas yongs su dag pa'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pa thob pa ni bsam gtan dang po'i chen po bzhi dam pa la brten na /
translated: The attainment of the superknowledge of the purified ear faculty by the two vehicles, when based on the excellent fourth concentration of the first concentration,

original: bsam gtan dang po 'ba' zhig thos te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po 'ba' zhig thos te /
translated: only hears the first concentration.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bsam gtan bzhi ba'i bar du'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa nas bsam gtan bzhi ba'i bar du'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true from the second concentration up to the fourth concentration.

original: @52b dus gcig tu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sgra ci yod pa thams cad cig car thos kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma tshad med mtha' yas pa snyed kyi sgra thos par mu nus so //
analyzed: @52b dus gcig tu stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sgra ci yod pa thams cad cig car thos kyang 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma tshad med mtha' yas pa snyed kyi sgra thos par mu nus so //
translated: Even though one hears all the sounds that exist in the great trichiliocosm simultaneously, one is able to hear the sounds of limitless world systems equal to the sands of the Ganges river.

original: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas thos pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rna ba'i dbang po dang tha dad do //
analyzed: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas thos pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi rna ba'i dbang po dang tha dad do //
translated: For this reason, the bodhisattvas’ hearing is different from the ear faculty of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ltar tha dad pas sngon ma thos pa thos par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar tha dad pas sngon ma thos pa thos par 'gyur te /
translated: Because it is different, they hear what they have not heard before.

original: sgra thos kyang sems la thog ma nas sgra thos pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: sgra thos kyang sems la thog ma nas sgra thos pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: Although they hear sounds, from the beginning there is no characteristic of hearing sounds in the mind.

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bde ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag po'i mtshan nyid dang / rten pa'i mtshan nyid dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rtag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bde ba'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag gi mtshan nyid dang / yongs su dag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bdag po'i mtshan nyid dang / rten pa'i mtshan nyid dang / byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: There is no characteristic of existence, no characteristic of permanence, no characteristic of happiness, no characteristic of self, no characteristic of purity, no characteristic of mastery, no characteristic of support, no characteristic of action,

original: rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / nges pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: no characteristic of cause, no characteristic of determination, and no characteristic of result.

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' dag gis sngon ma thos pa da thos par gyur to //
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' dag gis sngon ma thos pa da thos par gyur to //
translated: For this reason, the bodhisattvas hear what they have not heard before.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu snang ba mtho btsun dpal gyi rgyal pos gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu snang ba mtho btsun dpal gyi rgyal pos gsol pa /
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Samantaprabhāsa-udgata-bhadra-śrī-rāja said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa las nges pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid mi mdzad do zhes gsungs pa'i don de lta ma lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa las nges pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid mi mdzad do zhes gsungs pa'i don de lta ma lags so //
translated: “Bhagavān, it is not as the Bhagavān has said, that the defining characteristics of certainty and the defining characteristics of the result are not taught.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar gsungs pa las gang la la zhig @53a *//🔽gis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di tshigs su bcad pa gcig gam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngar gsungs pa las gang la la zhig @53a *// gis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di tshigs su bcad pa gcig gam /
translated: Bhagavān, it is as the Bhagavān has previously taught, that whoever

original: yi ge 'bru gcig tsam thos na /
analyzed: yi ge 'bru gcig tsam thos na /
translated: hears even a single verse or a single syllable of this Great Parinirvāṇa Sūtra,🔽without doubt

original: gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //🔽zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ro // zhes gsungs la /
translated: will attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas ci'i slad du nges pa dang / 'bras bu ma mchis so //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pas ci'i slad du nges pa dang / 'bras bu ma mchis so //
translated: The Tathāgata has said that this is without certainty and without result.

original: zhes gsungs / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa de nyid nges pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid lags na /
analyzed: zhes gsungs / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob pa de nyid nges pa'i mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid lags na /
translated: If the attainment of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is the characteristic of certainty and the characteristic of the result,

original: ci'i slad du nges pa dang 'bras bu ma mchis zhes gsungs /
analyzed: ci'i slad du nges pa dang 'bras bu ma mchis zhes gsungs /
translated: why is it said that certainty and the result do not exist?

original: sgra mi snyan pa thos na ngan sems skyes te /
analyzed: sgra mi snyan pa thos na ngan sems skyes te /
translated: If one hears about Uttarakuru, evil thoughts arise.

original: ngan sems skyes pas ngan song gsum du ltung ngo //
analyzed: ngan sems skyes pas ngan song gsum du ltung ngo //
translated: Because evil thoughts arise, one falls into the three lower realms.

original: gang ngan song gsum du ltung ba de nyid nges pa'i 'bras bu lags na /
analyzed: gang ngan song gsum du ltung ba de nyid nges pa'i 'bras bu lags na /
translated: If falling into the three lower realms is itself the result of certainty,

original: ci'i slad du nges pa dang / 'bras bu ma mchis zhes gsungs /
analyzed: ci'i slad du nges pa dang / 'bras bu ma mchis zhes gsungs /
translated: why is it said that certainty and the result do not exist?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: legs so / legs so //
analyzed: legs so / legs so //
translated: Excellent, excellent!

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar dri bar spobs pa legs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar dri bar spobs pa legs so //
translated: Son of noble family, it is excellent that you have the eloquence to ask that.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis sgra rnams la nges pa dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid yod par gsungs na /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis sgra rnams la nges pa dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid yod par gsungs na /
translated: If the Blessed One said that sounds have the characteristic of certainty and the characteristic of the result,

original: de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: that is not the characteristic of the Blessed Buddha.

original: bdud kyi rgyal po'i mtshan nyid yin /🔽'khor ba'i mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: bdud kyi rgyal po'i mtshan nyid yin / 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid yin /
translated: It is the characteristic of the king of māras.🔽It is the characteristic of saṃsāra.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang thag ring ba'i mtshan @53b nyid yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang thag ring ba'i mtshan @53b nyid yin no //
translated: It is the characteristic of being far from nirvāṇa.

original: de ci'i phyir zha na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zha na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so cog ni nges pa dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so cog ni nges pa dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: All that the Buddha, the Blessed One, has taught is without a definitive characteristic or the characteristic of a result.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dper na / ral gri'i nang na mi'i ngo snang ba bsgreng na ni chu ring por mthong /
analyzed: dper na / ral gri'i nang na mi'i ngo snang ba bsgreng na ni chu ring por mthong /
translated: it is like this: When a sword is held upright, a human face appears long;

original: 'phred du bltas na zheng che bar mthong ste /
analyzed: 'phred du bltas na zheng che bar mthong ste /
translated: when it is held horizontally, it appears wide.

original: de gal te nges pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ci'i phyir bsgreng na ni chu ring por mthong la /
analyzed: de gal te nges pa'i mtshan nyid yin na ci'i phyir bsgreng na ni chu ring por mthong la /
translated: If that were a definitive characteristic, why would the face appear long when held upright

original: 'phred du ni zheng che bar mthong /
analyzed: 'phred du ni zheng che bar mthong /
translated: and wide when held horizontally?

original: don de lta bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni nges pa dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: don de lta bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ni nges pa dang / 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: For that reason, all that the Buddha, the Blessed One, has taught is without a definitive characteristic or the characteristic of a result.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni sgra'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni sgra'i 'bras bu ma yin no //
translated: nirvāṇa is not the result of a sound.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa sgra'i 'bras bu yin na mya ngan las 'das pa de rtag pa'i chos ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa sgra'i 'bras bu yin na mya ngan las 'das pa de rtag pa'i chos ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If nirvana were the result of sound, then nirvana would not be a permanent dharma.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: dper na / 'jig rten na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i chos ni rgyu yod pas 'bras bu yang yod do //
analyzed: dper na / 'jig rten na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i chos ni rgyu yod pas 'bras bu yang yod do //
translated: For example, in the world, dharmas that arise in dependence exist because the cause exists, and the result also exists.

original: rgyu med na 'bras bu'ang med de /
analyzed: rgyu med na 'bras bu'ang med de /
translated: If there is no cause, there is also no result.

original: rgyu mi rtag na 'bras bu'ang mi rtag go //
analyzed: rgyu mi rtag na 'bras bu'ang mi rtag go //
translated: If the cause is impermanent, the result is also impermanent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rgyu las kyang 'bras bur 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rgyu las kyang 'bras bur 'gyur la /
translated: Why is this?🔽From the cause, the result arises,

original: 'bras bu las kyang rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu las kyang rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: and from the result, the cause arises.

original: don de lta bas na chos thams cad ni nges pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: don de lta bas na chos thams cad ni nges pa'i mtshan nyid med do //
translated: For this reason, all dharmas have no definite characteristics.

original: ji ste mya ngan las 'da' ba rgyu las skyes na rgyu nyid mi rtag pas 'bras bu'ang mi rtag ste /
analyzed: ji ste mya ngan las 'da' ba rgyu las skyes na rgyu nyid mi rtag pas 'bras bu'ang mi rtag ste /
translated: If nirvana were born from a cause, because the cause itself is impermanent, the result would also be impermanent.

original: de bas na mya ngan las 'da' ba ni rgyu las ma skyes la ngo bo nyid 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na mya ngan las 'da' ba ni rgyu las ma skyes la ngo bo nyid 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, nirvana is not born from a cause, and the essence is not the result.

original: de bas na rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rtag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is permanent.

original: rigs @54a *// kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs @54a *// kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: don de lta bas na mya ngan las 'da' ba'i ngo bo nyid ni nges pa med //
analyzed: don de lta bas na mya ngan las 'da' ba'i ngo bo nyid ni nges pa med //
translated: For this reason, the essence of nirvana is indeterminate.

original: 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: 'bras bu med do //
translated: It is not a result.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni nges pa zhes bya bar yang rung la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / mya ngan las 'da' ba zhes bya ba ni nges pa zhes bya bar yang rung la /
translated: Son of good family!

original: 'bras bu zhes bya bar yang rung ngo //🔽ji ltar nges pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya bar yang rung ngo // ji ltar nges pa'o //
translated: Nirvana is called “determinate” and it is also called “result.”

original: zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is it determinate?

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mya ngan las 'da' ba ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang; bdag dang / yongs su dag pa'i phyir nges pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mya ngan las 'da' ba ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang; bdag dang / yongs su dag pa'i phyir nges pa'o //
translated: All buddhas’ nirvana is determinate because it is permanent, blissful, self, and pure.

original: skye ba dang rga ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir nges pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir nges pa'o //
translated: It is determinate because it is free from birth, aging, and destruction.

original: log sred can dang / phas pham pa bzhi nyams pa dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde la skur pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba byas pa dag sngon gyi sems spangs na gdon mi za bar thob pa'i phyir de bas na nges pa'o //
analyzed: log sred can dang / phas pham pa bzhi nyams pa dang / shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde la skur pa dang / mtshams med pa lnga'i kha na ma tho ba byas pa dag sngon gyi sems spangs na gdon mi za bar thob pa'i phyir de bas na nges pa'o //
translated: It is determinate because those who have abandoned the mind of wrong views, the four defeats, the slander of the extensive sutras, and the five heinous sins, will without doubt attain it.

original: rigs kyi bu; ji ltar khyod kyis 'di skad du gal te la la zhig ngas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde tshigs su bcad pa gcig gam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; ji ltar khyod kyis 'di skad du gal te la la zhig ngas mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde tshigs su bcad pa gcig gam /
translated: “Son of noble family, just as you have said, if someone were to request a single verse from the Great Parinirvāṇa Sūtra,🔽

original: yi ge gcig tsam bshad pa thos na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob bo zhes bya ba'i don de da dung khyod kyis gsal bar ma rig gi /🔽shin tu brtags par nyon cig /
analyzed: yi ge gcig tsam bshad pa thos na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob bo zhes bya ba'i don de da dung khyod kyis gsal bar ma rig gi / shin tu brtags par nyon cig /
translated: “Son of a good family, since you have said, ‘If someone hears me explain even one verse or one syllable from the Great Parinirvāṇa Sūtra, they will attain unsurpassed perfect complete awakening,’ you have not yet understood the meaning of that.

original: ngas rab tu phye ste bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: ngas rab tu phye ste bstan par bya'o //
translated: Listen as I examine it and explain it to you.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽gal te rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po las yi ge 'bru gcig gam /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / gal te rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po las yi ge 'bru gcig gam /
translated: Son of a good family,

original: tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam @54b yang rung ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gcig tsam @54b yang rung ste /
translated: if a son of a good family or daughter of a good family hears even one syllable or one verse from the Great Parinirvāṇa,

original: thos nas yi ge'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
analyzed: thos nas yi ge'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
translated: having heard it, they do not grasp it as a characteristic of a syllable,

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
translated: they do not grasp it as a characteristic of a verse,

original: thos pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
analyzed: thos pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
translated: they do not grasp it as a characteristic of what they have heard,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin bshad pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin na de ni mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin bshad pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin na de ni mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya'o //
translated: If one does not grasp at the characteristics of the Buddha, and does not grasp at the characteristics of the explanation, that is called the characteristic of the absence of characteristics.

original: mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid pas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob bo //
analyzed: mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid pas na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob bo //
translated: Because of the characteristic of the absence of characteristics, one attains unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis ji skad du sgra yid du mi 'ong ba thos pa'i phyir ngan song gsum du 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don de'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu khyod kyis ji skad du sgra yid du mi 'ong ba thos pa'i phyir ngan song gsum du 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i don de'ang ma yin no //
translated: Son of noble family, the meaning of what you said, that one goes to the three lower realms because of hearing unpleasant sounds, is not so.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgra yid du mi 'ong bas ngan song gsum du 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra yid du mi 'ong bas ngan song gsum du 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not because of unpleasant sounds that one goes to the three lower realms.

original: de'i 'bras bu ni ngan sems yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni ngan sems yin no //
translated: The result of that is evil thoughts.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang sgra yid du mi 'ong ba thos kyang ngan sems ma bskyed na sgra yid du mi 'ong ba'i rkyen gyis ngan song gsum du 'gro ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo gang sgra yid du mi 'ong ba thos kyang ngan sems ma bskyed na sgra yid du mi 'ong ba'i rkyen gyis ngan song gsum du 'gro ba ma yin te /
translated: Son of noble family, if a son or daughter of noble family hears unpleasant sounds but does not give rise to evil thoughts, then because of the condition of unpleasant sounds, they do not go to the three lower realms.

original: sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngan sems mched cing mang du gyur pas ngan song gsum du skyes kyi /
analyzed: sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa'i ngan sems mched cing mang du gyur pas ngan song gsum du skyes kyi /
translated: Sentient beings are born in the three lower realms because of the proliferation of their many evil thoughts of defilement.

original: sgra yid du mi 'ong ba'i rkyen gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra yid du mi 'ong ba'i rkyen gyis ma yin no //
translated: It is not because of the condition of unpleasant sounds.

original: gal te sgra la nges pa'i mtshan nyid yod na /
analyzed: gal te sgra la nges pa'i mtshan nyid yod na /
translated: If there were a definitive characteristic in sound,

original: thos pa kun gyis ngan sems skye ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: thos pa kun gyis ngan sems skye ba'i rigs so //
translated: then everyone who heard it would give rise to evil thoughts.

original: de la la la ni skye /
analyzed: de la la la ni skye /
translated: But some people give rise to evil thoughts,

original: la la la ni mi skye ste; de bas na sgra la ni nges pa'i mtshan nyid med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: la la la ni mi skye ste; de bas na sgra la ni nges pa'i mtshan nyid med par rig par bya'o //
translated: while others do not. Therefore, you should know that sound has no definitive characteristic.

original: nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pas na /
analyzed: nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pas na /
translated: Because it has no definitive characteristic,

original: des rkyen byas kyang ngan sems mi skye'o //🔽gsol pa / bcom ldan @55a *//
analyzed: des rkyen byas kyang ngan sems mi skye'o // gsol pa / bcom ldan @55a *//
translated: even if it acts as a condition, evil thoughts will not arise.

original: 'das; gal te sgra ma nges na /
analyzed: 'das; gal te sgra ma nges na /
translated: ” The Buddha said, “Good son, if sound has no definitive characteristic,

original: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sngon ma thos pa thos par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' sngon ma thos pa thos par 'gyur /
translated: why is it that bodhisattvas hear what they have not heard before?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: sgra la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pas sngon ma thos pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis da thos par gyur to /
analyzed: sgra la nges pa'i mtshan nyid med pas sngon ma thos pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis da thos par gyur to /
translated: because sound has no definitive characteristic, bodhisattvas hear what they have not heard before.

original: de bas na ngas sngon ma thos pa da thos pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de bas na ngas sngon ma thos pa da thos pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, I say that I have heard what I have never heard before.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de la ji ltar na sngon ma mthong ba da mthong ba zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na sngon ma mthong ba da mthong ba zhe na /
translated: How is it that I have seen what I have never seen before?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde la nan tan byed pa sngar snang ba'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde la nan tan byed pa sngar snang ba'i mtshan nyid la 'jug pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra enters the characteristics of what appears before, as follows:

original: nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / skar ma dang / me'i phung po dang / sgron ma dang / nor bu dang / me'i snang ba dang / sman la sogs pa'i 'od goms par bsgoms pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po tha dad pa thob ste /
analyzed: nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / skar ma dang / me'i phung po dang / sgron ma dang / nor bu dang / me'i snang ba dang / sman la sogs pa'i 'od goms par bsgoms pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po tha dad pa thob ste /
translated: Because of cultivating the light of the sun, moon, stars, masses of fire, lamps, jewels, the light of fire, medicine, and so forth, one attains a different eye faculty.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thob pa dang tha dad do //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thob pa dang tha dad do //
translated: It is different from attaining the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha.

original: ji ltar tha dad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad ce na /
translated: How is it different?

original: theg pa gnyis pas 'phrul gyi mig rnam par dag pa thob pa /
analyzed: theg pa gnyis pas 'phrul gyi mig rnam par dag pa thob pa /
translated: The two vehicles attain the pure divine eye.

original: gal te 'dod pa'i khams kyi chen po bzhi'i mig gi dbang po la brten na bsam gtan dang po mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa'i khams kyi chen po bzhi'i mig gi dbang po la brten na bsam gtan dang po mi mthong ngo //
translated: If the eye faculty of the four great elements of the desire realm is used, one cannot see the first concentration.

original: gal te bsam gtan dang po la brten na gong ma mi mthong ba nas bdag gi mig gi bar du'ang mthong bar mi nus so //
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan dang po la brten na gong ma mi mthong ba nas bdag gi mig gi bar du'ang mthong bar mi nus so //
translated: If the first concentration is used, one cannot see the higher realms, up to one’s own eyes.

original: gal te mang du mthong na'ang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams las @55b mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gal te mang du mthong na'ang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams las @55b mi mthong ngo //
translated: If one sees a lot, one sees the world systems of a billion-world universe, but not more than that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'phrul gyi mig ma bsgoms kyang gzugs dam pa'i lus thams cad keng rus kyi mtshan nyid du mthong ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'phrul gyi mig ma bsgoms kyang gzugs dam pa'i lus thams cad keng rus kyi mtshan nyid du mthong ngo //
translated: Even though bodhisattva mahāsattvas do not cultivate the divine eye, they see all the excellent forms of the body as the characteristics of skeletons.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi gzugs kyi mtshan nyid mthong yang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed kyi gzugs kyi mtshan nyid mthong yang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
translated: They see the characteristics of forms in other world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, but do not apprehend them as the characteristics of forms.

original: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
analyzed: rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
translated: They do not apprehend them as the characteristics of permanence.

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang / ming dang / yi ge dang / rgyu rkyen dang / mthong ba'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rdzas kyi mtshan nyid dang / ming dang / yi ge dang / rgyu rkyen dang / mthong ba'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
translated: He does not grasp the characteristics of existence, the characteristics of substance, names, letters, causes, conditions, or the characteristics of seeing.

original: mig la dam pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mig la dam pa rnam par dag pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: He does not say, ‘The eye has the characteristic of the pure and sublime.’

original: zhes kyang mi zer te /
analyzed: zhes kyang mi zer te /
translated: He does not say, ‘It is not so.’

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du mthong ngo //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid du mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the characteristics of dependent origination and non-dependent origination.

original: ji ltar na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba zhe na /
translated: What is dependent origination?

original: gzugs ni mig gi rkyen yin no //
analyzed: gzugs ni mig gi rkyen yin no //
translated: Form is a condition of the eye.

original: gal te gzugs rten cing 'brel pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs rten cing 'brel pa ma yin na /
translated: If form were not dependent origination,

original: bus pa ma rabs thams cad kyis gzugs su mthong ba'i 'du shes mi skye ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: bus pa ma rabs thams cad kyis gzugs su mthong ba'i 'du shes mi skye ba'i rigs so //
translated: it would be unreasonable for the perception of form to arise in all childish ordinary beings.

original: de bas na gzugs ni rten cing 'brel pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs ni rten cing 'brel pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, form is called dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mthong du zin kyang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid mi skyed de /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mthong du zin kyang gzugs kyi mtshan nyid mi skyed de /
translated: Not arising from causes and conditions means that even though the bodhisattva-mahāsattva sees, he does not generate the characteristics of form.

original: de bas na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not arising from causes and conditions.

original: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas 'phrul gyi mig rnam par dag pa thob pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis thob pa dang tha dad do //
analyzed: don de lta bas na byang chub sems dpas 'phrul gyi mig rnam par dag pa thob pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis thob pa dang tha dad do //
translated: For this reason, the bodhisattva's attainment of the pure divine eye is different from that attained by the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ltar tha dad pa'i phyir dus gcig tu @56a *//
analyzed: de ltar tha dad pa'i phyir dus gcig tu @56a *//
translated: Because it is different in this way,

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na /
translated: in the worlds of the ten directions,

original: da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kun mthong ste /
analyzed: da ltar bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kun mthong ste /
translated: he simultaneously sees all the buddhas who are present.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpas sngon ma mthong ba mthong ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpas sngon ma mthong ba mthong ba zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva's seeing what was not seen before.

original: de ltar tha dad pa'i phyir rdul phra rab snyed mthong gi /
analyzed: de ltar tha dad pa'i phyir rdul phra rab snyed mthong gi /
translated: Because it is different in this way, he sees as many [buddhas] as there are atoms,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas ni mi mthong ngo //
translated: but the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas do not see them.

original: de ltar tha dad pa'i phyir bdag gi mig mthong mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar tha dad pa'i phyir bdag gi mig mthong mod kyi /
translated: Thus, because they are different, the self’s eye does indeed see.

original: thog ma nas mthong ba'i mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: thog ma nas mthong ba'i mtshan nyid med de /
translated: But it is not the case that it has the characteristic of seeing from the beginning.

original: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du mthong zhing /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid du mthong zhing /
translated: It is seen to have the characteristic of impermanence.

original: gang zag pa'i lus la rdzas sum cu rtsa drug gi mi gtsang bas yongs su gang ba lag mthil du skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu bzhag pa bzhin du mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang zag pa'i lus la rdzas sum cu rtsa drug gi mi gtsang bas yongs su gang ba lag mthil du skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu bzhag pa bzhin du mthong ngo //
translated: The body of the person is seen to be completely filled with the impurities of the thirty-six substances, like a myrobalan fruit placed in the palm of the hand.

original: don de lta bas na sngon ma mthong ba de mthong ba zhes bya ste /🔽gal te sems can gyi gzugs dang cha lugs ji snyed pa mthong ma thag tu de nyid theg pa chen po'am /
analyzed: don de lta bas na sngon ma mthong ba de mthong ba zhes bya ste / gal te sems can gyi gzugs dang cha lugs ji snyed pa mthong ma thag tu de nyid theg pa chen po'am /
translated: For this reason, what was not seen before is called “seeing.”

original: theg pa chung ngu'i dbang po gang yin pa rig go /
analyzed: theg pa chung ngu'i dbang po gang yin pa rig go /
translated: If one sees all the forms and attire of sentient beings, one will immediately know whether they are of the Great Vehicle or of the Lesser Vehicle.

original: gos la thang cig reg pa tsam gyis kyang de'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i dbang po'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid shes so //
analyzed: gos la thang cig reg pa tsam gyis kyang de'i dge ba dang mi dge ba'i dbang po'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid shes so //
translated: If one touches their clothes for just a moment, one will know the characteristics of their faculties, whether they are virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: don de lta bas na sngon ma shes pa da shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don de lta bas na sngon ma shes pa da shes par 'gyur te /
translated: For this reason, what was not known before will now be known.

original: thang cig mthong ba tsam gyis sngon ma shes pa dang shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thang cig mthong ba tsam gyis sngon ma shes pa dang shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: In a single instant, one can see what was previously unknown.

original: de ltar shes pa'i phyir sngon ma mthong ba da mthong bar 'gyur to ////
analyzed: de ltar shes pa'i phyir sngon ma mthong ba da mthong bar 'gyur to ////
translated: Because of this knowledge, one can see what was previously unseen.

original: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: 'phags pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: The Noble Great Parinirvāṇa Sūtra🔽Fascicle Thirty-Two

original: bam po sum cu gnyis @56b pa; gzhan yang /
analyzed: bam po sum cu gnyis @56b pa; gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: child of the lineage!

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sngon mi shes pa shes pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sngon mi shes pa shes pa zhe na /
translated: How is it that bodhisattvas know what was previously unknown?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bus pa ma rabs kyi 'dod chags dang; zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi sems shes kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bus pa ma rabs kyi 'dod chags dang; zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi sems shes kyang /
translated: Although bodhisattva-mahāsattvas know the minds of childish ordinary beings' desire, anger, and delusion,

original: thog ma nas sems sam sems las byung ba'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
analyzed: thog ma nas sems sam sems las byung ba'i mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin /
translated: they do not grasp them as the characteristics of mind or mental factors from the beginning.

original: sems can dang rdzas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin to; ;don dam pa mthar stong pa'i mtshan nyid la nan tan byed do //
analyzed: sems can dang rdzas kyi mtshan nyid du mi 'dzin to; ;don dam pa mthar stong pa'i mtshan nyid la nan tan byed do //
translated: They do not grasp them as the characteristics of sentient beings or substances, but rather practice earnestly the characteristics of ultimate emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ni rtag tu stong pa'i mtshan nyid la nan tan byed pa'i phyir ro; ;stong pa nyid la nan tan byed pas sngon mi shes pa da shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ni rtag tu stong pa'i mtshan nyid la nan tan byed pa'i phyir ro; ;stong pa nyid la nan tan byed pas sngon mi shes pa da shes so //
translated: By practicing emptiness, they know what they did not know before.

original: ji ltar shes zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes zhe na /
translated: How do they know?

original: bdag med pa dang / bdag gi ba med pa shes pa dang / sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod par shes te /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang / bdag gi ba med pa shes pa dang / sems can thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod par shes te /
translated: They know that there is no self and no possession of a self, and they know that all sentient beings have the buddha-nature.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa'i phyir log sred can dag sngon gyi sems spangs na thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa'i phyir log sred can dag sngon gyi sems spangs na thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the existence of the buddha-nature, even those with wrong views will all attain supreme awakening if they abandon their previous mind.

original: de dag ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis shes par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis shes par mi nus kyi /
translated: This cannot be known by śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpas shes par nus pas de bas na sngon mi shes pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas shes par nus pas de bas na sngon mi shes pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it can be known by bodhisattvas, it is called knowing what was not known before.

original: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu /
translated: Moreover, son of noble family,

original: ji ltar sngon mi shes pa shes pa zhe na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su mya ngan @57a *//
analyzed: ji ltar sngon mi shes pa shes pa zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yongs su mya ngan @57a *//
translated: How is it that one knows what was previously unknown?

original: las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde dam pa la nan tan byed pa ni sngon 'das pa'i dus kyi sems can thams cad kyi skye ba'i gnas dang / rigs dang / pha ma dang / phu nu dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / gnyen bshes dang /
analyzed: las 'das pa chen po'i mdo sde dam pa la nan tan byed pa ni sngon 'das pa'i dus kyi sems can thams cad kyi skye ba'i gnas dang / rigs dang / pha ma dang / phu nu dang / chung ma dang / bu dang / gnyen bshes dang /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva who practices the excellent sūtra of the Great Parinirvāṇa remembers the abodes, families, parents, siblings, wives, children, relatives,

original: dgra rnams dran pas yud tsam thang cig gis khyad par gyi ye shes thob ste /
analyzed: dgra rnams dran pas yud tsam thang cig gis khyad par gyi ye shes thob ste /
translated: and enemies of all sentient beings in the past. In an instant, he attains the wisdom of distinction.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes las khyad par du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes las khyad par du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is superior to the wisdom of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: ji ltar na khyad par du gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na khyad par du gyur pa zhe na /
translated: How is it superior?

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi shes rab ni 'das pa'i dus kyi sems can rnams kyi rigs dang pha ma dang gnyen nas dgra'i bar du dran te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi shes rab ni 'das pa'i dus kyi sems can rnams kyi rigs dang pha ma dang gnyen nas dgra'i bar du dran te /
translated: The wisdom of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas remembers the families, parents, relatives, up to the enemies of sentient beings in the past.

original: rigs dang / gnyen dang / dgra'i mtshan nyid skyed do //
analyzed: rigs dang / gnyen dang / dgra'i mtshan nyid skyed do //
translated: It produces the characteristics of family, relatives, and enemies.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Bodhisattvas are not like that.
